title: Narrative Change Researcher - Transformative Research Unit f...
desc:
The Transformative Research Unit for Equity (TRUE) is a research center with an interdisciplinary team of scholars and changemakers focused on the policies, practices, systems, and narratives that maintain historic or contemporary inequities among marginalized and minoritized groups and communities.
We are looking for a Narrative Change Researcher to join our Narrative Research and Community Engagement Lab (The Lab). The Lab’s purpose is to engage communities in research and co-create equity centered stories that will change current narratives and foster a most just and inclusive society. The NRCE lab sits within TRUE but will also collaborate across RTI as well as externally with community organizations, academic partners, and social justice artists to research, develop, and test new narratives.


Position Summary:
RTI is seeking a highly experienced, innovative narrative change researcher, that is a data-driven storyteller, visual thinker and strategist for this position. Narrative change research is a new offering at RTI, therefore this candidate must be visionary, that is solution-oriented with a proven track record of contributing to the field.


Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Collaborate with the Narrative Research Lead within the lab and other researchers within TRUE to develop equity centered narrative change research opportunities.
Lead and support proposal development
Collaborate with academic partners
Center equity in every aspect of narrative change and community engagement.
Develop, write and test new narrative messaging within narrative change frameworks.
Create thought leadership content (blogs, whitepapers, videos) about Narrative Change.
Develop and write communication tools including messaging guides, toolkits, whitepapers, policy briefs and digital content based on research findings and project needs.
Contribute to the development of workshops and training curriculum.


Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree and at least 8 years of experience working with inter-disciplinary teams (web, design, video, copy, subject matter experts, researchers) to create narrative campaigns or story driven assets to engage a key audience.
Professional experience that demonstrates a commitment for equity and social justice.
Experience creating strategic roadmaps.
Strong ability to collaborate with other researchers and community members.
Demonstrated experience in the field of narrative change research and storytelling.
Excellent written, oral, and visual communication skills.
Experience using communication and narrative change research methodologies, conducting both qualitative and quantitative research.
Experience developing proposals and obtaining funding.
Creative problem solver.
To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.


Highly Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in visual design, documentary filmmaking or creative writing.
Experience evaluating and measuring narrative change efforts.

The anticipated pay range for this role is listed below. Our pay ranges represent national averages and may vary by location as a geographic differential may be applied to some locations within the United States.

RTI considers multiple factors when making an offer including, for example: established salary range, internal budget, business needs, and education and years of work experience possessed by the applicant. Further, salary is merely one element to our offer.

At RTI, we demonstrate our commitment to rewarding individual and team achievement through a total rewards package. This package includes (among other things) a competitive base salary, a generous paid time off policy, merit based annual increases, bonus opportunities and a robust recognition program. Other benefits include a competitive range of insurance plans (including health, dental, life, and short-term and long-term disability), access to a retirement savings program such as a 401(k) plan, paid parental leave for all parents, financial assistance with adoption expenses or infertility treatments, financial reimbursement for education and developmental opportunities, an employee assistance program, and numerous other offerings to support a healthy work-life balance.

title: Transitions Care Manager
desc:
Transitions Care Manager
Chapel Hill Community Health Center
(Bilingual in Spanish and English - Required )
Full Time Benefit Eligible

JOB SUMMARY

The Transitions Care Manager position is a hybrid position focused on transitional care management, linkage to care, and navigation as well as on site care management within a primary care setting. This care manager provides outreach and navigation for individuals transitioning from acute care facility back to the community and primary care, including work with existing patients of the primary care practice, and those identified by staff of acute care facilities as lacking a primary care home and needing connection to primary care (e.g., the UNC/PHS Carolina Health Net Program). The Care Manager will assess needs, barriers and provide care coordination to meet individual patient needs. The care manager will provide support and expertise to the clinic team via assessment, planning, and implementation of the care plan. The Care Manager promotes patient-centered and team-based care through effective communication with patients, the care management team, medical team, acute care facility, and center staff. The Care Manager promotes continuity of care through support in navigating the health system, initiating and following up on referrals, providing outreach to patients through population health efforts, providing patient education and addressing high need concerns of medically complex patients. The Care Manager is responsible for resource identification, periodic reports, accessing acute care facility reports and addressing any gaps or needs identified. Independent critical thinking skills and decision making is necessary in this position.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree required, in a healthcare related field is preferred. (nursing, public health or social work)
One to two years nursing, case management, or social work experience preferred.
Bilingual Required

PATIENT POPULATION SERVED

Pediatric, Adolescent, Adult, Geriatric, Prenatal. Diverse population including but not limited to chronically ill and limited English speaking
patients.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/ WORKING CONDITIONS

Extended periods of walking, standing, and extended periods of sitting. Performance of essential duties requires close and distance vision, hearing
acuity, dexterity and stamina. Clinical environment with exposure to chemicals, pathogens and patient body fluids. Ability to work under stressful
conditions. Ability to multitask. Adaptability to change assignments unexpectedly. Must have a personal vehicle for transportation between sites
and to other community networks within our service area. Participation in training sessions outside of PHS. Requires moderate computer skills
and use of other office equipment.

office equipment.

title: Store Operations Specialist
desc:
Company Description

Jobs for Humanity is dedicated to building an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we have dedicated this job posting to individuals coming from the following communities: Refugee, Neurodivergent, Single Parent, Blind or Low Vision, Ethnic Minority, and the Previously Incarcerated. Company Name: Spectrum

Job Description

JOB SUMMARY
The Spectrum Store Operations Specialist is responsible for providing support in managing, planning, and implementing key projects from conception through completion. Evaluates and executes store management processes and templates. Compiles metrics relating to operational project success, project attributes, individual productivity and adherence to defined processes. Collects and analyzes data to prepare various reports covering project status, expense tracking, project metrics and other project management related reports. Coordinates data collection and communication between Charter and its vendors to successfully drive project efforts.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Supports implementing process improvements, project administration, planning, managing and monitoring major projects from concept through implementation. Ensures positive experience for our internal/external customers by maintaining the integrity of store operating procedures.

Serves as a resource to store management to educate and assist with implementing operational project management processes and making improvement/changes.
Maintains constant awareness of all operational policy and procedure changes, and assists store management in communicating changes to store employees through proper communication channels.
Attends project meetings prepares/collects meeting notes for distribution.

Provides project expense tracking and ensures project expenses are charged correctly. Works closely with finance team on project reconciliations.

Plans, manages and monitors minor projects from concept through implementation.

Prepares a variety of reports covering project status, expense status, project metrics and other management reports as needed.
Partners with internal and external parties to organize the various components needed to initiate, run and conclude major projects, ensuring they are running smoothly.
Coordinates schedules, activities and administrative details; assists with coordination of purchasing, procurement and maintenance agreements as needed; places orders for supplies and services, and tracks progress and results for projects.

Performs other duties as requested by Manager.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
Ability to read, write and speak the English language to communicate with employees, company management, and customers, in person, on the phone, and by written communications in a clear, straight-forward, and professional manner
Ability to assist with the management of diverse and strategic projects
Basic understanding of project budgets
Basic understanding of implementing project plans, monitoring progress, resource usage and quality measurements
Basic knowledge of process and project management disciplines
Ability to coordinate cross-functional communications among multiple teams
Ability to utilize key performance indicators/metrics
Ability to make decisions and solve problems while working under pressure
Ability to contribute to multiple projects at one time
Knowledge of personal computer and software application skills (i.e. Word processing, spreadsheet, Visio, Project, etc.)
Knowledge of broadband products and services preferred

Education
Bachelor's degree or related field or equivalent work experience

Related Work Experience
2+ years: Demonstrated project management experience
3+ years: Business process management experience
3+ years: Business work experience

WORKING CONDITIONS
Office environment
Travel required, up to 50%

title: Senior Support Consultant - Fully Remote
desc:
Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
This is a fully remote position.
Job Summary

Provides product application support to clients via the telephone and/or Internet (e.g., instant message, email). Assesses nature of product or service issues and resolves support problems through independent judgment and advanced troubleshooting skills.

Essential Functions
Possesses sound knowledge of organization's software products
Follows all Standard Operating Procedures SOP's (i.e. Patient Safety and Compliance)
Diagnoses and resolves client application questions or problems over the telephone/Internet in the areas of product functionality, system configuration/setup and bugs/enhancements.
Tracks and documents inbound support requests and ensures proper notation of client problems or issues
Documents problems and solutions to train lower-level support on how to properly address client or product problems
Maintains a log (SNOW) of issues and conveys client feedback regarding issues and collaborates with product development staff, via problem record or issue case to improve on current design or to identify possible problems with design
Stays abreast of current software releases, design changes, and new software products offered
Works directly with clients on application issues related to special expertise and is often chosen by management to handle SEV1/Critical cases in the area of expertise
Acts as a mentor for the team, guiding more junior staff in terms of how to manage client issues n his/her area of expertise
Acts as the go-to person for that specific area of expertise for other team members
Works directly with 3rd party vendors and cross functionally internally
Develops knowledge content
Performs root cause analysis in his/her area of expertise and suggests to leadership potential billable cases
Escalation duties as needed, assigned by leadership
Serves to drive a client-centric approach to operations while emphasizing cross-functional cooperation within the organization
Job Requirements
Bachelor's Degree (Preferred)
2-5 years relevant work experience (Preferred)
ITIL ITIL Foundations (Preferred)
Must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for employment with Allscripts.
Visa Sponsorship is not offered for this position.
At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 postacute organizations across the globe. Allscripts offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including holidays, vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, company paid life insurance and retirement savings.
Allscripts' policy is to provide equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in all of its employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for North American based positions with Allscripts must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada. Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. Allscripts is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursing and hiring a diverse and inclusive workforce.

title: Peer Support Specialist
desc:
Job Title: Peer Support Specialist
Group: Behavioral Health Programs
Department: Healthy Opportunities Program (HOP, NC)
Region: NC
Location: Columbus County and surrounding area
Classification: Exempt
Status: Full Time
Reports to: Program Coordinator
Supervises: N/A
Travel Requirement: Telework Capacity and travel in the NC Region, as needed.
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Volunteers of America Chesapeake & Carolinas empowers self-reliance and inspires hope. As a church without walls, we do this through personalized housing, ministry, health, and human services that benefit vulnerable individuals, their families and the community. Founded in 1896 in Baltimore, MD by social reformers, Ballington and Maud Booth, we were one of the first of over 30 affiliates of Volunteers of America one of the nations largest and most comprehensive human services organizations.
Our founders envisioned a movement dedicated to reaching and uplifting the American people. On behalf of the organization, the Booths pledged to go wherever we are needed, and do whatever comes to hand. Their declaration continues to guide Volunteers of America's impact on Helping Americas most vulnerable.
Through a dedicated and committed team of more than 850 employees and thousands of volunteers, we provide critical care, support services and hope to thousands of people each year throughout Virginia, Maryland, the District of Columbia and the Carolinas. We firmly believe our employees drive the success of the organization. Through our diversity, equity and inclusion efforts, we endeavor to attract, engage and retain qualified, diverse, compassionate individuals to join our journey and experience a work environment that offers challenging, stimulating and financially rewarding opportunities.
JOB SUMMARY
As the key Human Services Organization (HSO), VOACC will provide housing navigation support and sustaining services in Bladen, Pender, and Columbus counties in NC. The Peer Support Specialist is responsible to provide peer support and/or educational services to prepare and support an individual for stable, long term independent housing.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop a good rapport and relationships with program participants
Develop relationships with outside vendors and other stakeholders to assist individuals with the resources needed to achieve housing independence
Assist with data collection and reporting requirements
Report concerns to case manager/Program Coordinator when indicated
Assist the case manager with identifying housing preferences and needs
Assist the case manager with connecting the individual to social services to assist with locating housing necessary to support meeting medical care needs
Assist the case manager with assisting individuals to complete housing applications
Assist the case manager with assisting the individuals to complete a housing support/crisis plan to support independent living in their own home
Assist the individuals to support the follow through and achievement of the goals defined in their housing plan
Assist the case manager with providing housing move in support which include assisting the individual with non-recurring set up expenses
Assist the case manager with providing essential utility set up which is a non-recurring set up cost for essential habitable housing
Assist the case manager with setting up home remediation services
Assist the case manager with securing home accessibility and safety modifications as well as healthy home goods
Perform other duties as assigned
EFFECT ON END RESULT:
Program participants are provided timely and effective assistance in the evaluation of their immediate and long-term housing needs.
Provides empathy and support to engage and encourage vulnerable clients.
Helps provide a safe and supportive environment for clients.
Maintains a positive image in the local and professional communities.
Ensures compliance with agency, Federal, State and local laws and regulations and funding source requirements.
Maintains accurate and current data collection.
Requirements
A Bachelors degree in a Human Services or related field.
Certification as a Housing Peer Support Specialist or similar credential is preferred, but not required.
Experience required in communication, peer support, care coordination, case management, motivational interviewing, advocacy, and have social service connections where applicable.
Familiarity with the Housing First model, housing/homeless is desired.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
The physical requirements described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential duties of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.
The ability to safely operate a motor vehicle to transport oneself, consumers, and program supplies as necessary.
The physical ability to travel to assigned locations, stand, stoop, bend, reach, pull, push, lift, grasp, climb, talk, see, hear and perform basic and light home maintenance activities, and operate office equipment.
Operating office equipment requiring continuous or repetitive hand/arm movements.
The ability to remain in a sitting position for extended periods of time
OTHER DUTIES:
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

title: DISCHARGE CALL SPECIALIST - PATIENT RELATIONS
desc:
Work Type: FULL TIME
Work Schedule: DAYS
Location: BLADEN COUNTY HOSPITAL LLC
Position Summary:

Make telephone contact with patients within 24-72 hours of discharge to evaluate patient experience including the patient’s perception of readiness for discharge, understanding/compliance with discharge instructions and overall impression of hospital performance. Identify trends that may require improvements in practice. Serve as a super-user in providing support for new discharge callers and existing decentralized discharge callers to use the Discharge Call Manager software. Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Bi-lingual preferred. Incumbent must possess a minimum of two (2) years experience to include, but not limited to customer service, public speaking, cultural competency training and administrative support. It is preferable that this experience is in a position which requires a high level of organization, multi-tasking and customer service. Having knowledge in Healthcare is desirable and the incumbent must type accurately at 50 wpm. It is essential that the incumbent possess strong interpersonal skills, phone skills, listening skills, and a preference for interacting with others, negotiating and problem solving. The ability to learn quickly and adapt calmly to changing situations is vital to the success of the position. Working knowledge of computer hardware and proficiency in software including databases, spreadsheets, graphics and word processing is necessary. Communicating with people from various professions and backgrounds with tact and diplomacy is mandatory. Having a willingness to learn and provide creative input is essential.

Required Education, Licenses, and Certifications:
High School Diploma or GED


Preferred Education, Licenses, and Certifications:
Bachelor's Degree
Business Administration, Education, or related field.
Other Information:
There are a number of deadlines associated with this position, Many hours will be spent in intense concentration require attention to detail and high levels of accuracy. Speaking, hearing and visual acuity required. Long periods of sitting at a desk are required. Motor coordination and finger dexterity required for computer work.


About Cape Fear Valley Health System
For exceptional healthcare come to Cape Fear Valley Health System - where caring employees are committed to integrity, patient-centeredness and excellence throughout the entire healthcare process. At Cape Fear Valley Health System, our goal is to improve the quality of every life we touch. To achieve that, our Fayetteville doctors, surgeons and staff are committed to excellence in every aspect of the healthcare process. Our values of patient-centeredness, integrity, innovation, teamwork, diversity and accountability help us create a better experience for every patient, every time. At Cape Fear Valley, our employees and physicians proudly serve a seven-county region of southeastern North Carolina, including Fayetteville, Fort Bragg, Hope Mills, Raeford, Lumberton, Elizabethtown, Clinton, Lillington, Dunn, and beyond. Our medical facilities include Cape Fear Valley Medical Center, Highsmith-Rainey Specialty Hospital, Cape Fear Valley Rehabilitation Center, Behavioral Health Care, Bladen County Hospital, Hoke Hospital, Central Harnett Hospital, Betsy Johnson Hospital, as well as several medical offices and specialty clinics spread throughout the Cape Fear region. Our newest clinic is the Stephen A. Cohen Military Family Clinic at Cape Fear Valley. It offers comprehensive mental healthcare, at no or low-cost, to area veterans and their families coping with the invisible wounds of war.
Screening Requirements: Drug Screen, Background Check, License and Employment reference verification.

Cape Fear Valley Health System is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Program Coordinator I
salary:
Job details
Salary
$32,703 - $51,904 a year
Job Type
Full-time
desc:
Salary Grade: GN07 Salary Range: $32,703 - $51,904

This position is located in the Charlotte IRP office.

This position provides customer-friendly, patient, courteous, and informative services to the general public and IRP customers. This position assists with customer facing IRP customers, completing the correct documents needed for opening new accounts and for executing renewals. This position assists IRP customers with filing equipment supplements, updating insurance, turning in tags, collecting payments for 2290’s (Federal Heavy Use Tax), confirming 2290 payments, collecting payments for renewals and new accounts, issuing Apportioned and For Hire tags and stickers, updating name changes for individuals and for business entities, and transferring plates and/or titles. This position explains the mandatory proof of residency requirements to customers. This position thoroughly reviews all residency documents to detect fraudulent or altered materials. This position contacts utility companies to verify proof of residency. This position reviews lease agreements and insurance certifications to make sure that they are compliant with IRP requirements, and follow-up with return customers who did not have all of their required documents initially. This position responds to telephone and facsimile inquiries from customers, insurance companies, the general public, and motor carrier authorities. This position processes incoming mail and responds to renewal packets and submitted payments. This position reviews the websites of North Carolina Secretary of State, Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration, and Safety and Fitness Electronic Records and cross-referencing the USDOT and Motor Carrier numbers. This position requires responding to customer inquiries regarding Unified Carrier Reg (UCR) and International Fuel Tax Agreement (IFTA) and providing them with the contact information that they will need for said matters. This position maintains a detailed and accurate accounting of all cash, credit/debit card, money order, and check transactions. This position balances and reconciles a cash drawer at the end of every workday. This position conducts all title work and all other transactions pursuant to the Motor Vehicle General Statutes, DMV rules and regulations, and the Privacy Protection Act. This position receives, and reviews in-state and out-of-state finance packages that are utilized by IRP customers to purchase/lease motor vehicles.

To perform the above-stated tasks and responsibilities, this position requires technical and administrative skills, and an extensive knowledge of the North Carolina General Statutes, policies, procedures, and regulations that govern the issuance of a North Carolina title, as well as other credentials.

The program area for this position includes International Registration Plan Unit, vehicle title and registration, DMV customer service, applying and/or explaining Motor Vehicle General Statutes and DMV rules and regulations.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities / Competencies
Qualified Applicants must submit an application that clearly reflects work experience that demonstrates the following:

Experience with Microsoft applications and/or mainframe databases.
Experience in broad customer service dealing with a diverse clientele explaining information of considerable detail as it relates to laws, rules, and regulations.
Experience in analyzing, interpreting, and/or evaluating information or data.
Experience reviewing information to determine compliance with applicable laws, rules or regulations to resolve a complex or special processing matter.
Experience in balancing a cash drawer

Minimum Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor's degree from an appropriately accredited institution; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.

title: Divisional Scheduler, Brenner Children's Hospital, Pediatric...
desc:
JOB SUMMARY:
Provides efficient and accurate administrative support and project leadership for compliance and scheduling for division. Provides daily administrative support including oversight and facilitation of confidential information and global oversight of schedules, schedule management, and schedule monitoring. Serves as the key departmental point of contact for the nurse managers and staff with regard to scheduling needs, revisions, and obstacles. Focuses on optimizing schedules and employee coverage for multiple units within a large nursing division. Monitors scheduled activity across multiple units as well as assist the nurse managers with other tasks such as rounding, safety checks and other duties as assigned. Oversees administrative, operational and business processes and special projects for the division.
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's degree preferred; or, an equivalent combination of relevant education and/or experience. Strong background in computer spreadsheet systems.
LICENSURE, CERTIFICATION, and/or REGISTRATION:
N/A
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Supervises and coordinates various personnel functions including continual monitoring and assessment of departmental schedules including balancing, swaps and management of BTO requests.
Reviews and revises schedules to optimize staff efficiency, and unit coverage. Anticipates multiple workflows and prepares accordingly.
Utilizes ClairVia scheduling module and email for scheduling and documentation purposes.
Follows divisional policies and procedures to assure accuracy of schedules.
Ensures coordination of staffing coverage and flow of information by promptly communicating with internal and external sources.
Prepares detailed analysis of staffing and census levels for individual units to identify shift-by-shift and week-to-week trends in order to justify position requests for additional staffing. Reports key indicators and critical success factors related to staffing, which are necessary to benchmark performance and monitor nursing unit resources.
Works within multiple spreadsheet systems to ensure budgetary metrics are met for the individual unit as well as the divisional whole for staffing costs.
Supports regulatory compliance needs for surveying bodies such as The Joint Commission (TJC) and CMS. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to; medication refrigerator log monitoring, corridor cleanliness, and completion of safety walks.
Contributes to the success of the department by assisting in the development and implementation of methods to improve unit efficiency and customer service.
Coordinates events for unit and division as assigned. Serves as a courteous, prompt contact for staff and leadership.
SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS:
Understanding of inpatient nursing needs
Proficient Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Professional handling of exposure to confidential/sensitive information
Ability to multitask
Ability to remain positive in demanding situations
Knowledge of purchasing and inventory control
Ability to develop and maintain professional, service oriented relationships with staff, management, co-workers, and supervisors

title: Diversity Compliance Specialist
salary:
Job details
Salary
$45,566 a year
Job Type
Full-time
desc:
Description
Under general supervision, performs complex professional and administrative work in implementing the City's Minority and Woman-owned Business Enterprise (M/WBE) Program.

Examples of Duties
Monitors the program to ensure compliance with local, state, and federal laws.
Monitors program activities to ensure compliance with City Council directives.
Serves as staff support to the M/WBE Citizen's Advisory Committee.
Attends pre-bid and bid opening meetings.
Assists with investigating and reporting on the good faith efforts made by contractors to comply with the contractual M/WBE participation numbers.
Manages the City's M/WBE Vendor Listing database to ensure accuracy for internal and external users.
Analyzes statistical data and prepares various reports on M/WBE participation in procurement contracts for commodities, professional services as well as contracts relating to construction, repair work and/or leasing activities.
Collaborates with community resources to develop and implement meaningful programs that enhance relations between M/WBE firms and majority-owned firms.
Actively seeks out M/WBE firms to participate in city contracting opportunities.
Assists contractors and vendors in obtaining M/WBE participation.
Prepares and delivers presentations to groups regarding the M/WBE program.
Typical Qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The
requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable
accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Knowledge of economic development finance tools and analysis; knowledge of the federal, state and local regulations
relating to minority and female subcontractors on various projects; ability to gain knowledge of all functions, organizations, staffing and operating procedures of all City operations; ability to communicate ideas, explanations and recommendations clearly both orally and in writing; ability to exercise independent judgment to apply facts and principals for developing approaches and techniques to problem resolution; ability to use various office equipment and software programs; ability to exercise judgment, decisiveness and creativity in situations involving the evaluation of information against subjective criteria, as opposed to that which is clearly measurable or verifiable; ability to work independently and plan, organize and prioritize work tasks; ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with citizens and business owners, boards and commissions, City Council, City staff, and developers and work with the public in a positive manner.

Education and Experience
Bachelor's degree with coursework in Business Administration, or related field and moderate experience with
Compliance, Audits, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Physical Requirements
This work requires the occasional exertion of up to 10 pounds of force; work regularly requires sitting, speaking or
hearing and using hands to finger, handle or feel and occasionally requires standing and walking; work has standard
vision requirements; vocal communication is required for expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word;
hearing is required to perceive information at normal spoken word levels and to receive detailed information through
oral communications and/or to make fine distinctions in sound; work requires preparing and analyzing written or
computer data and observing general surroundings and activities; work occasionally requires working near moving
mechanical parts; work is generally in a moderately noisy location (e.g. business office, light traffic).

title: K12 Program Assistant
salary:
Job details
Salary
$40,135 - $41,000 a year
Job Type
Full-time
desc:
About the Opportunity
The primary purpose of the K12 Program Assistant position is to provide day-to-day program support for the three K12 scholarship grant programs: the Children with Disabilities Grant, the Opportunity Scholarship, and the Personal Education Savings Account. Responsibilities include: planning and delivering a variety of administrative services for both programs, including overseeing processing functions, providing customer service and communicating program information, policies, and procedures to parents of students, nonpublic school officials, and other stakeholders, planning and organizing activities related to applications, documentation, and disbursement of funds, maintaining records and preparing data for review, and problem-solving process and procedural issues.
This position may be eligible for a hybrid or remote work arrangement, consistent with System Office policy. The North Carolina State Education Assistance Authority (NCSEAA) employees are generally required to reside in North Carolina, within a 2-hour commuting distance of their assigned duty station.
About the NC State Education Assistance Authority
NCSEAA, an agency of the State of North Carolina, is authorized by the General Assembly to plan, finance and administer postsecondary student financial assistance programs of a statewide or inter-institutional nature. It serves students attending public and private two- and four-year colleges and universities in North Carolina. The Guaranty Agency and Repayment Services Division provides default aversion assistance to borrowers, reviews and processes lender claims, initiates collection activities, and resolves outstanding balances of borrowers with defaulted educational loan debts under the Federal Family Educational Loan Program (FFELP) and loans under various State of North Carolina educational loan programs. The division also administers the servicing and collection of loans in the State's various forgivable loan programs and oversees the State's centralized Residency Determination Service.
About the Team
The Grants, Training and Outreach Division administers over 30 aid programs awarding over $350 million to approximately 150,000 K12 and college students each year. The Division also conducts FAFSA outreach programs to educate and assist North Carolina students and families with paying for college and offers training programs for financial aid professionals and school counselors
Minimum Education, Experience, and Skills
Graduation from high school diploma or equivalency and one year of related office experience; or equivalent combination of training and experience.
Preferred Education, Experience, and Skills
Bachelor's degree and minimum of one year of relevant experience working in customer service and program administration using a database system in a government setting.

To claim veteran's preference, all eligible persons must indicate their eligibility as requested on the application. A DD Form 214, Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty, may be required later in the selection process.

title: Care Connections Business Associate
salary:
Job details
Job Type
Full-time
PRN
desc:
Overview:
As part of the Care Connection team servicing consumers interested in Novant Health services, the Associate is responsible for ensuring a positive consumer experience by communicating with consumers by telephone and web based platforms and navigating consumers to the proper level of care and resolution upon initial contact. Serves as a resource to both consumers and team members. Responsible for identifying source of payment and interfacing with appropriate consumers. Responsible for both administrative and clerical support to the department, either as part of a team or individually to ensure operational effectiveness. Must possess critical thinking and analytical skills to assess consumer’s needs and explore all relevant engagement touch point opportunities between consumer and Novant Health, ensuring needs are met through the most appropriate channel. Serves as ambassador for the Novant Health Brand. Demonstrates the service standard “know me” through leveraging consumer contact history and collecting additional information through each new interaction. Demonstrates knowledge of Novant Health system and service offerings to connect consumer to the right service, at the right time at the right place.

At Novant Health, one of our core values is diversity and inclusion. By engaging the strengths and talents of each team member, we ensure a strong organization capable of providing remarkable healthcare to our patients, families and communities. Therefore, we invite applicants from all group dynamics to apply to our exciting career opportunities.
Qualifications:
Education: High School Diploma, Required. Bachelor's Degree, Preferred.
Experience: Minimum one year of experience in customer service and one year of healthcare experience, Required.
Additional Skills Required:
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills using “remarkable” customer skills, possesses experience and competency in customer relation skills in a professional environment.
Ability to organize and prioritize work in a stressful environment.
Detail oriented with excellent time management skills.
Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills.
Above average computer proficiency and ability to multi-task, working on multiple internet platforms while conversing with a consumer.
Ability to assertively recommend appropriate care based on your professional training.
Team player who is positive and self-motivated. High level of integrity.
Basic medical terminology.
Ability to use a variety of software packages, such as Microsoft Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, Access, etc., to produce correspondence and documents and maintain presentations, records, spreadsheets and databases.
Ability to successfully complete generic and department-specific skills validation and competency testing.
Possess demonstrated knowledge of insurance plans and coordination of benefits, registration processes, collection and cash receipting in compliance with regulatory standards, emergency codes and appropriate responses, and applicable federal and state healthcare regulations.
Responsibilities:
It is the responsibility of every Novant Health team member to deliver the most remarkable patient experience in every dimension, every time.
Our team members are part of an environment that fosters team work, team member engagement and community involvement.
The successful team member has a commitment to leveraging diversity and inclusion in support of quality care.
All Novant Health team members are responsible for fostering a safe patient environment driven by the principles of "First Do No Harm".

title: Senior Research Associate
desc:
Overview
Job Summary
Collects, enters and analyzes research data. Provides reports using computerized databases and information systems. Prepares reports from requests from the director, faculty, study sponsor, and outside collaborators. Designs, implements, and evaluates request using databases as information source.
Completes tasks and/or requests as a project manager, data manager/collector, protocol writer, grant writer, manuscript writer, and assist with certain data or laboratory analysis regarding department research projects.

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or health-related field required
Associates Degree with equivalent work experience will be considered.
Training in information systems technologies, desktop application, and databases required.
Experience with analytical software and database analysis and reports preferred.
Essential Functions
Maintains designated applications in research department databases.
Creates new databases, prepares and runs data analysis queries, and uploads local database to the national database center.
Uses existing database to create reports as requested.
Performs data manipulation and migration.
Reviews data quality reports for data submissions and errors.
Ensures data requests are received, have authorizations, are evaluated, and reported.
Prepares specifications and summary reports for data queries and requests.
Performs chart abstraction.
Provides administrative support when needed.
Physical Requirements

Work consistently requires sitting for 5-6 hours. Intact senses of sight, hearing, smell, touch, and manual dexterity. Each employee has the responsibility to work in a safe manner.

salary:
Job details

$41,954 - $54,538 a year

Full-time
desc:
Description
The Marketing Coordinator will perform professional work, public information, and marketing work; duties include developing and implementing marketing of recreation programs and events utilizing brochures, flyers, website information, media, and other mechanisms.

This position involves some weekend and evening hours.

Work is performed independently under general supervision.
Examples of Duties
Oversees coordinated marketing efforts for all programs and events of the Parks, Recreation, and Cultural Resources department.
In coordination with direct supervisor and senior leadership team, develop and update annual marketing plan to promote the department’s programs and special events, defining the appropriate strategies and tactics to reach the multiple audiences served by the department.
Establishes and maintains the department’s social media presence, ensuring adherence to professional standards and Town’s Social Media Policy; monitor multiple social media pages to ensure information is consistent and professionally presented; advise other department staff on the best use of social media.
Designs promotional materials for the events and programs; composes materials and edits information from others for marketing documents; assures consistent look for materials; reviews and approves marketing and communication materials developed by colleagues to ensure they meet the department’s brand and graphic standards.
Oversee the development of the departmental brochure 2 to 3 times a year;
Create flyers, e-blasts, news releases, brochures, commercials, posters, newspaper ads and inserts to advertise programs and events, following graphic standards and maintaining a cohesive brand for the department.
Works with IT department to maintain departmental website information and manage web-based content management system.
Assists Communications Manager with media relations, especially concerning departmental special events;
Prepares reports, correspondence and evaluations; assists with budget preparation and finances; keeps records of all expenses and monitors budget allocations;
Keeps current on advertising contracts; works with printers and other contractors as required to fulfill the marketing strategies of the department;
Serves as a point of contact with the various media organizations for recreation events;
Attends camp, job and health fairs, and other community events to promote departmental programs;
Works with outside organizations such as newspapers, community calendars, and websites to list programs and events;
Maintains accurate inventory of supplies; inspects inventory for proper condition and safety;
Prepares and maintains proper files and records;
Works on special projects as assigned such as new departmental campaigns, new programs, and accreditation process;
Performs related duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications
Applicants must possess a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in Marketing, Public Relations, Graphic Design, Recreation Administration, Public Administration, Business Administration, or related field.
Applicants must possess an appropriate driver's license valid in the State of North Carolina.

Applicants must be proficient with Desktop Publishing (Adobe Creative Suites) and MS Office.

CPR/First Aid certification must be obtained within 6 months of hire. Training will be provided for the selected candidate if needed.

Three (3) or more years of experience in planning, marketing, promotions, graphic design, website management, sponsorships, and advertisements related to special events and recreation programming strongly preferred.
Additional Information
The salary range shown is the hiring range.

This position is open until filled and may close at any time.

Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Manager, Training Delivery ( In- Center)
desc:
Company Description

Jobs for Humanity is dedicated to building an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we have dedicated this job posting to individuals coming from the following communities: Refugee, Neurodivergent, Single Parent, Blind or Low Vision, Ethnic Minority, and the Previously Incarcerated. If you identify with any of the following communities do not hesitate to register, even if you feel that this particular opportunity is not the right fit for you.

Company Name: Spectrum

Job Description

JOB SUMMARY
The Spectrum Training Delivery Manager is responsible for managing the consistent implementation and delivery of training and performance improvements. Work to assess and execute strategies relating to trends, opportunities and training needs. Measure and evaluate the effectiveness of training programs.
MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner with the Senior Management on curriculum reviews and additional training requirements.
Work closely with the Senior Management to assess performance, identify gaps and key drivers, and recommend training solutions and other related strategies for enhancing performance.
Work with managers to ensure successful implementation of the training curriculum and Leadership Development curriculum.
Define business and performance objectives for all relevant training initiatives.
Assess student performance during training, and thereafter, to provide relevant coaching and development.
Measure and evaluate the effectiveness of training in achieving desired outcomes.
Partner with peer training managers on shared queue responsibilities.
Keep abreast of current learning and performance strategies, delivery methods, and techniques.
Determine implementation plans, schedules, resource needs, and supporting logistics for delivery of training initiatives.
Manage external resources, as needed, to maximize cost effectiveness and quality.
Facilitate training from time to time.
Perform other duties as required.

Ability to communicate orally and in writing in a clear and straightforward manner
Ability to communicate with all levels of executive, management and company personnel
Ability to deal with the public in a professional manner

Ability to manage multiple projects to meet target dates for implementation

Ability to prioritize and organize effectively
Ability to show judgment and initiative and to accomplish job duties

Fast paced office environment
Travel as required

title: ADMINISTRATIVE ANALYST
salary:
Job details
Salary
$54,661 - $72,418 a year
Job Type
Full-time
desc:
Summary
The purpose of this analyst position is to assist with managing the strategic planning, fiscal, analytical, and reporting functions of the Public Works Department; providing advanced analysis, research, and reporting with implications for decision-making; assist with developing and managing the annual departmental budget; assist with developing and evaluating strategic plans and performance management programs; and managing high-interest projects and special initiatives from start to finish, including policy development and implementation, operational reviews, cross-departmental teams, and system improvements.
Essential Functions
Conducts quantitative and qualitative analysis of complex budget, financial, employee, and operational datasets for problem solving using financial administration system software and work order systems; conducts research and analyzes information to identify trends, takeaways, and action steps; prepares detailed written reports, graphs, visuals, and dashboards; makes conclusions and recommendations to ensure quality, data driven decision-making; communicates interpretations, findings, and recommendations to executive leadership.
Assists the Public Works management team in coordinating the fiscal operations of the department; provides support in preparing and monitoring the department's annual operating and capital budgets; conducts complex financial analyses with implications for department operations and policy development; and prepares fiscal-year end closing and related reports.
Monitors and supports performance management initiatives: monitors benchmarks and performance measures and reports progress to management; and assists division managers in considering operational improvements based on evaluation of performance measures and benchmarks to foster organizational change and improvement.
Assists in coordinating personnel operations of the department; reviews and assists managers with departmental recruiting, selection procedures and hiring recommendations; reviews documentation of employee sanctions and disciplinary actions to ensure compliance with departmental applicable regulations and policies.
Communicates across all levels of the organization and externally, including developing communications and stakeholder management plans; organizing and presenting information to various stakeholders; providing facilitation and consensus-building on diverse teams; preparing and providing guidance on high-level reports and correspondence to the Town Council; corresponding with residents regarding complex questions, complaints, and requests; and preparing written materials and delivering presentations as assigned.
Collaborates with the Town’s Emergency Management Team and other local and federal agencies to lead efforts in emergency preparedness and response during inclement weather, adverse and special events; and develops operational procedures.
Provides administrative support to management; performs special assignments and special projects as needed.
Performs other duties as required.
*
SUPERVISION EXERCISED*
Monitoring work performance by program support employees.
*
PHYSICAL DEMANDS*
The work is typically performed while sitting at a desk or table, standing or stooping. The employee may occasionally lift light objects.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
The work is typically performed in an office environment.
Minimum Qualifications
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
An equivalent combination of education and experience that would provide the required knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the duties of the job.
KNOWLEDGE OF:
Research methods, analysis, and report preparation
Principles and methods of program evaluation, performance management, process design, and strategic planning
Governmental accounting standards and audit standards for state and local government units
Accounting principles and practices, including budget preparation, cost analysis, and inventory control
Contract administration principles
Relevant state, federal, and local laws
Principles of business and persuasive writing
Town and department policies and procedures
ABILITY TO:
*
Synthesize complex, technical information and communicate effectively orally and in writing
Demonstrate strong interpersonal awareness and skills
Meet multiple deadlines and manage changing priorities
Analyze complex and confidential issues and draw logical conclusions
Ability to use financial administration software and work order systems
Prepare and present clear and concise reports, presentations, and visual tools
Develop policies and procedures
Collect, compile, and analyze information and data
Work with advanced mathematical operations
Organize and maintain accurate records
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with others
Work independently and in a team environment
Follow rules of confidentiality
Learn proprietary government software
Use a personal computer, various word processing and database software applications, and develop and navigate complex documents and spreadsheets
Model the Town’s values of RESPECT
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Any combination of education and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities to perform the duties of this job.
Education
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, or a related field. Master’s degree preferred, but not required.
Experience
Three years of experience performing professional level administrative duties. Experience in the public sector preferred, but not required.
Licenses/ Certifications
Possession of a valid driver's license issued by the State of North Carolina or the ability to readily obtain one.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $54,661.00 - $72,418.00 per year

title: Compliance Associate (Remote)
desc:
Coleman Research Group is a leading global expert network and primary research company serving investment management firms, management consultancies, hedge funds, mutual funds, and private equity firms, assisting with their due diligence and investment research processes. Our network of roughly 250,000 professionals provides expertise and insights on industries ranging from healthcare to technology to retail and beyond. We connect clients and experts via phone and in-person consultations, conference events and custom surveys. Headquartered in New York City, with offices in Hong Kong, London, Raleigh and Los Angeles our 200+ employees collaborate across the globe to meet our client needs.

CRG is currently seeking a Compliance Associate to assist the Compliance team with the following:

Monitoring and taking action real-time on compliance controls applicable to the Company's business
Administering the Company's Compliance Program through our proprietary software platform, the ERM (Expert Relationship Management) System
Assist in day-to-day operations of the Compliance Department, as directed by the team's Manager and the Chief Compliance Officer
Lead virtual and in-person compliance training sessions for Coleman staff globally
Execute compliance audits in accordance with the Company's audit program
Interact with compliance departments of Company clients, responding to their questions via email or phone, completing written due diligence questionnaires describing our compliance controls and features of our program
Act as an internal knowledge resource to business-level employees on relevant compliance topics
Generate and draft documentation regarding the Company's Compliance Program

Position Qualifications

1-3 years of relevant work experience
Understanding (or willingness to gain an understanding) of the financial markets and role of the Company's various client types therein, along with applicable bodies of law and regulation that affect the primary research process, including insider trading laws and securities issuance are a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to independently handle complex topics using sound judgement and high integrity
The ability to effectively manage and prioritize a multitude of tasks, and work independently in a fast-paced environment
Detail and process oriented
Bachelor's degree required

Why Join Us?

If you are self-motivated, driven, and focused on achievement, there are no limits to your ability to succeed and grow with Coleman!
We know that our employees are our most valuable asset, and they make Coleman a vibrant and innovative place to work. As such, we strive to ensure the happiness and health of our employees. At our US locations, we offer a variety of perks, including a generous PTO package, free and/or subsidized fitness centers, corporate sports leagues, stocked break rooms, team outings, and other office celebrations throughout the year. Additionally, Coleman covers 90% of medical premiums, with medical coverage available on your first day of employment, along with your eligibility to enroll in our 401(K) plan with a company match!
We believe in fostering the personal and professional development of our employees, and strongly believe in our talents' potential to develop into future leaders. We provide extensive orientation and training programs for each of our employees throughout their careers with Coleman, as well as educational assistance programs to encourage our people to stay curious and to continue learning.
We also believe in giving back to our communities. In that spirit, we provide each employee 2 paid community service days per year, and, as an organization, participate in other volunteer and fundraising activities that are meaningful to our employees.
We have an interactive management team, and an open and collaborative work environment, whereby we value creativity of thought and listen to the voice of our employees.
An Equal Opportunity Employer. All Coleman employees are required to sign the Company's standard non-compete agreement as a condition of accepting employment.

title: Project Specialist
desc:
Do you want to join an international team working to improve the future of healthcare? Do you want to improve the lives of millions of people? Grifols is a global healthcare company which, since its foundation in Barcelona in 1909, has been working to improve the health and well-being of people all over the world. Our four divisions - Bioscience, Diagnostic, Hospital and Bio Supplies - develop, produce and market innovative medicines, solutions and services in more than 100 countries and regions.



This position will be based at our RTP, NC office.

The Project Management Specialist is responsible for planning, executing and evaluating projects according to the outlined goals and objectives and ensuring strong quality control throughout the project life cycle.

Oversee all aspects of project planning and execution including:
Working with project team, sponsor and stake holders to define project scope, goals, deliverables, resources and timing
Creating and managing detailed project plan including; objectives, tasks, work structure, timelines, resources and project risks.
Coordinate and facilitate project team meetings and proactively lead teams to accomplish project goals
Develop and implement procedures, databases, tools etc. as needed for effective project management
Identify and manage risks associated with projects and resolve any issues any problems that may arise during project life cycle.
Develop and implement procedures, databases and tools for effective project management
Track and monitor project milestones, key metrics and analyze data to report to sponsors and stakeholders
Create detailed execution plan including schedules, resources, training and ensure all are aligned prior to rollout and track and report progress.
Provide oversight of project execution through completion and ensure post implementation lessons learned are documented.
Provide leadership, direction and coaching on project specific tasks as well as individual professional development

Bachelor's degree or equivalent project management experience.
Minimum of 2 years previous plasma management experience or 3 year management experience.
MS Office (Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint)
Effective phone and interpersonal communication skills.

Frequent hand movement of both hands with the ability to make fast, simple, movements of the fingers, hands, and wrists. Occasionally walks and stands. Occasionally bends and twists neck. Light to moderate lifting and carrying objects with a maximum lift of 25lbs. Frequently drives to site locations with occasional travel within the United States. Able to communicate information and ideas so others will understand; with the ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken and written words and sentences. Interacts with others, relates sensitive information to diverse groups. Must work with diverse groups to obtain consensus on issues.

title: Business Administration Director
desc:
What You'll Be Doing

The Business Administration Director plans, prioritizes, leads, and directs Business and Administration functions in the following core operational areas: Business Process Management (fiscal oversight, budget development (operating & capital), data analytics, and operational evaluation; supervision of the Department Business Manager, Business Quality Assurance Supervisor, and Request Center), Criminal Justice Planning (Criminal Justice Support and the County’s Jail Diversion Program), and Support Services (Mail & Courier Services, Move and Warehouse Services). The position implements division business plans through a balanced approach of internal and outsourced labor to ensure the most efficient and competitive service delivery at lowest cost while maintaining quality industry standards and customer service. The Business Administration Director develops and manages the annual budget and develops annual major and minor capital budgets.

Business Process Management:
Administer duties of the Division and manage staff
Oversee all budgetary and fiscal needs for GSA
Supervise Department Business Manager, Business Quality Assurance Supervisor, Senior Accountants, Senior Accounting Technicians, and two Customer Service Representatives
Direct the Annual GSA Budget and Business Plan Preparation
Provide budget reporting and analysis to GSA Management
Advise, create and document GSA Business Processes
Serve as GSA’s Finance Treasury Contact
Oversee Accounts Payable for GSA Divisions
Oversee the maintenance of records for all internal and external accounting and auditing of GSA expenditures
Lead the continuous improvement of cost reporting systems for GSA services
Evaluate organizational structure and recommend personnel change requests
Provide leadership for the Request Center - GSA’s communication hub
Oversee all GSA Administration Office HR personnel actions and needs
Serve as the Technology Lead for GSA on HR’s Learning Management System, SharePoint Team Sites, Engie (Utility Bill Payer), VFA (Capital Forecasting), and Finance’s Electronic Contract Management

Energy Management Support:
Oversee management of utility payment process
Participate and represent GSA on Countywide committees
Direct fulfillment of Public Records Request for GSA.

Support Services:
Provide oversight to the Mail and Courier Services and Move and Warehouse Services
Supervise a Mail and Courier Services Specialist, Moves and Warehouse Operations Supervisor, a Moves and Warehouse Technician and 7 contracted staff
Ensure fiscal and inventory controls remain in place for postage and surplus property management
Monitor performance of functions to ensure service delivery model remains efficient and effective
Maintain performance standards for mail delivery, as required by USPS and laboratory samples regulations, and move services

Criminal Justice Planning:
Assist in managing the following areas: Jail Alternative Programs; development of Jail and Court data collection and system improvements; Jail and Court Master Plan updates and court technology related projects; 10th Judicial District Officer Court Calendar and Pretrial Monitoring Program Software

NOTE: A criminal background and credit check will be conducted.

About Our Team

General Services Administration (GSA) manages Wake County owned and leased facilities, the Wake County fleet, provides criminal justice support, and supports a number of General Government business units. GSA is dedicated to ensuring safe, productive work environments; safe, reliable vehicles; and consistent corporate support to assigned business units. The department is organized into five major organizational service delivery divisions: (1) Administration and Support Services, (2) Facilities and Field Services, (3) Fleet Operations, (4) Physical Plant and (5) Safety and Security. These service organizations support the four core businesses of GSA: facility management, fleet management, general government and criminal justice support.

The Basics (Required Education and Experience)
Bachelor's degree
Five years of experience in public administration, business administration, accounting or budgeting
A valid driver's license and a "safe" driving record required
Equivalent education and experience are accepted
Beyond the Basics (Preferred Education and Experience)

Master’s Degree in Public Administration, Business Administration, Accounting, Budgeting, or related field
Seven years of public administration, business administration, accounting, budgeting, criminal justice planning, and supervision
Expert level in Microsoft Office Suite
Experience working with Advantage, Maximo, FM Systems, Cornerstone, Engie, and SharePoint Team Sites

How Will We Know You're 'The One'?
Familiarity with developing and managing Capital and Operating budgets, public sector accounting and fiscal management
Excellent interpersonal and exceptional oral/written communication skills
Ability to interact and communicate effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization with tact and diplomacy
Superior customer service skills, integrity and commitment to collaboration and forward-thinking efficiency
Excellent problem solving, organizational, analytical, prioritization and decision-making skills
Supervisory skills with the ability to see the big, long-range picture and lead others accordingly
Ability to provide guidance and professional support to staff, offer regular feedback, hold staff accountable, and serve as a mentor
Advanced critical thinking and project management skills with ability to multi-task and prioritize
Ability to exercise independent and sound judgment in performing the duties of the position

title: Regional Compliance Coordinator
desc:
Reynolds American is evolving at pace - truly like no other organization.
To achieve the ambition, we have set for ourselves, we are looking for colleagues who are ready to live our ethos every day. Come be a part of this journey!

WE ARE LOOKING FOR A REGIONAL COMPLIANCE COORDINATOR

SENIORITY LEVEL: Experienced Non-Management Level
FUNCTION: Operations
LOCATION: Winston-Salem, NC

ROLE POSITIONING AND OBJECTIVES
What are the key objectives and expectations from this role?
The Compliance Coordinator provides factory material assessment and support services to internal stakeholders, to ensure that materials used in RAI factories meet the existing Product Stewardship Council (PSC) guidelines.

What is the direct impact of this role on the team or organization?
The position interfaces with key stakeholders within Operations to ensure initiatives are adequately supported and serves as an administrative resource to support Quality Assurance, Environmental Health and Safety, and Facilities departments to meet administrative and compliance requirements.

Reports to: Regional Compliance Director
Core Relationships: Internal – Manufacturing and Production Team External-Some vendors Vendors
Geographic Scope: Local

WHAT YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR
Provide reliable and efficient screening, routing and generating of material evaluation requests through internal communications and correspondence
Ensure records are complete and properly maintained and updated in system for area of responsibility
Coordinate with EHS on material requests as needed
Is responsible for the execution of the factory material evaluation from initiation until completion
Reviews incoming factory material assessment requests for completion and accuracy
Evaluate risk assessment to determine if the material request must be escalated to a formal evaluation
Communicates evaluation outcome and all other updates to internal stakeholders
Manages the list of approved materials and consolidate the RAI list with the Global PSC list of approved materials
Maintain Spare Parts request within the Capital/MRO/Supply site
Maintain, update, or modify document procedures as needed
Be aware of the Company environmental, health & safety policies and comply with the objectives as it relates to the role
Follow Company Safety Rules
Know the potential health & safety risks and environmental impacts of work activities and understand role in mitigating these impacts
Understand responsibilities for compliance with regulatory requirements and Company standards
Complete EHS-required training and follow operational procedures
Immediately report all injuries and illnesses
Any other assigned duties

CAN THIS BE YOUR FUTURE ROLE?
Do you have experience in a manufacturing or regulated environment?

ESSENTIAL
Experience Required
Strong computer skills (including Microsoft Office Professional suite)
Strong verbal and written communication skills

Technical / Functional / Leadership Skills Required
Strong organizational skills with demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks and projects.
Ability Good problem solving and analytical skills

Education / Qualifications / Certifications Required
Bachelors of Science degree in Science preferred;
Associate degree with relevant experience (2+ yrs);
High School diploma or equivalent with relevant experience (5+ yrs)

BENEFICIAL
Sharepoint Use

COMPENSATION/TARGETED BONUS
Competitive annual salary
Targeted Annual Bonus

BENEFIT SUMMARY
We offer very competitive compensation and benefit plans, including:
401(k) plan that offers opportunity to save on pre- and post-tax basis up to 50 percent of eligible compensation. Company matches 100 percent of employee pre-tax/Roth (401k) contributions up to six percent
Comprehensive health- and welfare-benefits package
Eleven paid company holidays annually, plus a generous paid vacation plan based on length of service
Company-paid sick and personal days, funeral leave, and jury duty leave; Also, Parental leave/Reduced Work Schedule
Confidential personal financial counselling service
On-site health clinics and fitness centers
A matching grants program that enables employees to direct and double their donations to qualifying charitable organizations of their choice
Health-care advocacy service
Volunteer service opportunities
Federal credit union membership through Allegacy Federal Credit Union
Extensive training opportunities

Our organization offers a level of challenge, responsibility and creativity for motivated employees that welcome opportunities for growth. We are also committed to employing a diverse workforce and valuing different perspectives, experiences, and talents to improve the company's potential for optimally achieving its business objectives!

Reynolds American Inc. and its affiliated companies is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. Reynolds American Inc. is an indirect, wholly owned subsidiary of British American Tobacco p.l.c., and the U.S. parent company of R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company; Santa Fe Natural Tobacco Company, Inc.; American Snuff Company, LLC; Modoral Brands Inc.; R. J. Reynolds Vapor Company; Lorillard Licensing Company, LLC; Reynolds Brands, Inc.; Vuse Stores LLC; Kentucky BioProcessing, Inc.; RAI Services Company and Reynolds Marketing Services Company. WE ARE REYNOLDS AMERICAN — A member of the BRITISH AMERICAN TOBACCO GROUP
At Reynolds American, we are committed to our Purpose of creating A Better Tomorrow. This is what drives our people and our passion for innovation. See what is possible for you at REYNOLDS AMERICAN.

title: UCS Temporary Career Counselor/Coach
salary:
Job details
Job Type
Part-time
Temporary
desc:
The Temporary Career Counselor/Coach is responsible for providing career coaching and support to students when selecting a major and career direction, planning for their career goals, learning effective job search skills and strategies, and finding part-time jobs, internships and post-graduation employment. The temporary career counselor/coach will work with UNC undergraduate and graduate students. UCS services include helping students learn about career fields, career planning, career assessments, resume and cover letter writing, interviewing, networking, job searching, and graduate school planning. The temporary career counselor/coach reports to the Associate Director. Candidate will have the part-time availability to work with individual students and groups both in-person and virtually. A combination of both day-time and evening availability is expected.Advising and Coaching:- Provide direct career counseling and coaching services to students individually and in groups regarding all aspects of career development.- Maintain virtual and in-person appointment availability.- Demonstrate consistent quality as evidenced by student evaluations, comments on follow-up surveys, and direct observation.- Follow industry changes and development.- Develop coaching and life design models for students.Special Projects:- Assist with office to help strengthen relationships, programs, and collaborations across campus.- Demonstrate effective communication, presentation, and teamwork skills.- Serve as a presenter or classroom assistant for University Career Services-instructed career courses.
Minimum Qualifications:
Master's degree in education, special education, instructional design, educational technology, educational media, or related discipline with coursework in curriculum development or learning theory; or a Bachelor's degree in the assigned discipline and two years of experience in teaching, educational testing, or instructional design and curriculum development; or equivalent combination of training and experience. All degrees must be received from appropriately accredited institutions.
