title: Human Resource Specialist
desc:
Overview:
The HR Specialist will report directly to the HR Director of Administration to support the Senior Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer with a variety of organizational priorities and projects, including board and committee preparation, budget development, and merger integration. This role will develop HR budget reports in conjunction with the Budget Department to analyze and forecast workforce trends. This role will support the daily management of the HR budget and spend for existing vendors. In addition, this role will follow-up with key stakeholders to obtain documents for board and committee preparation. This position will also support merger integration as needed for all functions of the department.

At Novant Health, one of our core values is diversity and inclusion. By engaging the strengths and talents of each team member, we ensure a strong organization capable of providing remarkable healthcare to our patients, families and communities. Therefore, we invite applicants from all group dynamics to apply to our exciting career opportunities.
Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor's degree required.
Experience: Three years of project management and budget management experience required. Three years of artificial intelligence, IT experience preferred.
Licensure/certification: PMP Project Management Certification preferred.
Additional skills required:
Minimum of three years of results-oriented project management experience with an emphasis on budget management, board preparation, and merger and acquisitions.

Advanced experience with MSOffice, particularly MS Excel, PowerPoint, Word.

Proficient in MicroSoft Project and Visio.

Experience analyzing budget data with attention to accurate data and calculations.

Ability to effectively communicate and build relationships with a view of inclusion and belonging.

Strong analytical, consulting, organizational, and strategic thinking skills.

Action oriented, willing to do what is needed in order to move projects forward in an organized manner with consistent execution.

Strong digital fluency.

Relationship management skills that include listening and consultative abilities, as well as the ability to establish credible relationships with business partners to drive change.

Exceptional oral and written communication skills, and ability to draft clear, concise communications and documents.
Additional skills preferred:
Entrepreneurial spirit and innovative drive for reaching the next great idea and exceeding goals.

Intellectual depth, moral integrity, personal vision, creativity, leadership skills, fortitude, sincerity and diplomacy.

Ability to work independently and as a team player who will productively engage with others at varying levels of seniority within and outside of Novant Health.

Bilingual in Spanish / English.


Responsibilities:
It is the responsibility of every Novant Health team member to deliver the most remarkable patient experience in every dimension, every time.
Our team members are part of an environment that fosters team work, team member engagement and community involvement.
The successful team member has a commitment to leveraging diversity and inclusion in support of quality care.
All Novant Health team members are responsible for fostering a safe patient environment driven by the principles of "First Do No Harm".

The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually.

Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process.

What We Believe

We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.

Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation.

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement.

Requesting An Accommodation

Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired.

If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter.

Other Employment Statements

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.

title: Associate Director of Development
salary:
Job details
Salary
$50,000 a year
Job Type
Full-time
desc:
NOTICE OF VACANT POSITION
ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF DEVELOPMENT – FAYETTEVILLE, NC
Opening Date: 3/26/2021
Closing Date: Opened until filled
Employment Type: Full-time/Exempt
Starting Pay: $50,000 annually
OVERVIEW OF GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES
The Assistant Director of Development is a key leadership team member and an active participant in making decisions on the Food Bank Leadership team. The Food Bank is dedicated to building community awareness and creating an efficient food distribution network to eliminate hunger in seven (7) counties. Staff is committed to embodying the Food Banks values in all activities. Relationships are based on collaboration and respect. Resources are leveraged strategically and cost-effectively to achieve the Action Pathways mission and goals.
In collaboration with all Action Pathways programs, the Associate Development of Director has responsibility for planning strategy, implementing and directing all aspects of fundraising activities related to Action Pathways programs. This includes, but is not limited to, Corporate/Foundation Gifts, Major Gifts, Planned Giving, Special Events, and Direct Mail. Strong focus will be placed on generating gifts from individuals, new prospects and expanding fundraising efforts into previously untapped locales within the service territory, and maximizing existing campaigns and events. The position will report to the Assistant Director.
Development Office Operations
Responsible for the daily management of development office operations and ensuring best practices
Responsible for donor relations management software and the integrity of donor database records
Manage the acknowledgment and receipting process for all donor gifts in a manner that is professional, timely, and confidential
Draft and personalize written donor correspondence including requests and thank you letters
Assist and support Food Bank Director with prospect management and fundraising reporting
Provide direct supervision and direction to Development Assistant
Act as the primary point of contact for donor questions and concerns
Manage tribute and memorial giving program
Process donations of stock and other non-cash contributions
Manage relationships with development vendors and audit invoices for accuracy and correctness
Fundraising
Steward relationships with existing annual donors to promote donor retention
Solicit event sponsorship renewals
Track pledge payments and follow up on receivables
Lead 3rd party fundraising efforts such as Feeding America Cause Marketing Campaigns
Direct Mail Campaigns:
Lead and manage all aspects of mailed campaigns such as appeals, newsletter, bequest, monthly giving, capital projects, etc.
Work with a graphic designer, printer, and mail house on all aspects of production and distribution
Grant Writing:
Provide direction and supervision to outside grant consultant, including prospect evaluation, coordination, and final reporting
Draft and submit grant proposals to a select group of foundations, generally those with established relationships and/or smaller gift amounts
Other Responsibilities
Oversee volunteer recognition efforts such as flowers, gifts, and plaques
Attend Advisory Committee meetings as necessary
Participate in general community relations— external and internal events, etc.
Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS
Education: A Bachelor's Degree in business, public policy, nonprofit management, or other relevant fields.
Experience: A minimum of three (3) years of development experience required. In addition, two or more years of development, sales, or related experience is preferred. Experience in a nonprofit setting is also preferred. Successful track record in soliciting and closing principal and major gifts-whether outright or deferred-as well as campaign experience is required. Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and presentation skills are required. Superior written and verbal communication skills required. Demonstrated supervisory experience of fundraising staff preferred. Strong leadership skills required.
An equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered in lieu of a formal educational degree.
GENERAL REQUIREMENTS
Computer Skills
To perform this job successfully, the individual should be proficient in preparing Excel spreadsheets, word processing software including PowerPoint, database software, or other presentation materials. The employee should have experience with Donor Management Software.

The employee must be familiar with warehouse safety practices and able to operate equipment properly. He or she must be familiar with safe food handling, receiving, inspecting, and shipping practices. The individual must be able to get along well with a diverse population of customers, volunteers, and employees.
Applicant must have:

The employee is required to have a valid NC Driver's License and own reliable transportation.

Ability to construct, articulate, and implement annual strategic development plans. Strong organizational and time management skills with exceptional attention to detail. Customer focus; donor-centric vision. A professional and resourceful style; takes initiative, and is able to manage multiple tasks and projects at a time.
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral; ability to influence and engage a wide range of donors and build long‐term relationships. Strong organizational, leadership, and mentoring skills. Flexible and adaptable style; a leader who can positively impact both strategic and tactical fundraising initiatives.
CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT
Background check with state and Federal law enforcement agency required. Selected applicant must submit to a pre-employment substance abuse screening test and receive a negative result for the use of drugs and alcohol as specified in agency policies. Must submit and receive negative results for random testing of same. The employee must have a valid North Carolina Driver's License. Must be able to pass a post-offer physical examination.
Action Pathways, Inc. is an “at-will” employer. Either the employee or Action Pathways, Inc. may terminate the employment arrangement at any time, with or without cause.
Management has the exclusive right to alter this job description at any time without notice. The job description or announcement is not an employment agreement or contract.
EMPLOYEE BENEFITS:
Zero cost health, vision, dental, short-term disability & life insurance
Retirement plan with 100% employer matching
Paid vacation, personal & sick leave
Professional development training
Education financial assistance
Auto mileage reimbursement for official travel
HOW TO APPLY
Applicants must apply online at www.actionpathways.ngo

title: IPS Employment Team Leader
desc:
WHO WE ARE:
Together We Achieve Better Days - Easterseals UCP creates opportunities, promotes individual choice, and changes the lives of children and adults with disabilities by maximizing their individual potential to live, learn, work, and play in their communities. We are Accountable, Committed, and Caring. These three words guide everything we do.
Our Employment Services Program has an immediate opportunity for an IPS Team Lead to support the Fayetteville program. This is a Full-Time position Mon-Fri 9:00 am-5:00 pm offering full benefits and competitive salary.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
The IPS Team Leader’s primary duties are to provide leadership in direct service for the IPS team, to ensure that jobs are secured for individuals with disabilities who are served and supported by the IPS team, and to ensure that services are provided according to the service definition and IPS Fidelity Model. In this position, the IPS Team Leader serves as an integral part of the management team in the daily operation of the supported employment program. The IPS Team Leader is supervised by the Employment Program Supervisor or IPS Program Supervisor.
Provide leadership in the implementation of direct services and supports for the IPS team.
Hold weekly staff meetings to ensure adherence to the fidelity.
Provide monthly individual supervision with each IPS staff to assure the delivery of evidence-based and ethical practices.
Provide clinical supervision and oversight to all IPS employment staff for each individual receiving the IPS employment services.
Coordinate with the IPS employment team integration with behavioral health teams to discuss clinical and employment services provided to individuals supported by the team.
Provide training for all members of the IPS team prior to services being delivered and/or ensure that all required training is in compliance with the service definition, rules and regulation, and Easter Seals UCP policy.
Accompany individuals being supported to their community-based employment site to provide on the job training as needed.
Analyze job duties and tasks and completes a thorough job task analysis as needed.
Assist individuals in mastering skills and meeting production standards. Employment Support Professionals may be required to assist in performing an individual’s job duties to maintain necessary production as well as model work behavior.
Facilitate collaboration with Vocational Rehabilitation services as needed to ensure seamless service provision.
Conduct job development activities.
Maintain case records as required by licensing and funding entities' standards and regulations.
Coordinate communication with parents, care coordination, Vocational Rehabilitation, Behavioral Health Services, and other agencies serving the individuals being supported.
Maintain good work habits regarding attendance, punctuality, appearance, and effective working relationships with co-workers, VR and MCO staff, employers, other providers, and individuals being supported.
Provide supplemental evaluation, job development, and intensive training activities with individuals being supported according to their service authorization, service plan, and work schedule.
Keeps the Program Supervisor informed on all issues of importance.
Become a Certified Employment Support Professional within 6 months of employment in this position.
Follow all ESUCP Policies and Procedures.
Must demonstrate Easter Seals valued behaviors of Accountability, Commitment, and Caring as appropriate to the position.
Complete required training within prescribed timeframes.
Perform related duties as requested by the Program Supervisor.
Supervisory Responsibility: Supervise IPS Team providing oversight of the programs’ staff, including but not limited to: recruitment, screening, hiring, training, and supervision.
WHAT EASTER SEALS UCP CAN OFFER YOU:
Comprehensive Benefits Package including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and long-term & short-term disability insurance.
403(b) Retirement Plan
Accrued Paid Time Off + 10 Paid Holidays.
Company provided phone and laptop with IT Technical Support
YOU’RE A GREAT MATCH FOR OUR TEAM IF YOU HAVE:
Bachelor's Degree from a college or university accredited by an entity approved by USDOE or CHEA which meets the criteria for MHQP status.
Knowledge of the labor market and community service agencies.
Previous work experience with comprehensive clinical assessments (CCA's) and writing Personalized Plans (PCP's)
Skilled in developing and writing task analysis, systemic job training, and supported employment.
Must hold current, unrestricted, state appropriate driver’s license and valid vehicle insurance.
Must be willing to support this community-based program and travel throughout the assigned delivery area as needed.
FOLLOW YOUR PASSION * FIND YOUR VOICE * JOIN THE EastersealsUCP TEAM
Experience
Preferred
3 year(s): Supervisor Experience
3 year(s): IPS Employment services

title: Sr Materials Analyst
desc:
Company Description

Jobs for Humanity is dedicated to building an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we have dedicated this job posting to individuals coming from the following communities: Refugee, Neurodivergent, Single Parent, Blind or Low Vision, Ethnic Minority, and the Previously Incarcerated. If you identify with any of the following communities do not hesitate to register, even if you feel that this particular opportunity is not the right fit for you.

Company Name: Spectrum

Job Description

JOB SUMMARY
The Sr Materials Analyst will be an integral contributing member of the supply chain team, responsible for inventory processes, analytics and support initiatives of the supply chain organization. Monitors inventory movement and reviews and researches opportunities for improvement.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Actively and consistently supports all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience.
Provide financial and operational analysis specific to the needs of the supply chain group.
Physical inventory reconciliation support for tier 1 and regional hub APIs as held.
Min/max inventory level review and provide suggestions for adjustment to align with company inventory level goals.
Excess and obsolete inventory analysis and suggested inventory usage strategy to minimize scrap inventory.
Partner with the warehouse operations on demand planning and replenishment reviews based on historical and current activity levels.
Support asset tracking software reconciliation against regional hub churn inventory records.
Develop and maintain standard formats, templates, and operating procedures.
Maintain and track critical inventory metrics as assigned including cycle count/physical inventory results, inventory turns, inventory valuation and back orders.
Interface as the central point of contact with field warehouses, hub personnel and 3PL on inventory levels, activity and accuracy.
Foster a culture of consistency, accountability and continuous improvement.
Provide support to accounting/finance teams on material and CPE inventory matters.
Prepare ad hoc reports as necessary to address issues and opportunities.
Identify supply risks and elevate for resolution.
Take on additional duties as assigned to support the enterprise.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Required Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
Ability to read, write, speak and understand English
Demonstrated analytical and critical thinking skills with the ability to gather comprehensive requirements and delivery results expediently
Superior personal computer skills in all Office applications with emphasis on Excel and Access
Verbal, written and inter-personal communications skills
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, working efficiently and effectively under deadlines
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, proactively reach out for information when necessary and draw valid conclusions
Ability to work collaboratively with multi-disciplined teams
Ability to multi-task and adapt to a fast paced and rapidly changing environment
Ability to prepare reconciliations of differing data sets
Knowledge of cable billing and ancillary systems

Required Education
Bachelor's degree, preferably with Accounting, Finance or Supply Chain concentration; or equivalent training, education and experience

Required Related Work Experience and Number of Years
Applicable relevant experience - 5+

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Preferred Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
Preferred Education
Preferred Related Work Experience and Number of Years
JD Edwards/PeopleSoft inventory experience

WORKING CONDITIONS
Office environment
Some travel may be required
#LI-TM3

title: HR DEPARTMENTAL DIRECTOR
desc:
School of Medicine Established in 1930, Duke University School of Medicine is the youngest of the nationâ€™s top medical schools. Ranked sixth among medical schools in the nation, the School takes pride in being an inclusive community of outstanding learners, investigators, clinicians, and staff where interdisciplinary collaboration is embraced and great ideas accelerate translation of fundamental scientific discoveries to improve human health locally and around the globe. Composed of more than 2,500 faculty physicians and researchers, more than 1,300 students, and more than 6,000 staff, the Duke University School of Medicine along with the Duke University School of Nursing, Duke University Health System and the Private Diagnostic Clinic (PDC) comprise Duke Health. a world-class academic medical center. The Health System encompasses Duke University Hospital, Duke Regional Hospital, Duke Raleigh Hospital, Duke Primary Care, Duke Home and Hospice, Duke Health and Wellness, and multiple affiliations.
HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENTAL DIRECTOR – Duke Radiology

Summary Description
Reporting directly to the Chief Administrative Office in Duke Radiology, Human Resources Department Director supports Duke Radiology in the strategic and work culture leadership of the department. The role will be integral to our leadership team and will include budgeting and planning for the Duke Radiology portfolio, leading recruitment and selection, advising on change management, assisting managers with expectations and accountability, championing team development, navigating the complexities of building an increasingly international and hybrid workforce, and leading the organization's work culture initiatives.

Responsibilities
Provide strong organizational leadership for the Department of Radiology, a growing clinical, research, and academic enterprise and partner at all levels of the organization to assure the success of the team.
Lead key strategies for the department including strategic planning and implementation, organizational planning, recruitment and selection, change management, team expectations and accountabilities, and work culture improvement.
Manage SOM central HR hub team and oversee responsibilities and portfolio of the team.
Act as liaison with central HR offices and other clinical department human resources teams, and facilitate responses and actions for department leaders and managers
Develop strong culture around coaching and mentorship for department and proactively work with managers to develop new training and development frameworks for their teams.
Manage ad hoc and ongoing projects identified by the needs of the business, including but not limited to:
HR compliance related centralization (e.g., OSHA)
COVID related activities including policy alignment and vaccinations
Policy and process alignment
Manage annual processes such as the Performance Evaluation and Faculty Review and Assessment processes for department as well as compliance related to COVID, Flu, and credentialing as needed.
Provide guidance to managers and leadership team related to compensation, diversity and inclusion initiatives, Rewards and Recognition actions, performance expectations and accountability.
Lead a multifunctional team to cultivate a spirit of excellence and inclusion by establishing executable goals, respect, great communication, and superb responsiveness. Streamline and maximize opportunities to improve on all aspects of recruiting, onboarding, and offboarding trainees and faculty.
Organizational planning and forecasting: Lead department in by providing strategic vision for building evolving teams with effective planning and tactics for managers to recruit and select exceptional teams.
Recruiting: Collaborate with hiring managers to develop job descriptions and navigate approval processes, develop policy and manage recruiting and selection processes, assist with offer letters including approvals and negotiate candidate compensation, conduct interviews and collaborate on onboarding/orientation for new employees.
Provide support and guidance to managers on talent acquisition and retention activities, including but not limited to, the development of search plans and strategic recruitment strategies/initiatives, applicant sourcing and selection, job description development and position management, and temporary recruitment needs ensuring compliance with EEO and other applicable requirements.
Create consistent onboarding programs for faculty and staff positions
Develop compensation benchmarking for department and advise on proactive compensation adjustments and promotions for teams
Advise managers on pay issues, affirmative action requirements, position classification issues, performance appraisal, employee relations and employee training and development issues; maintain liaison with Human Resources and other appropriate offices and departments to respond to employee problems, issues, and special requests and to facilitate actions.
Collaborate with HR Service Center on all Visa sponsorship and applications (including gathering of required documents, Duke Web Form completion and requisition of checks) for Radiology staff working closely with the Visa Services office
Advise and assist management, faculty and staff in the handling of employee relations issues, complaints and/or grievances and determination of appropriate disciplinary actions; represent management at grievance hearings, dismissal conferences and arbitration.
Interpret human resource policy intent and/or acceptable management practices to ensure fair and consistent application of University policy; develop departmental policies in accordance with established University policy.
Preferred Skills And Experience
5+ years in human resources or administrative role with HR
Prior staff management experience is preferred.
Familiarity with Duke@Work, SAP, and Success Factors preferred
Project management skills
Solid organizational and analytical abilities

Required Qualifications At This Level

Education/Training: Work requires a general business or personnel background generally equivalent to a bachelor's degree in a related field.

Experience: Work requires five years of business and/or administrative experience, with exposure to human resources activities, to acquire knowledge of human resources policies and procedures necessary to manage the personnel activities of a major department or division.OR AN EQUIVALENT COMBINATION OF RELEVANT EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE.

Motivation, Values, and Personality
Impeccable integrity.
High levels of motivation and great attitude.
Inspired by the Duke Radiology opportunity.
Commitment to excellence.
Approachable. Naturally connects with colleagues about their interests and ideas and also personally.
A collaborative team player.
Natural coach.

Experience, Knowledge, and Competencies
Time management.
Outstanding interpersonal, communication and written communication skills.
Expert consulting, coaching and facilitation skill
Demonstrated experience to influence and strategically solve problems
Proactive and demonstrated ability to think strategically.

Duke is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing employment opportunity without regard to an individual's age, color, disability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or veteran status.

Duke aspires to create a community built on collaboration, innovation, creativity, and belonging. Our collective success depends on the robust exchange of ideas—an exchange that is best when the rich diversity of our perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences flourishes. To achieve this exchange, it is essential that all members of the community feel secure and welcome, that the contributions of all individuals are respected, and that all voices are heard. All members of our community have a responsibility to uphold these values.

Essential Physical Job Functions: Certain jobs at Duke University and Duke University Health System may include essentialjob functions that require specific physical and/or mental abilities. Additional information and provision for requests for reasonable accommodation will be provided by each hiring department.

title: STAFF SPECIALIST
desc:
School of Medicine Established in 1930, Duke University School of Medicine is the youngest of the nationâ€™s top medical schools. Ranked sixth among medical schools in the nation, the School takes pride in being an inclusive community of outstanding learners, investigators, clinicians, and staff where interdisciplinary collaboration is embraced and great ideas accelerate translation of fundamental scientific discoveries to improve human health locally and around the globe. Composed of more than 2,500 faculty physicians and researchers, more than 1,300 students, and more than 6,000 staff, the Duke University School of Medicine along with the Duke University School of Nursing, Duke University Health System and the Private Diagnostic Clinic (PDC) comprise Duke Health. a world-class academic medical center. The Health System encompasses Duke University Hospital, Duke Regional Hospital, Duke Raleigh Hospital, Duke Primary Care, Duke Home and Hospice, Duke Health and Wellness, and multiple affiliations.
Position: Staff Specialist, NUS/OCA
Job Code: 0083
Level 9

Job Description:
Support for Associate Director, Global Education for Duke-NUS

Responsibilities will include:
Providing administrative support to the Associate Director, Global Education for Duke-NUS
Assisting with the planning, organization, and implementation of Duke-NUS events at Duke including Applicant Days, Recruitment events, Orientation of Duke-NUS students, and symposia
Liaising with MedEd IT staff to provide audiovisual and other technical support during Duke-NUS events
Assuming primary responsibility for assisting incoming third year medical students from Singapore with visas services, background checks through Castlebranch, health insurance etc., and communicating with them regarding requirements and deadlines
Enrolling third year Duke-NUS students at Duke into appropriate study programs through PeopleSoft/Oracle.
Maintaining databases of visiting student information.
Maintaining organization of confidential student information and sharing this information with relevant offices (Visa Services, Student Health etc.) at Duke SOM
Communicating and working closely with colleagues in Singapore and at Duke to acquire, share or clarify information and answer inquiries concerning program activities
Scheduling rooms for all Duke-NUS events, such as recruitment events, interview days and visits, through 25live which is Duke’s room scheduling system
Assisting with hosting visitors including making hotel, restaurant, and land transportation reservations, making appointments for meetings, and creating individual agendas
Clearing the Associate Director, Global Education for Duke-NUS’s corporate card and creating expense reports
Creating inventory lists of materials we have and needed for Duke-NUS events
Purchasing office supplies for the team and beverages for guests through Buy@Duke, Duke’s online purchasing system, and making purchases through Amazon and other online vendors as needed
Postage duties including mailing large packages of material to Singapore.
Assisting with quality assurance of course materials
Planning and scheduling work priorities in accordance with program goals and deadlines
Advising supervisor as to the status of current activities and additional or expanded program requirements and making recommendations for solutions to problems identified.
Partnering with supervisor in developing and improving processes as needed
Participating in staff development opportunities
Performing additional general duties as needed for Duke-NUS and Medical Education.

The successful applicant will:
Have strong administrative and office management skills
Be proficient at using Microsoft Word and comfortable with Excel
Have strong written and verbal communication skills
Be able to communicate effectively with international colleagues and students appreciating differences in culture and dialects
Have exceptional organizational skills and keen attention to detail
Be able to manage multiple priorities and have good time management skills
Have a proven record of maintaining confidential information
Be comfortable and effective working with a diverse international team of professionals and students
Be flexible in adapting to the needs of an international collaboration for undergraduate medical education
Have some experience with event planning
Be comfortable with technology and have the ability to learn to use relevant Duke-specific software tools such as Box & 25live
Be familiar with online communication tools such as Zoom and Skype.
Occasionally work flexible hours because of 12–13-hour time difference with Singapore
Have some knowledge and experience with video editing tools and procedures

Minimum Qualifications
Education
Work requires knowledge of basic mathematical, research and communications principles normally acquired through two years of postsecondary education. A bachelor’s degree is preferred by the department.

Experience
Work generally requires four years of clerical or research experience to acquire strong skills in administrative or project research responsibilities as well as accepted office management, communications, and research practices. A bachelor's degree in a field of study directly related to the specific position may be substituted for the education and two years of the experience requirement OR AN EQUIVALENT COMBINATION OF RELEVANT EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE.

Duke is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing employment opportunity without regard to an individual's age, color, disability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or veteran status.

Our collective success depends on the robust exchange of ideas—an exchange that is best when the rich diversity of our perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences flourishes. To achieve this exchange, it is essential that all members of the community feel secure and welcome, that the contributions of all individuals are respected, and that all voices are heard. All members of our community have a responsibility to uphold these values.
