title: PlanView Administrator
desc:
Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology? An industry solutions professional who wants to work in a collaborative environment. As an experienced PlanView Administrator you will have the ability to share new ideas and collaborate on projects as a consultant without the extensive demands of travel. If so, consider an opportunity with Deloitte under our Project Delivery Talent Model. Project Delivery Model (PDM) is a talent model that is tailored specifically for long-term, onsite client service delivery. PDM practitioners are local to project locations, minimizing extensive travel, and provides you with a full career path within the firm.

Work you'll do/Responsibilities

Enterprise Services Solutions Architecture team is seeking an experienced Planview Enterprise One (E1) Business System Administrator to support the design, implementation and ongoing support of the platform. As an integral member of the E1 Core Team, this administrator will be responsible for engaging with PlanView and the Raytheon team on a day to day basis though the implementation phase of the program. Following successful implementation, the administrator will be responsible for maintenance, configuration, and troubleshooting Planview's EnterpriseOne CTM and PRM modules - often the result of Strategic Planning and Portfolio needs, end-user work requests, help desk tickets, process changes, and regular system upkeep. In addition to system administration responsibilities, the Administrator will provide oversight and support for integrations with other 3rd-Party tools, as well as, seeking opportunities to enhance the Planview EnterpriseOne tool features and functions.

Responsible for maintenance, configuration, and troubleshooting Planview - often the result of Strategic Planning and Portfolio needs, end-user work requests, help desk tickets, process changes, and regular system upkeep. Participates and contributes to process improvement initiatives by proposing and/or undertaking system configuration changes that support the overall improvement initiative. Helps end users understand system processes and usage rules, as well as, enforcing those processes and rules. Supports the Planview team in communicates maintenance windows and outages to impacted end users. Establishes and documents system support procedures, including level-1 help desk procedures. Adheres to established SLAs when responding to help desk tickets and identifies the root cause of system problems. Proficient in the understanding of the systems' back-end processes and underlying data, such that he/she can provide insight during improvement initiatives, as well as effective troubleshooting when problems arise.

Essential Functions
Configures the system to support Digital Technology needs, user requests, process changes, and improvement initiatives
Develop and administer enterprise wide onboarding training, recurring refresher training
Perform in-depth analysis in current state setup, workflows and capabilities with the goal of enhancing the usage of Planview to match scaled agile framework setup from Request in-take, planning and strategies capability
Manages end user requests (e.g. system access requests, reports, research requests, job scheduling, etc.) and provides data analysis and queries to support IT and other business initiatives
Provides guidance and enforces system processes and usage rules
Performs regular system maintenance by supporting timely upgrades, communications, process updates.
Communicates system changes, maintenance windows, and outages to impacted end users
Supports large project initiatives in the role of the system's Subject Matter Expert. Proposes solutions related to the supported system, as well as, identifies risks related to proposed system changes.

Skills and Abilities


Ability to analyze and solve problems
Ability to read and/or listen and understand information and ideas communicated
Develops and delivers effective presentations
Present information and ideas to others clearly and understandably
Ability to effectively facilitate meetings, work sessions, and training
Aptitude to learn a new business and systems
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to create and maintain professional relationships within all levels of the organization (peers, work groups, customers, supervisors)
Ability to work independently and as a member of a team
Flexibility to operate and self-driven to excel in a fast-paced environment
Capable of multi-tasking, highly organized, with excellent time management skills
Detailed oriented with excellent follow-up practices
Technically savvy with ability to quickly learn new systems and effectively assume administrator responsibilities advanced required
SQL scripting or similar scripting capabilities (fundamental skills at minimum) intermediate required
System analysis capabilities (including data analysis) and process improvement capabilities (business and/or technical) advanced required


The Team

Our Core Technology Operations (CTO) team offers differentiated operate services for our clients with solutions to help organizations scale and optimize critical business operations, drive speed to outcome, deliver business transformation, and build resilience in an uncertain future.

Our operate services within CTO include:


Foundry Services: Operate services providing flexible, recurring resource capacity for client initiatives, projects, tasks, and enhancement
Managed Services: Operate services that provide ongoing maintenance, monitoring, and optimization for IT/Engineering applications & products


Qualifications Required


Bachelor's degree required Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Informatics or Engineering, other majors to be considered on an individual basis
Five (5) years or more System administration/configuration of the Planview Enterprise One Platform (preferred) or other similar SaaS PPM and EA platform administration or configuration experience
Three (3) years or more Experience in process improvement - whether in a business or technical environment required
Seven (7) years or more Experience working in an IT environment and having been exposed to various IT-related responsibilities and terminology required
Technically savvy with ability to quickly learn new systems and effectively assume administrator responsibilities advanced required
SQL scripting or similar scripting capabilities (fundamental skills at minimum) intermediate required
System analysis and process diagramming capabilities (including data analysis) and process improvement capabilities (business and/or technical) advanced required
Other System administrator certification(s) from commercially recognized product(s)
US Citizen/ Green Card
Travel up to 10% annually
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.


Additional Requirements


Engages in online, classroom, and/or self-training to continue developing system expertise
Performs other duties as assigned.

title: Physician Liaison - Novant Medial Group
desc:
Overview:
The role of the Physician Liaison is to foster strong collaborative relationships among providers and between providers and acute facilities of Novant Health within our service areas. The Liaison will have responsibility for ensuring an effective onboarding process for new providers joining the organization. The liaison will develop and improve relationships with physicians in the service area with the goal of enhancing referral processes for both inpatient and outpatient services with an emphasis on creating lasting partnerships that will allow Novant Health to provide remarkable, seamless care for the communities its serves. As well, the liaison will serve as a primary point of contact for market leaders, unaffiliated acute facility leaders and physicians with concerns or questions to ensure concerns are addressed in a timely manner. Come join a remarkable team where quality care meets quality service, in every dimension, every time.

#JoinTeamAubergine #NovantHealth Let Novant Health be the destination for your professional growth.

At Novant Health, one of our core values is diversity and inclusion. By engaging the strengths and talents of each team member, we ensure a strong organization capable of providing remarkable healthcare to our patients, families and communities. Therefore, we invite applicants from all group dynamics to apply to our exciting career opportunities.
Qualifications:
Education: 4 Year / Bachelors Degree, required. Graduate Degree, preferred. Master’s degree in business or healthcare.
Experience: Minimum of five years marketing, recruiting, liaison/referral or equivalent, preferred.
Additional Skills (required):
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills including critical thinking when addressing various situations that require improving or linking physicians and services
Excellent interpersonal relationship skills as well as written and oral communication skills
Portrays a professional image, particularly when interacting with patients, clients, physicians and team members
Trustworthy of confidential information and understanding of sensitive information
Respect for confidentiality and rights of patients
Willing to take informed risks and receptive to new ideas
Embraces change and acts as a change agent
Able to identify appropriate data and statistics for tracking and reporting and ability to interpret relevant data for communication and resolution
Strong organizational skills and ability to establish priorities
Proficient in public-speaking
Ability to understand customer needs and expectations and knowledge for pathways to improvement that will exceed the customer’s expectations
Ability to work with dual reporting structure as feedback and direction will be received from market, acute, institute and NHMG leaders
Able to track performance metrics such as Provider Engagement, Provider Satisfaction, Provider Retention and Referral data to monitor team performance and address areas of opportunity for improvement
Responsibilities:
It is the responsibility of every Novant Health team member to deliver the most remarkable patient experience in every dimension, every time.
Our team members are part of an environment that fosters team work, team member engagement and community involvement.
The successful team member has a commitment to leveraging diversity and inclusion in support of quality care.
All Novant Health team members are responsible for fostering a safe patient environment driven by the principles of "First Do No Harm".

title: Medicare Product Analyst
desc:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.
Position Purpose:
Support the product team’s focus on offering quality, competitive product solutions for growth and retention of our marketplace members. Provide tactical, operational, execution and analytical support for assigned Medicare product portfolio. Responsible for delivering compliant products to market while supporting business goals and objectives.
Perform product-related operational tasks by assisting with new product development and product feature updates, providing data, assembling reports, and regulatory filings.
Develop trust-based relationships and collaborates with other functional areas to collect information, in addition to acting as a lead on sub-projects and smaller initiatives ensuring timelines, internal alignment and all risks are escalated as needed for project deliverables.
Conduct basic qualitative and quantitative analysis on commercial product performance, market share, and general competitor information to align internal stakeholders on the success of our Products as well as to shape changes to the product portfolios supporting growth goals.
Research competitor products, performs regulatory compliance analysis, and disseminates information with recommendations to team and partners to support product success fueled by deep industry knowledge and insights.
Lead the administration of meetings, follow defined policies and procedures, use designated team tools, and monitor regulatory rules and requirements.
Ensure a fully compliant commercial product portfolio, at the state and federal levels by implementing the required changes into the product portfolios through benefit configuration and project documentation.
Our Comprehensive Benefits Package:
Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility
Competitive pay
Paid Time Off including paid holidays
Health insurance coverage for you and dependents
401(k) and stock purchase plans
Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development
Education/Experience:
Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience.
2+ years of insurance, insurance operations, sales operations, business analysis, key performance indicators, and portfolio management experience or related experience.
Healthcare industry experience preferred.


Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Business Development Sales Representative
desc:
DH Pace Company, will hire a Business Development Manager in Charlotte, North Carolina who is experienced at closing sales. Work in sales for a recognized brand and industry leader offering best in class product and sales training that will put you on the road to success! DH Pace is one of the world's most recognized leaders in commercial door solutions and we are currently seeking a motivated sales representative to sell our well known, high quality products.
Job Responsibilities:
Business to Business Sales presentations with industrial and commercial businesses using a consultative sales approach
Analyze each customer's door problems; meet with decision makers to influence the purchase of our comprehensive line of doors and door building related products
Promptly follow up to close customer projects and participate in project management when necessary
Be responsible for achieving sales objectives
Job Requirements:
Bachelor's degree preferred, but not required
Prefer a minimum of two (5) years outside sales experience
Excellent communication skills and be able to interact professionally with contacts, internal and external, at all levels and possess a high sense of urgency with exceptional problem solving skills
Ability to multi-task and work efficiently in a fast-paced work environment
Strong aptitude for technical applications and mechanical systems preferred
Why DH Pace?
DH Pace Company is a distribution, construction and service organization offering a complete range of door and door related products and commercial security products. The company is privately owned and has been in operation over 95 years! We have 50 US offices in 24 states with company-wide sales in 2021 of $740M.
We set the tone for success, reward hard work and put employees first:
Exposure to tenured DH Pace leaders will invest time in training and development.
Access to online training material to enhance professional skills and product knowledge
Advancement and transfer opportunities
Competitive compensation
Comprehensive total benefits package and corporate wellness program
PTO Plan - 16 days accrued annually after 1 year of service! 10 days accrued annually to start!
Successful completion of references, employment verifications, background check, and drug screen required in advance of hire.
Behaviors
Preferred
Loyal: Shows firm and constant support to a cause
Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well
Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity
Motivations
Preferred
Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help
Goal Completion: Inspired to perform well by the completion of tasks
Flexibility: Inspired to perform well when granted the ability to set your own schedule and goals
Financial: Inspired to perform well by monetary reimbursement
Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Care Worker
salary:
Job details
Salary
$22.15 - $38.14 an hour
Job Type
Full-time
desc:
We are currently seeking Care Workers to serve members in Mecklenburg county.
Care Workers support Alliance Complete Care by ensuring that members are linked with and engaged in recommended services and supports. Care Workers assist members with various interventions under the care plan by removing administrative barriers to care, monitoring authorized services, and helping members transition to community-based settings.
This position will allow the successful candidate to work a schedule which will include both onsite as well as remote work certain days of the week as approved by their supervisor.
Responsibilities & Duties
Complete assessments and screenings
Complete all assessments to identify whether member is receiving the services which will best match their identified needs
Complete required Screening Tools
Retrieve and review historical data to better-understand member’s treatment history
Collaboration with the Alliance Care Team and Provider Networks
Attend all required meetings related to care planning and provider engagement
Notify Care Manager of any new service needs identified during service monitoring
Work with the Provider Network department to provide technical assistance or to discuss concerns to resolve identified issues
Engage with Providers
Identify barriers to service delivery at the member level and work toward individualized resolution with both the member and provider
Ensure that assessments, person-centered plans, discharge plans, and crisis plans are completed and shared with providers with whom the individuals are linked
Report changes in member’s health status to authorized providers
Service Monitoring
For Medicaid C services: conduct face to face, field-based observation of the member’s experience with service delivery per the frequency and requirements outlined in the Medicaid C waiver and Home and Community-based Services (HCBS) standards
For non-Medicaid C services: complete (a) Provider Engagement Tool to assess provider support needs (to engage member in services) and (b) interventions to resolve administrative barriers to care
Review service utilization and documentation as required by the member’s program enrollment to monitor progress toward individualized goals and fulfillment of the intent of the service authorized
Complete Documentation
Maintain medical record compliance/quality
Ensure timely documentation of Care Coordination activities as required by department policy and procedures
Compliance with Alliance Policy and Procedure
Adhere to all Alliance Organizational Policies and Procedures and Care Management Desk Procedures
Minimum Education & Experience required-
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a Human Services field and two (2) years of I/DD and Innovations Waiver experience with the population served.
Or
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a non-Human Services field and four (4) years of I/DD and Innovations Waiver experience with the population served.
Or
Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in a Human Services field and one (1) year of I/DD and Innovations Waiver experience with the population served.
Special Requirements-
Current, valid drivers license
Certification in NACCM, NADD-Specialist, and/or CBIS required within 12 months of hire
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
Knowledge of Medicaid basic, enhanced MHSUD, and waiver benefits plans
Knowledge of and skilled in the use of Motivational Interviewing techniques
Person Centered Thinking/planning
High level of diplomacy and discretion is required to effectively negotiate and resolve issues with minimal assistance.
Proficient in Microsoft Office products (such as Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)
Conflict management and resolution skills
Strong interpersonal and written/verbal communication skills
Strong problem solving, negotiation, arbitration and conflict resolution skills are essential to balance the needs of both internal and external customers.
Conflict management and resolution skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office products (such as Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)
Ability to understand macro and micro level planning, maintaining both the big picture and seeing that the details are covered.
Detail oriented,
Ability to organize multiple tasks and priorities.
Ability to change the focus of his/her activities to meet changing priorities.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office products (such as Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.) is required
Ability to be flexible and adaptable.
Knowledge of regulations and statutes specific to 1915(b) and (c) waiver services including licensure type required for facility-based services, and staffing and supervision requirements (LTS and TBI Care Workers only)

title: Staff Program Control Analyst-Hybrid
desc:
Applied Research Associates (ARA), Inc. is seeking a qualified Staff Program Control Analyst to join the project management team at ARA’s Software Enterprise Division (SED) Raleigh, NC location. This is a permanent full-time position and provides the selected candidate an opportunity to interact with a vibrant team of engineering & science professionals working on exciting new technologies. At ARA, we strive to hire colleagues who not only have the right skills, but who also demonstrate our core values of passion, freedom, service, and growth. As a Staff Program Control Analyst on our team, you are the backbone of our program teams that serve our customers within the defense and national security industries.
ARA's Software Enterprise Division (SED) in Raleigh, NC is a looking for a permanent, full-time Program Control Analyst with demonstrated experience working with project managers and principal investigators to perform budget analysis, cost projections, material estimates, and man-hour estimates for contract and FAR compliance. This person will also be responsible for project finance reporting both internally to the project management team and SED management as well as to customers through reports and presentations. Working with corporate purchasing and subcontracting personnel, the selected candidate will assist in the preparation of purchase requisitions (PRs), subcontracts, consulting agreements, contract modifications, and purchase orders for projects, using corporate templates and following established company guidelines. In addition, the selected candidate may assist SED project managers in negotiating, executing, monitoring, and closing-out purchase orders, subcontracts, consulting agreements, and intercompany work authorization agreements.
At a minimum, we are seeking candidates with a Bachelor's Degree, or higher, in a related field with five to seven years of related work experience. Candidates must be self-motivated with the ability to work proactively and achieve results without close supervision. Additionally, candidates must be organized individuals with excellent attention to detail, the ability to multi-task, and the capacity to change priorities quickly and work effectively under deadlines. Excellent written and verbal communications skills are a must, with the ability to establish effective working relationships with staff located both here in Raleigh and at other ARA facilities located around the country.
Staff Program Control Analyst Required Experience & Skills:
Candidates must have the following skills and attributes to be considered for this position -
Selected candidates must be U.S. Citizens and may be subject to government security. Candidates must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting, or a related degree along with 5-7 years of relevant experience. AS will be considered with 7+ years of experience
Ability to manage competing priorities and complete assigned tasking within required timelines
Self-directed, detail-oriented, and a problem solver
Experience preparing & monitoring project budgets and costs
Experience negotiating, executing, monitoring, and closing-out subcontracts or large procurements
High proficiency in MS Excel
Beginner level (or higher) experience using MS SharePoint or similar file-sharing applications
Demonstrated knowledge/experience in FAR/DFAR requirements
Staff Program Control Analyst Desired Experience & Skills:
Candidates with one or more of the following skills or attributes will receive additional consideration -
Demonstrated expertise in preparing procurement requests
Demonstrated expertise in developing cost proposals and/or generating price quotes
Experience with the federal government purchasing and contracting procedures
Master’s in business administration degree
Project Management Professional (PMP) or Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) certified
Above all, we value passion, a desire to learn, and teamwork. We are confident that if you possess the right attitude, work ethic, and skillset you could succeed in this role.
Team Information:
As a member of Division Operations, this role will support the Software Enterprise Division’s (SED) growing business portfolio. Duties will include:
Budget tracking, forecasting, and other financial analysis tasks for an assigned portfolio of projects
Preparing and updating project finance & management plans based on executed contracts and contract modifications
Compiling, recording, analyzing, submitting, tracking, and closeout of supplier agreements and invoicing for direct purchases and subcontracts
Developing cost proposals and quotes based on ARA standard estimating practices and input from project managers
About Us:
Applied Research Associates, Inc. (aka ARA) is an employee-owned international research and engineering company known for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems in the physical sciences. We were founded in Albuquerque, NM in 1979 as the disco era was, thankfully, closing out and the personal computer era was beginning. We employ over 1,500 professionals and continue to grow. ARA offices throughout the U.S. and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense, civil, and health technologies, computer software, and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement.
ARA also prides ourselves on having a challenging culture where innovation & experimentation are the norm. At ARA, employees are our greatest assets, so we give our employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take active roles as owners. The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. The company realizes employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels. We are also very proud of our Women’s Initiative Network (WIN) whose purpose is to motivate, support, and encourage professional career development for women to maximize career and professional accomplishments.
To find out more about the Software Enterprise Division visit our website at: https://www.ara.com/raleigh/

title: GIS Data Analyst I
desc:
More than a career - a chance to make a difference in people's lives.
Build an exciting, rewarding career with us – help us make a difference for millions of people every day. Consider joining the Duke Energy team, where you'll find a friendly work environment, opportunities for growth and development, recognition for your work, and competitive pay and benefits.
Provides support role in data processes (data analysis, maintenance, development, audits) for transmission, distribution and, substation systems and substation equipment to ensure that all data and applications are delivered consistently, that the data management system’s data standards are used, Service Level Agreements are observed, and process improvements are realized to ensure that the Power Delivery departments receive data and applications that can be fully utilized to maximize their value to the business. As such, incumbent must gain knowledge of the data maintained within the supported database systems and knowledge of the physical electric power system equipment and maintenance and construction activities which that data represents.
This functional job family (Data Analyst-Power Delivery) has the lead responsibility for data quality, data analysis and data training development efforts. Key activities for this position include: (1) maintaining, querying, reporting and analyzing data from a number of data management systems, (2) administering the data management systems, (3) support the operation, maintenance and construction of the electric power delivery system.
Individuals in this position will assist in evaluating the technical aspects of software purchase decisions, as well as assisting in identifying data requirements for installation of the system at Duke Energy. Individuals will assist in the testing of such systems to ensure that the new system will function with other business applications existing at Duke. Continued data management for those installed vendor applications will also be a function of this position.
Responsibilities
Process Management: Carries out individual assignments of a less complex nature executing appropriate system applications & data processes.
Receives work assignments and works with review and direction.
Work is defined with prescribed process instruction.
Administers, develops reports, and analyzes equipment data, preventative maintenance schedules, and work orders within the computerized software systems that are mainframe, PC, and/or network-based applications.
Project Management: Carries out individual assignments of a less complex nature to meet established work schedules.
Receives work assignments and works with review and direction.
Work is defined with little freedom of action.
Administers, develops reports, and analyzes equipment data, preventative maintenance schedules, and work orders within the computerized software systems that are mainframe, PC, and/or network-based applications.
Customer Support: Resolves less complex problems that have been identified and isolated.
Provides technical expertise and guidance to department personnel on use of the computerized software systems.
Assists in delivery of customized training, including communicating information to field personnel.
Delivers high-quality results in a timely manner, meeting or exceeding established deadlines or promised data.
Establishes and maintains open communications and effective working relationships with Managers, Supervisors, and individual contributors within the “customer” departments within Duke Energy.
Proactively understands and fulfills the needs of the “customers”.
Infrastructure: Acquires knowledge of infrastructure-related issues.
Demonstrates increasing knowledge of infrastructure functions
Operations: Acquires knowledge of operations-related issues.
Demonstrates increasing knowledge of operations functions.
Power Delivery Business Support: Acquires knowledge of applications used by the power delivery business, and the associated data & business processes.
Demonstrates increasing knowledge of applications used by the power delivery business, including the data & business processes.
Organizational Skills:
Uses time effectively in completing individual work assignments to meet established task schedules.
Uses good judgement in making decisions on assigned work activities which have limited business impact.
Effectively solves less complex problems which have typically been previously identified.
Teamwork:
Works well (good listener, approachable, and has basic interpersonal skills) with those in immediate work group and work contacts within assigned section.
Communications:
Demonstrates good listening skills, puts forth effort to understand others and points of view.
Organizes thoughts well and clearly communicates in basic oral and written communications.
Typical audience is assigned work group and/or section.
Proactively communicates to keep supervisor, co-workers, departmental management and “customers” informed of ongoing activities and emergent issues.
Basic/Required Qualifications
Associates degree in GIS, IT or similar
In lieu of the degree, High School/GED and 2 years related work experience
Desired Qualifications
Bachelors degree in GIS, IT or similar and 3 years related work experience
GIS experience
Duke Energy work experience
Experience in the utility industry.
Transmission experience is a plus.
Additional Preferred Qualifications
Successfully completed college-level or certification courses in database systems, data structures, and data querying and reporting tools
Exceeding minimum qualifications outlined in major accountabilities section
Demonstrated strong working knowledge of the transmission and distribution systems, substations and substation equipment and associated safety and maintenance policies, practices and procedures
Demonstrated ability to work with a variety of individuals from various socio-economic, cultural and ethnic backgrounds
Demonstrated ability to work with numerous organizational levels of personnel both within and external to the company (e.g. Substation supervisors, managers, Mechanics/Electricians, Engineers and Technical Analysts’ Storeroom/Procurement personnel; sales, customer service, and other vendor personnel)
Demonstrated excellent interpersonal skills with ability and willingness to share information and transfer knowledge to others
Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated working knowledge of software applications such as Microsoft Office products and familiarity with retrieving all applicable corporate information.
Demonstrated effective leadership skills.
Working Conditions
Hybrid Mobility Classification – Work will be performed from both remote and onsite locations after the onboarding period. However, hybrid employees should live within a reasonable daily commute to a Duke Energy facility.
Travel Requirements
Not required

title: Director of Operations
desc:
Summary:
Atlantic Medical Management (AMM) is currently seeking an experienced Director of Operations. AMM is a corporate medical management firm that is dedicated to improving patient care. This position will be responsible for managing the operational functions, activities, and projects. Responsibilities encompass managing, scheduling, planning, and coordinating the operations of clinical staff, planning internal space requirements, and serve as a liaison with external health facilities. This position is based out of the Cary, NC corporate office and may require travel around Eastern North Carolina.
Essential Duties:
Leads and manages clinic staff and operations to ensure the delivery of quality patient care.
Effectively communicates with clinic management, staff, physicians, and patients. Works to improve the patient and employee experience at the clinical practice.
Ensures compliance with all federal, state and local regulations.
Applies communication skills to effectively connect with staff to ensure the dissemination of policies, procedures, and other pertinent information; work closely with Clinic Manager to ensure clinical staff training requirements are obtained as required by clinic guidelines and procedures; accountable for implementation of new operational guidelines approved by the QI committee, to improve the quality of patient care provided by the practice.
Ensures safe and efficient operation of the clinic including office and clinical equipment.
Responsible for supervising the coordination and scheduling of laboratory, diagnostic and imaging studies including prior authorizations.
Accountable for managing medical supply cost; order medical supplies and equipment as approved by CEO; meet with pharmaceutical representative and vendors to review invoices and pricing, demonstration of next generation of drugs, medicine, and medical equipment.
Monitor Provider Approval Queue (PAQ) for physicians to ensure labs and reports are signed off and completed as required by standing orders and procedures; Assign out of office status when warranted.
Supervises and evaluates daily work of custodial workers; regularly inspects all assigned areas to ensure work is performed properly and orderly by the hired custodial contractor.
Responsible for the supervision of maintenance workers in the overall upkeep and maintenance of the exterior and interior of company facilities.
Supervises and evaluates scheduled upkeep and maintenance of grounds is conducted in accordance with hired landscaping contractor.
Manage daily clinic operations; review workflow; review and record daily productivity of clinic.
Accountable for creating and managing monthly physicians and physician extenders work schedule.
Using data and NextGen reporting capability, accountable for understanding and using population health data to improve and enhance access and continuity of care at the clinic practice.
Accountable for monitoring, approving, and submitting hourly employee timecards and physician contractor schedules on a bi-weekly basis; Monitors attendance of clinic staff and adjusts staffing as necessary.
Conducts annual and periodic performance evaluations for LPNs and MAs; and provides guidance as needed.
Provide quarterly status reports on vacation time, professional leave and sick time of physicians and physician extenders to CEO.
Liaison with college representatives in coordinating externship of nursing and medical assistant students.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree is Administration or Health related field with 2 years of job-related experience (or 5 years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree), 1 year must include supervisory experience.
Effective verbal and written communication on all levels and both internally and externally.
Self-motivated, analytical, quick learner, organized, detail-oriented, multi-tasker.
Active listener that is able to analyze, negotiate, and respond appropriately to the message being communicated.
Benefits:
Medical, Dental, Vision Coverage
Life Insurance
Paid Time Off
Long Term Disability
401K Plan
Job Type: Full-time
Experience
Preferred
1 year(s): Management
Education
Preferred
Bachelor of Arts or better in Health Administration or related field

title: Oliver Wyman - Executive Assistant - Raleigh, NC
desc:
Oliver Wyman is a global leader in management consulting. With offices in 60 cities across 29 countries, Oliver Wyman combines deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise in strategy, operations, risk management, and organization transformation. Our 5000 professionals help clients optimize their business, improve their operations and risk profile, and accelerate their organizational performance to seize the most attractive opportunities. Oliver Wyman’s thought leadership is evident in our agenda-setting books, white papers, research reports, and articles in the business press. Our clients are the CEOs and executive teams of the top Global 1000 companies.
Visit our website for more details about Oliver Wyman: www.oliverwyman.com
Job Overview:
Oliver Wyman is looking for an Executive Assistant to act as a point of contact for our Partners to help them meet their business goals and objectives. You will coordinate efforts to help the flow of business operations. Partners depend on you to collaborate with all parts of the business. Executive Assistants work closely with colleagues to share information and provide consistency. As an Executive Assistant, you will provide administrative support to 2-4 Partners.
This position will be based out of the Raleigh, North Carolina office and work remotely though periodically being required to go into the office for meetings, trainings and other community-building activities as needed.
Key Responsibilities:
Client Impact
Viewed by clients as responsive; acting as central point of contact for Partners
Complete a variety of administrative tasks including; managing extremely detailed and intricate calendars, booking business travel and appointments, organizing video conferences, processing expense reports and vendor invoices and maintaining trusted CRM data
Deliver a positive service experience to clients and work to build and maintain trusted relationships
Develop a knowledge base of projects, key clients and internal support functions to support Partners goals and objectives
Trust Based Teaming
Build productive relationships with colleagues, understanding expectations and demonstrating commitment to team, including providing back-up coverage as needed
Approachable and demonstrates a positive attitude
Listens to others and is open to and respectful of all views
Demonstrates inclusive behaviors
Work Smart
Completes work to agreed standards
Prioritize workload to deliver results on time
Identify and escalate risks as necessary in accordance with company policies and procedures
Communication and Influence
Convey clear written and verbal messages; presenting information in a way that is easy for others to understand
Actively listen and seek clarification as needed
Fair and respectful when communicating with others
Development and Leadership
Attend trainings and firm events
Respond to feedback and seek guidance as needed
Set a positive example and acknowledge good work
Experience Required:
2+ years of previous administrative or customer service experience
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office suite, including Word, Outlook and PowerPoint
Bachelors’ Degree or equivalent experience
Skills and Attributes:
Thoughtful judgment and ability to have an owner’s mentality while being courteous and caring
Strong organizational skills that demonstrate the ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks
Detail-oriented, even when the work is fast-paced
Resourceful, takes proactive approaches to problem-solving with strong decision-making capabilities
Positive demeanor and superior written and verbal communication skills are essential
Solid time-management abilities with the ability to prioritize tasks
Possess a positive attitude and be willing to work as part of a team
Able to work with different personalities.
Ability to speak a second language is an asset

title: Operations Specialist
desc:
Title: Operations Specialist
Location: NC/SC, US
Job Type: Full-time with Benefits

Who We Are:
We are MSX International – a leading, global provider of technology-enabled business process outsourcing (BPO) services to automotive manufacturers. For more than 25 years, MSX International has worked closely with vehicle manufacturers around the world. With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries worldwide, our teams provide industry leading expertise. We have combined our deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technology solutions to help our automotive clients increase revenue and reduce cost, while enhancing operational efficiency and customer satisfaction. Our goal is to help our customers reach their full potential and to excel as their global partner of choice.

What’s in it for you? When you join our team, you become part of the MSX International, Inc. family. It’s more than a job – it’s the opportunity to build a career, make a difference, and be part of an exciting industry.

SUMMARY
MSX International is seeking an Operations Specialist who will be responsible for the professional delivery, installation and sustainment of MSX International Express Service prescribed solutions.

RESPONSIBILITIES
The Operations Specialist is the lead liaison with FCSD Zone Manager. The Specialist will be responsible for developing and maintaining a direct relationship with specifically assigned dealers, attend regional FCSD Organization meetings quarterly, support launch and performance manager in planning meetings and Quick Lane launches, along with implementing plans to achieve regional objectives.

The Operations Specialist will provide primary operational support to assigned Quick Lanes within Region:
Attend Annual Business Plan Meetings
Create and Work Quick Lane Action Plans
Conduct Repair Order Analysis as needed
Develop Quarterly Marketing Plan and Monitor Adherence
Ensure Scheduling of Quarterly Quick Lane Sales Events
Ensure current Quick Lane POS is updated and displayed
Work with Quick Lane Manager to conduct periodic Competitive Ad and Price Surveys
Review and approve Co-op claims
Work with Quick Lane on Search Engine Optimization and Landing Page Claiming
Monitor and motivate Quick Lane Contest and Incentive performance
Manage tire sales processes at each Quick Lane
Create and maintain Tire Screen
Assist with TIM Tool set-up and monitor
Conduct periodic inventory review and arrange for inventory swap as needed
Establish Good/Better/Best Lineup
Ensure adequate Tire Displays and current pricing (Indoor/Outdoor)
Conduct on-site training as needed
Ensure Quick Lane team completion of all required STARS courses
VCU Training (including inspection skills)
RIM and ¼ Time
Telephone Sales Skills
Customer Handling
Tire Sales Skills
Brake Sales Skills
Credit Card Solicitation Skills
Conduct operational review on every visit
Action Plan review
KPI and Sales Performance review
Op code usage and submission
Workflow Processes
Service Times
VCU and Sales Skills
Provide visit summaries to Dealer, District Operations Manager and FCSD Region
Complete all administrative tasks in a timely manner
Run Quick Lane as needed

QUALIFICATIONS
Qualified candidates must be highly motivated, self-starters who possess excellent customer relationship, communication and facilitation skills, with a high degree of interest in working in a field environment with minimal supervision. The successful candidate must also reflect an exceptional track record and attributes that includes:

Will possess Aftermarket Experience, preferably Retail Tire Store Management experience
OEM dealer contact experience is a plus, as well as excellent verbal and written communication skills
This position requires proficiency with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Internet Explorer
Ability to leverage relationships to identify and sell the business case for change
Analyzing data from dealer financials and operational assessments to establish improvement action plans
Implementation of service advisor selling systems and overall process improvement solutions at the aftermarket or retail level
Ability to understand, establish and implement effective metrics to keep dealerships focused on growth and ROI
Demonstrated proficiency with PC applications in a Windows environment
Ability to train and utilize all aspects of Automotive Tire Sales and automotive service sales
Ability to influence the sales personnel and technicians in the training processes and monitoring the results
EDUCATION REQUIREMENT
Bachelor's degree (preferred)

WORK ENVIRONMENT
80% Travel required
Overnight travel required
Have ability to equally accommodate working from home office or remote location
MSX International is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer committed to employing a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you are interested in this position apply here
https://careers.msxi.com
#MSXNAJobs

title: Government Affairs Manager
desc:
DAK Americas is a globally competitive supplier of Terephthalic acid (TPA) - Monomers, Polyethylene Terephthalate Resins (PET & Recycled PET ) and Polyester Staple Fibers (PSF) for the western hemisphere. The company is headquartered in Charlotte, NC with manufacturing facilities in the Carolinas, Mississippi, Indiana, and Pennsylvania.
DAK Americas is a division of [ Link removed ] - URL blocked - click to apply, the petrochemicals and synthetic fibers business group of [ Link removed ] - URL blocked - click to apply, one of Mexico's largest corporations.
Position Responsibilities
In order to generate the greatest contribution to PET Promotion & Governmental Affairs, the successful candidate will be responsible for the following items:
Developing Strong Business Acumen
Gain foundational knowledge and understanding of our products, markets, technologies as well as our domestic and international locations.
Understand the unique and sustainable benefits of our products, markets, technologies and maximize the promotion or such across legislative bodies to foster positive PET positioning.
Building & Maintaining Key Internal Partnerships
Establish and maintain relationships with individuals across various levels of our organization.
Supports PET Promotion & Public Affairs Director in relationship and message building and collaboration at targeted audiences
Government Affairs Consultant
Collaborate with necessary parties(Lobbyist & Consultants) to coordinate governmental affairs and trade relations activities to foster the successful positive positioning of PET in federal, state & local legislations.
Ensures all communications and marketing materials align with to corporate guidelines and legal requirements.
Supports the implementation of communications initiatives through the creation of creative content (both digital and print).
Ownership of Governmental Legislation & Policy Communications Material & Initiatives
Act as a point of contact for government and policy communications requests.
Collaboration to support legislation & policy initiatives.
Additional Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Assist with other duties & assignments within Public Affairs as needed.
Identify and pursue communications initiatives that support company culture build brand recognition and awareness.
Job Requirements:
Requirements:
Bachelor level degree in Communications, Public Relations or Marketing.
5+ years of experience in marketing communications, advertising, corporate communications, public relations, media relations, brand marketing, or related field.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to interact effectively with all levels of internal and external stake holders.
Previous press release, editing and proofreading experience.
Effective presentation and facilitation skills.
Successfully work in a fast paced environment and able to deal with ambiguity and change.
Ability to effectively work within a team environment and as an individual contributor and leader.
Intermediate to Advanced skill with MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Preferred:
Proficient in Spanish (verbal and written communication). French and Portuguese also beneficial.
Experience with Adobe Creative Suite.
DAK Americas LLC is subject to US Department of Commerce export regulations and thus must hire individuals who meet national security requirements. Interested applicants (or temporary employees) must meet eligibility requirements. DAK Americas LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Community & Business Engagement Manager
desc:
Goodwill Industries of Central North Carolina works to enhance the dignity and quality of life of individuals and families by strengthening communities, eliminating barriers to opportunity, and helping people reach their full potential through learning and the power of work.
Goodwill Industries is invested in developing productive networks of community and business partners to collaborate in our mission of improving lives and enriching communities through the power of work. The Community & Business Engagement Manager is responsible for the development and enhancement of relationships with employers, service providers, and professional associations to support career development initiatives and the Goodwill mission. This person will help create organizational strategies that meets community and area labor needs, and will partner and coordinate with partners as appropriate to maximize local resources. Operating in alignment with the fund development strategies of the organization, this position will also have responsibilities for identifying, cultivating, soliciting, and stewarding organizational relationships. Activities of this person will ensure the Goodwill brand is enhanced through established engagement processes and will lead to organizational growth and increased community impact.
This position will operate out of Goodwill s Home Office located at 1235 S. Eugene St., Greensboro, NC. Regular travel throughout our five-county territory is required, including: Guilford, Alamance, Randolph, Rockingham, and Caswell Counties.
Essential Functions: To be successful, the Community and Business Engagement Manager must be very organized, able to multi-task, and excel at communication and relationship management. Key responsibilities and activities:
Builds meaningful partnerships with employers in various industries to enhance the career opportunities for individuals experiencing barriers to employment.
Develops, plans, executes, and analyzes organizational priorities and activities supporting the development of impactful, outcome-based community and business relationships.
Cultivates new business relationships through cold-calling, site visits, networking, informational interviews, etc. to engage organizations around activities supporting Goodwill s mission.
Represents the agency at community events, resource fairs, chamber meetings, etc.
Performs a variety of office and administrative duties including data collection, communications, correspondence, report preparation, etc.
Displays strong professional work behavior both internally and externally that aligns with Together is Better and our five core values: Passion, Integrity, Collaboration, Stewardship, and Compassion.
Develops goals, benchmarks, strategic plans, processes, forms, and staff development, as it relates to community and business engagement; leads successful execution of each.
Facilitates education and information sharing regarding labor market trends, local hiring needs, and resources.


Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor s Degree from an accredited college or university in education, human services, sociology, psychology, business management, or related field. Associate Degree and three years related experience, or high school diploma and four years related experience, may be considered in lieu of Bachelor s Degree.
3-years experience developing robust business networks resulting in program-specific deliverables and outcomes, including experience using customer relationship management or donor database(s). Experience in workforce development, developing contracts/MOUs, and/or project management preferred.
2-years experience working directly to enhance the mission-based work of nonprofit or social services organizations through operations, community advocacy, fundraising, or volunteer management.
Excellent skills and understanding of technology, digital skills needed for today s careers, productivity software, digital trends, etc. Includes intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite; intermediate skills with database use, web-based learning platforms; knowledge of peripheral devices, digital platforms, tools, and software.
Excellent researching, organizational, presentation, and oral communication skills.
Ability to independently negotiate competing priorities and facilitate productive relationships with diverse teams.
Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills.
Ability to handle volatile customers and situations without input from others and in alignment with organizational mission, values, and philosophies.
Ability and willingness to attend after-hour events as scheduled.
Valid NC driver s license, acceptable driving record, reliable vehicle, & proof of personal vehicle insurance coverage.


Hours: Position is full-time. Work is generally conducted Monday-Friday, 8:00am-4:30pm, with occasional requirements for evening/weekend events.
Salary & Benefits: Salaried/exempt position, $45,000-$55,000 depending on experience and education. Benefits include 3 medical insurance plans, dental insurance, vision insurance, company paid life insurance, short- and long-term disability, long term care plan, 401k plan with up to 5% match, and educational assistance plan. We also offer numerous supplemental benefit plans such as extra life insurance, critical incident, cancer, identity theft, and legal assistance coverage as well as a pet insurance discount plan are available. Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) plan and 12 paid holidays are also provided.

title: Content Specialist - Mathematics
desc:
Description :
Provide assessment expertise in item and test development planning and customer interactions
Facilitate various client committee meetings (content review, data review, etc.) and provide content expertise during those sessions
Interpret standards, test blueprints, and item development plans
Develop item and test specifications documents
Develop and provide training and feedback to item writers based on established standards, cognitive complexity, and best practices for item development
Select, assign, and manage subcontracted item and content development

Work as a member of a team to develop, review, and revise ancillary materials

Provide source references and copyright research, if needed
Facilitate activities related to test construction and review of composed test forms
Work with test development managers, other content developers, psychometricians, and other Pearson groups
Consult with the client as required, including participation in planning, status, review meetings, etc.
Some travel may be required
Perform other duties as assigned
The anticipated starting salary range for Colorado-based individuals expressing interest in this position is at least $60k. This position is eligible to participate in an annual incentive program. Benefits available to eligible employees can be seen at: https://pearsonbenefitsus.com/
Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics or Education, or equivalent education & experience required
At least five years’ teaching experience in the field of mathematics required
Some experience in mathematics assessment and/or publishing is preferred
Must have outstanding verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work closely with clients
Must be able to propose problems/solutions to a variety of audiences
Must have excellent planning, organizational, and problem-solving skills, and ability to manage personal tasks within a project and schedule, and to adapt to unforeseen and unexpected requests or changes in priorities
Must have strong technology skills including working with Microsoft Excel, Adobe Pro, Microsoft Word; and confidence necessary to work with unfamiliar programs
Familiarity with the Common Core State Standards for Mathematics (CCSS-M) is preferred
General knowledge of test development including processing, scoring, and reporting of large-scale assessments is preferred
Experience working with technology enhanced items is preferred
Basic understanding of xml preferred
General knowledge of computer adaptive testing preferred
