title: Analyst, Insights
desc:
At NASCAR, you will find a community of passionate individuals who care about our sport and are united in seeing it grow.
NASCAR is looking to hire an Analyst, Insights. This person works across multiple projects on NASCAR Research & Insights team, contributing to and supporting highly visible initiatives around Social, Digital, Consumer, and other attitudinal and behavioral research platforms. The Analyst will craft a holistic data-based approach to inform key marketing decisions.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Aggregate and interpret social media, digital, and consumer research analytics, through a variety of hands-on data pulls within a broad suite of tools (Conviva, Meltwater, Zoomph, YouTube Analytics, Adobe, Comscore, Qualtrics, Nielsen, Simmons, et. al)
Create institutional knowledge around social media analytics for the Social Content team; share measurement results, provide independent opinion, and offer informed guidance to support company social efforts
Monitor fan conversations and user-generated content across social channels, using independent judgement and discretion to interpret and understand current fan sentiment and reactions
Contribute to all areas of the Research & Insights team, telling the story of fans, viewers, visitors, and followers to an industry-wide audience
Monitor social, traditional/earned and broadcast media for conversations relevant to NASCAR during race events; understand how social media conversation and engagement plays a role in the overall consumption of the sport
Follow week-to-week storylines of the sport to understand how all pieces of the business fit together on and off the track
Stay “tuned in” to both the company’s races and the sports world at large; watch or follow the company’s races, and other important live sporting events, on a year-round basis
Shape effective workflows with vendors/partners, in collaboration with department leadership
Create reporting templates to share results with internal and external stakeholders
Work effectively in a collaborative team environment while demonstrating a high level of attention to detail and accuracy
Show passion for NASCAR and for the data that the team is responsible for
Travel: Less than 5%
QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) from four (4) year college or university and minimum of four (4) years related experience within the digital/social media industry or consumer insights industry; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
COMPUTER SKILLS
Proficient on all Company provided hardware and software. Expertise in using social media. Knowledge and experience with web-based social and traditional media monitoring systems, including the ability to create Boolean-style searches. Demonstrated ability to learn new tools (may contribute to all tools across the Research & Insights team). Expertise in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint preferred.
OTHER QUALIFICATIONS
Analytical, with the ability to articulate the meaning of data findings for non-technical audience
Flexible, nimble and able to act quickly to urgent issues
Curious; eager to uncover new findings and information through creativity and innovative thinking
Passion for NASCAR and the broader sports world
Fast learner, a team player and very energetic with a positive outlook
Apply Now!
Learn more about this role and our team by applying at
www.careers.nascar.com
for consideration.

We are a company unlike any other. We want you to bring your experience, skills and passion to our close-knit, high-energy environment in which our employees thrive and where you can prosper. We know the key to our success is our employees and we offer highly competitive salaries, a solid benefits package focused on wellness, and opportunities for you to grow and develop both personally and professionally. It won’t take you long to find out that you are on the right track here at NASCAR!
NASCAR is committed to fostering a diverse work environment where all employees feel valued and empowered. NASCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO). We seek to attract and retain the best qualified people available. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, religion, sexual orientation, genetic information, pregnancy, veteran status or any basis that is protected by applicable law except where a bona fide occupational qualification exists.
Follow us on Twitter @NASCARJobs to stay current on all of our openings.

title: Human Resources Director for University Development and OneC...
desc:
The Human Resources Director for University Development and OneCarolina (HR Director) is responsible for the overall administration, coordination and evaluation of the human resources function within the University Development Office (UDO) and development-specific positions throughout the schools and units. Within UDO, this includes administering human resources policies, programs, and practices - planning, organizing, developing, implementing, coordinating and directing. UDO consists of 20+ departments (approximately 170 full-time employees when fully staffed) including Annual Giving, Application Development & Support, Campaign Management, Constituent Programs, Corporate & Foundation Relations, Donor Relations, Events, Fundraising Management, Gift Planning, Gift Services, Industry Relations, Infrastructure & Technology, Marketing & Communications, Operations, Parents Program, Prospect Management, Research & Analytics, Regional Programs, Scholarships & Student Aid, Talent Management, UNC Global, and Vice Chancellor's office. The position acts as a liaison with the University's office of human resources (OHR) and EEO in all areas of human resource management within UDO.This position serves as a strategic partner with the 30+ development operations within schools and units throughout UNC Chapel Hill to enhance their organizational and human resource needs relative to development-specific operations. This includes providing direction and counsel to deans, associate deans, lead development officers, directors and other senior officers while partnering with HR school/unit leads in job creation, classification, compensation, recruitment, talent acquisition, and performance management of approximately 200+ development staff. The HR Director will review development positions across campus to help ensure positions are looked at comprehensively, make strategic sense, and are not duplicative in nature.The position reports to the Associate Vice Chancellor of Business and Operations and has regular interaction with senior leadership throughout the University.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree and two years of progressively responsible professional human resources management experience; or equivalent combination of training and experience. All degrees must be from appropriately accredited institutions.

P014853

04/01/2022

title: Internal Communications Lead, Market Intelligence
desc:
Title: Internal Communications Lead Grade: 11 (Relevant to internal only) Location: DC, Charlottesville, Raleigh, Denver

As a truly global company with a dynamic story to tell that impacts economies and markets, S&P Global leans on a worldwide network of experienced communicat ions professional to share our narrative with our stakeholders. You will lead internal communications for S&P Global Market Intelligence (MI), the division with the largest employee population at the company. We are seeking a n excellent writer and storyteller who can operate in a fast-paced environment to develop effective, executive-ready content and act as a trusted communication partner.

Working closely with the Global Head of MI Communications, y ou will create, execute, and manage internal communication strategies to control the flow of information to our 11,000+ global employee population. Your work will help drive employee engagement , enhance our culture, promote our values, and enhance internal understanding of our division’s strategy . You will provide counsel to senior leaders and create targeted communications programs that clearly communicate business roadmaps, vision, goals, projects and executive updates . You will be a part of a global team that will flex and support your work, as you will for them. You be equally a strategist and tactician, comfortable developing communications strategy and rolling up your sleeves to implement communications programs.

Key Roles & Responsibilities
Lead the development of MI’s overall internal company messaging and tone, aligned with business and cultural priorities, ensuring they are consistent with the enterprise.
Operate with a global mindset that is educated and sensitive to geographic and cultural differences.
Plan, develop and execute global employee communications initiatives that bring the company’s narrative and culture to life, including through executive communications, the intranet, and internal events (town halls, panels, fireside chats, and roundtables).
Be a proactive team player that is able to take broad concepts and minimal direction to create dynamic and engaging communications plans .
Partner with the People team on key organizational change and business transformation activities to develop communications plans , FAQs, and key messages.
Continue to evolve and innovate our internal communications strategy and practices; align yourself with internal communications leads across the company to share best practices.
Put in place measurement tools and other means to identify and track progress and areas of improvement for internal communications programs.
Be agile, collaborative , transparent and assume positive intent across the team and internal stakeholders.
Advise multiple division senior executives as their Communications Business Partner, helping them strategize the communications activities around their internal visibility and their business priorities.
Partner with the Leadership Team, functional leaders, and the rest of the MI communications team to plan and prepare effective, thoughtful, and engaging executive communications that educate, inform, connect, and inspire employees.

Functional & Business Knowledge
8+ years of experience creating, managing and executing internal communications strategies across global companies
Understanding of the global financial markets and a willingness to learn and understand the S&P Global Market Intelligence business
Experience working across global teams and working closely with C-suite executives
Excellent writing and communications skills
Excellent inter-personal and relationship-building skills
Proactive, tactical, and creative in crafting strategy
Out-of-box thinking for determining the best channel to use for any kind of messaging – keen eye on developing new channels as needed.
Ability to prioritize tasks and work under tight deadlines
Solid working knowledge of communications vehicles and how to identify the right channel for a message and audience
Highly proficient digital literacy
Knowledge of basic CMS and social media is a plus
Knowledge of basic graphic design

The Team / The Business The Communications team has fostered a reputation of trust and critical to business success. Our team adapts to the needs of stakeholders, both external and internal. As a communications team we prioritize supporting the global team as a whole and achieving collective success. We have a professional, transparent culture supported by a strong leader and a terrific network of communications colleagues in sister divisions and at the corporate level. This is an ideal role for a communications professional who wants to be an integral part of a team that values hard work, helping one another, recognition and transparency.
Minimum & Preferred Education Bachelor's Degree with emphasis in Communications, Journalism, English or related fields .

Minimum Qualifications:
8+ years’ experience working in a corporate environment or Corporate Communications department
Project management.
Excellent writing, editing and presentation skills.
Detail-oriented.
Highly proficient in digital literacy.

S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $83,200 to $190,100. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location. In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan.

This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires .

S&P Global delivers essential intelligence that powers decision making. We provide the world’s leading organizations with the right data, connected technologies and expertise they need to move ahead. As part of our team, you’ll help solve complex challenges that equip businesses, governments and individuals with the knowledge to adapt to a changing economic landscape.
S&P Global Market Intelligence partners with customers to broaden their perspective and operate with confidence by bringing them leading data sources and technologies that embed insight in their daily work. S&P Global Ratings offers critical insights for credit, risk and sustainable finance solutions that are essential to translating complexity into clarity, so market participants can uncover opportunities. S&P Global Commodity Insights enables organizations to create long-term, sustainable value with data and insights for a complete view on the global energy and commodities markets. S&P Global Mobility turns invaluable insights captured from automotive data to help our clients understand today’s market, reach more customers, and shape the future of automotive mobility. S&P Dow Jones Indices provides iconic and innovative index solutions, bringing transparency to global capital markets. S&P Global Engineering Solutions solves for tomorrow’s challenges today by transforming workflows and end-user experiences with data, insights and technology.

-----------------------------------------------------------

Equal Opportunity Employer
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

US Candidates Only: The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

title: COMMUNICATIONS SPECIALIST
desc:
School of Medicine:
Established in 1930, Duke University School of Medicine is the youngest of the nation’s top medical schools. Ranked tenth among its peers, the School takes pride in being an inclusive community of outstanding learners, investigators, clinicians, and staff where traditional barriers are low, interdisciplinary collaboration is embraced, and great ideas accelerate translation of fundamental scientific discoveries to improve humanhealth locally and around the globe.

Comprised of 2,400 faculty physicians and researchers, the Duke University School of Medicine along with the Duke University School of Nursing and Duke University Health System create Duke Health . Duke Health is a world-class health care network. Founded in 1998 to provide efficient, responsive care, the health system offers a full network of health services and encompasses Duke University Hospital, Duke Regional Hospital, Duke Raleigh Hospital, Duke Primary Care, Private Diagnostic Clinic, Duke Home and Hospice, Duke Health and Wellness, and multiple affiliations.

This position may have an opportunity to work Remotely, Hybrid or In-Person. All Duke University remote workers must reside in one of the following states or districts: California; Florida; Georgia; Maryland; New York; North Carolina; South Carolina; Tennessee; Texas; Virginia or Washington, DC.

Communications Specialist, Research Communications and Training

Job summary:
The Research Communications Specialist brings value to Department of Medicine Research Administration (DOMRA) team by supporting various internal and external communications activities to advance program goals, promote best practice, and ensure alignment with multiple stakeholders, and report key milestones and deliverables.

DOMRA is seeking a collaborative and organized communicator with a keen eye for detail, the Research Communications Specialist is responsible for providing administrative support, project coordination, tracking and development of key Research communications products, such as emails, newsletters, stakeholder presentations, reports, website updates, blogs, presentations, and trainings. They work closely with Department research staff (investigators, grant managers, and others) and partners to deliver program updates and opportunities that keep stakeholders informed and engaged in the work of Department of Medicine (DOM) research teams. This role also works closely with DOM Central Communications Office on leadership messages and content dissemination opportunities that spotlight DOM research findings and program progress as a point of distinction for the broader Duke organization.

This role will have a dual reporting relationship to the Director of Research Administration and the DOM Director of Communications.

Primary Responsibilities :
Coordinate DOMRA communications and training activities in support of research program strategy, direction, and goals in partnership with DOM grant managers and the DOM communications team.
Research, identify, and implement best practices and improvement ideas in support of (1) ongoing Research communications and dissemination activities and (2) DOMRA program training activities.
Assist with department training on Research Communications processes as needed.
Assist with design, proofreading, and coordination of DOMRA communications such as policy, procedure, compliance, and training updates.
Meet with research team members (clients) to develop and design concepts for communications, gather information, discuss alternatives, gain approval
Maintain liaison with clients and other staff members, as well as vendors (e.g., illustrators, photographers, printers and writers), to communicate job specifications and ensure deadlines are met
Manage timelines and ensure that all materials are completed to the satisfaction of the internal/external client and follow relevant regulations, standard processes, policies, and procedures
Provide input for the development of proposals for new work and project budgets
As assigned by the Director of Research, review and edit communications created by others, including but not limited to: external facing emails, documents, presentations, and proposals.
Provide project coordination support across the team and documenting various processes, including dissemination plans and activities.
Serve as the administrator for DOMRA intranet and Microsoft Teams portal.
Monitor and maintain Research publications and list-servs, as assigned.
Assist with DOM Annual Report publication and other special projects, as assigned.
Create and maintain tracking databases or spreadsheets as needed.
Assist with website updates and maintenance, workshop and webinar planning and coordination as appropriate.
Advance the reputation of DOMRA through strategic use of social media such as Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn.
Reflect our DOM support for DEI initiatives in all communications and activities.
Other duties as assigned.

Preferred Qualifications
The ideal candidate must be a creative self-starter and have excellent communication skills and strong attention to detail
The candidate must be able to work with teams of people without having direct supervisory responsibilities
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to take initiative and work independently
Strong organizational and problem-solving skills
Excellent customer service skills
Ability to manage competing priorities
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers, managers and clients

Minimum Qualifications
Education
Work requires communication and marketing skills normally acquired through a bachelor's degree in a related field.
Experience
Work generally requires one year related experience in advertising, marketing, media, promotions or public relations. EXPERIENCE OR ANY OTHER EQUIVALENT COMBINATION OF RELEVANT EDUCATION AND/OR

title: Assistant Lake Program Supervisor
salary:
Job details
Salary
$39,799 a year
Job Type
Full-time
desc:
Description
Performs intermediate technical work planning and overseeing recreation and leisure outdoor, nature, and fishing activities at Salem Lake and surrounding properties; patrols lake, park, and trails for maintenance and general sanitation; and related work as apparent or assigned. Work is performed under the moderate supervision of the Lake Program Supervisor. Oversight is exercised over Lake Attendants and Recreation Leader.
Examples of Duties
Assists with developing and implementing programs and activities at Salem Lake and related properties.
Assists with completing park maintenance, collecting park fees, patrolling lake and surrounding properties enforcing park rules.
Assists with scheduling events and rentals for the marina.
Provides general assistance with fishing licenses.
Enforces water and boat safety rules.
Operates motorized boat for patrolling purposes.
Reports condition of the facilities, equipment, attendance, etc. to Lake Program Supervisor.
Follows and enforces all facility and park rules and policies at all times.
Reports and documents all significant events, problems, issues, or occurrences to immediate supervisor.
Acts as supervisor in the absence of the Lake Program Supervisor.
Typical Qualifications
Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree with coursework in recreation, natural science, or related field and moderate experience recreation facility usage, park management or conservation of natural science and/or resources, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Knowledge of the techniques and methods of fishing and boating practices; ability to develop partnerships with outside organizations; ability to develop and lead programs; ability to assist in enforcement of applicable park and city laws and regulations; knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and position specific software; ability to develop and maintain effective relationships with supervisors, co-workers, and members of the public.

Physical Requirements: This work requires the occasional exertion of up to 50 pounds of force; work frequently standing, walking, sitting, speaking or hearing and using hands to finger, handle or feel and occasionally requires stooping, kneeling, crouching or crawling and reaching with hands and arms; work has standard vision requirements; vocal communication is required for expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word and conveying detailed or important instructions to others accurately, loudly or quickly; hearing is required to perceive information at normal spoken word levels; visual inspection involving small defects and/or small parts, using of measuring devices, assembly or fabrication of parts within arms-length, operating machines work requires preparing and analyzing written or computer data, operating motor vehicles or equipment and observing general surroundings and activities; work frequently requires exposure to outdoor weather conditions; exposure to fumes or airborne particles and exposure to bloodborne pathogens and may be required to wear specialized personal protective equipment work is generally in a moderately noisy location (e.g. business office, light traffic).

title: Curriculum Development and Instructional Design Consultant
desc:
Job Details
Description
Curriculum Development and Instructional Design Consultant
Job Category: Technical
Date posted:

Background and Objectives of the Consultancy
USAID awarded a five-year, $160 million cooperative agreement to USP to sustainably strengthen medical product quality assurance systems in low- and middle-income countries, addressing the proliferation of poor-quality medical products that put millions of people at increased risk of illness or death and waste precious health system resources. The program—Promoting the Quality of Medicines Plus (PQM+)—builds on the successes of predecessor programs while adopting cutting-edge approaches to support countries worldwide in responding to an evolving pharmaceutical landscape.

To achieve the goal of PQM+, USP and its partners will work to strengthen governance and regulatory structures, optimize the allocation and use of resources, improve the supply of quality-assured medical products, and advance the global learning, policy, and operational agenda for medical product quality assurance. Importantly, PQM+ will work with local and regional organizations to build on-the-ground specialized expertise where it is needed most. Through PQM+, these partners will mature to become direct providers of technical assistance.
IntraHealth International is a core partner leading health workforce development and capacity building of local partners for transition awards. The consultant will work under the guidance of and in coordination with technical staff at USP, IntraHealth, and in-country stakeholders, ensure the timely delivery of activities, and provide progress reports contributing to high quality results and the overall success and integrity of the program.

Intrahealth seek to recruit a consultant to support curriculum development/Instructional Design activities in PQM+ countries. The consultant will be contracted through an Extended Services Agreement for a period of 12 months with a level of effort ceiling not to exceed 130 days. Work orders for individual assignments will be issued, specifying the scope of work, the period of performance, and the level of effort assigned to the activity.

Key Responsibilities
The consultant may be responsible for any or all of the following for any given assignment:
Work with the accountable advising SME, the technical lead, the implementing SME responsible for accurately facilitating the curriculum to design an engaging and highly participatory, training package
The SME may provide training materials, source materials and will be available for organizational, needs assessment, and review meetings to determine the most effective way to assess training needs as part of implementing an ADDIE like process.
Participate in the initial kick-off meeting and other work implementation meetings with the PQM+ and country teams, to discuss the activity, agree on activity implementation plan to guide the activity through completion.
Provide continuous updates to the PQM+ team including the Sr. Advisor Workforce Development on progress of assignment. This includes bi-weekly submission of detailed activity report and other relevant work products as applicable including meeting minutes with action points, and briefing/debriefing reports.
Mentor and support Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) in application of ADDIE instructional design system.
Coach and provide SMEs with best implementation practices.
Review existing content and repackage according to PQM+ and IntraHealth guidelines (to be provided)
Learner-focused learning objectives
Active learning – learning activities
Adult learning theory – application
Chunked content with effective spacing
Facilitator guide
Participant guide/workbook
Work with the PQM+ technical team to support in-country activities.
Other duties as assigned

Consultant Qualifications
Minimum of a Bachelor of Arts in curriculum development, instructional design, human resources for health, public health, international development, or a related discipline. Master’s Degree in Public Health, or related field is preferred.
At least five years of relevant experience in curriculum development and instructional design.
Knowledge and experience in the following: curriculum development, adult learning theory, competency-based training, active learning, facilitation design in a workshop environment, and training implementation, designing and hosting virtual meetings, trainings and workshops using applications to boost engagement and brainstorming, and knowledge of effective and practical ways to monitor and evaluate learning (indicators, methods to track, KPIs).
Bonus - familiarity with public health, medicines regulatory authorities, good manugactoring practices, medical product market authorization, or supply chain management.
Skillset in the following: PowerPoint, graphics and data visualization, practical (hands-on) experience using eAuthoring software (i.e., Articulate Storyline and Rise) and white board animation application (Scribbler, Vyond, etc.).
Demonstrated ability to work independently and manage multiple work flows, while effectively managing project timelines and deliverable schedules.
Ability to build relationships and interact effectively with technical experts, other partners and donor agencies.
Prior experience and success working in complex environments, with teams whose members are physically located in different time zones and geographic areas.
Fluency in English, and excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Able to work in Russian, Portuguese, and/or French is preferred
Professional and able to communicate effectively with colleagues and key external stakeholders.
Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills with strong attention to detail.
Ability to demonstrate the highest degree of ethics and integrity.
Ability to work in cross-cultural settings

Location and Travel
Work will be performed remotely unless co-facilitation of trainings is required by the activity manager. This will be stipulated and negotiated in the work order.

Period of Performance and LOE
The period of performance for this effort shall be up to 12 months from date of signature of the agreement at a level of effort (LOE) not to exceed 130 days.

Reporting
The consultant will report to the Senior Technical Advisor – Regulatory Workforce Development
1
Submission of applications
Applications should be received no later than 5pm Eastern Standard Time (EST) on April 15, 2022 and should include the following:
Cover letter
CV
Daily rate, sent in PDF format, duly signed. The daily rate must remain effective for a 12 month period. Daily consultant rates will not be increased before 12 months.
A sample of work
At least two references of clients for whom the offeror has recently provided services similar to those described herein

Applicants can apply to this posting, or send your application directly to the following address:
By email to: Daniel Djakba, ddjakba@intrahealth.org
When sending your application by e-mail, please start the title on the subject line by referring to “Curriculum Development/Instructional Design Support
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Assistant to the Provost and Chief Campus Officer - Public S...
desc:
Position Description
Pay Grade: Assistant 7
This position supports the office of the Provost/Chief Campus Officer-Public Safety Education and Training, providing assistance with administrative tasks and representing the Provost/CCO when appropriate
Responsibilities and Duties (*Essential Functions)
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential job functions satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the primary job functions herein described.
Provides administrative and technical assistance to the Provost/CCO
Plans, coordinates, and ensures the Provost's schedule is followed and respected
Prepares, processes, and verifies assigned paperwork, such as reports, memos, etc. from the Office of the Provost/CCO, and routes it to its intended recipient in a timely manner
Provides "gatekeeper" and "gateway" role, creating win-win situations for direct access to the CCO's time and office
Maintains the budget for the service area and tracks budget expenses throughout the year including compiling budget information for travel, technology, supplies, and equipment
Prioritizes conflicting needs: handles matters expeditiously, proactively, and follows through on projects to successful completion, often with deadline pressures

title: IT Strategic Sourcing Specialist
salary:
Job details
Salary
$61,972 - $100,892 a year
Job Type
Full-time
desc:
Looking to take the next step in your IT career?

We currently have an opening for an IT Strategic Sourcing Specialist.

~This is a Statutory Exempt position and is not subject to the State Human Resources Act.~

IT Strategic Sourcing Specialist position will serve as the contracting liaison (single point of contact) to support the creation and development of RFPs, bids and agreements. Provide process and technical expertise to the offer evaluation and award process
Specific job duties include, but are not limited, to:
Create, lead, manage and administer the contract throughout its lifecycle
Coordinate with state business leads/owners and project managers as required to ensure contract related decisions are made in an informed and fiscally responsible manner
Review and modify entity solicitations, contracts, amendments, or renewal options that do not adhere to state policies and guidelines involving project management, technical architecture, security, procurement and other standards as required
Provide IT procurement expertise on major IT projects involving complex IT projects to ensure a successful bid process, contract finalization and appropriate utilization
Ensure compliance with requirements of procurement laws and regulations for information technology, including compliance with and negotiation of contract terms and conditions

About the Organization:
The N.C. Department of Information Technology (NCDIT) mission is to promote a stronger North Carolina that connects customers, citizens, business, education, and government. NCDIT provides technology services to state agencies and is charged with closing the digital divide by expanding availability of broadband services and promoting the adoption of affordable, high-speed internet.

DIT is responsible for providing IT support to government, education entities, businesses and citizens in the state, as well as establishing the strategic vision for IT in state government and implementing an enterprise approach to IT. DIT provides shared business applications services, computing services, telecommunications support, IT procurement services, project management assistance, and project approval for state IT projects.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities / Competencies
To receive credit for your work experience and credentials, you must document on your application that you possess all of the following:
Working knowledge to create, lead, manage and administer the large-scale IT project contracts throughout its lifecycle
Experience to develop, edit, review, and revise IFBs, RFQs, and RFPs of varying complexity and in various cross-functional business environment
Working understanding of IT product and service needs, as well as maintain general knowledge of changing technologies
Knowledge or experience with Federal and State statutes, regulations, policies, codes, and rules
Experience in leveraging high order communication and negotiation skills to effectively engage with business owners, end users and vendors on contractual procedures, terms and conditions, disputes, periodic contract reviews, and other management areas as required
The following Management Preferences are not required, but applicants that possess these skills are preferred:
North Carolina State Government Agency procurement experience
Knowledge of North Carolina procurement Statutes and Administrative Code
IT Commodity Procurement Experience
Ability to negotiate contracts and RFP documents. Global perspective of business environment and technology

Minimum Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Business or related area from an appropriately accredited institution and five years of progressively responsible experience in the area of procurement specifically related to strategic sourcing, including experience with vendor management, solicitation, evaluation and negotiation of contracts, preferably in information technology and/or public sector environments
OR
An equivalent combination of education and experience

title: Herbicide Product Manager - Research Triangle Park, NC
desc:
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Description
At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.

We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.
And we are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America’s Best Large Employers in 2021. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!
Herbicide Product Manager (2201212) – RTP. NC
Where the Chemistry Happens
Marketing at BASF revolves around the customer experience and driving profitable growth. The foundation for this is a strong team that brings specific application, industry and market knowledge in order to understand the diverse markets where we build satisfying customer relationships.
We are seeking a professional like you to join the Crop Protection Group within the Agricultural Solutions business, located in Research Triangle Park, NC.
As the Herbicide Product Manager, you will be responsible for the development, implementation, and execution of the Marketing Plans for the US Crop Soybean Herbicide market. You will also lead the development of BASF’s Soybean Post Herbicide products in US Crop, including developing a clear business plan, identification & tracking of plan metrics, financial objectives, and implementation of strategies and tactics with sales, technical service, and senior management.
You will be the primary contact person for US Crop Herbicide discussions with regional and global herbicide teams on the key products managed and lead US project justification for assigned actives building market development plans for commercialization. Other responsibilities will include identifying and leading co-promotion and co-marketing discussions with distributors and other 3rd parties for assigned Engenia Herbicide products to optimize overall profitability and share. Additionally, you will be tasked with developing, managing and implementing active ingredient plans which include situation analysis of markets, projections of future events, objectives, strategies, tactical proposals and post evaluations of results.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success

Leveraging your Bachelor Degree and experience, you will manage an assigned business segment including operational forecasting, coordinating supply requirements with market developments.

Successfully engaging inside and outside the organization, you will coordinate with other key internal and external groups to ensure segment-related plans are implemented.

Your ability to lead and think strategically will be essential as you provide strategic direction / oversight to the Marketing Communications Specialist and Communication Agency in the execution of advertising, promotions, sponsorships, special events, collateral marketing and other promotional activities, with an overall objective of conveying a unified and distinctive leadership presence in the marketplace. You will also use this skill as you develop and update mid and long-term strategies for assigned Herbicide products.
Motivating the sales force and distributors, you will keep them informed about products, product performance, and our go-to-market strategy.
Your strong organizational skills will aid you as you lead the development and update of product concepts, detailing mid and long-term strategies for lead market segments. You will also be required to prepare project plans for approval.
Demonstrating your solid business acumen, you will manage assigned product short & long-term supply, forecasting, and profitability by coordinating a balance between short-term operating results and long-term market share development. You will also use this knowledge in the support of other members of the sales & marketing team, helping to ensure company sales and financial goals are achieved.
Your targeted customer focus will be evident as you participate in ongoing customer interactions, helping to position BASF and our products.

Acting entrepreneurially, you will participate in the development & implementation of industry insights and messages that are impactful by identifying market & sales opportunities for BASF products.

Working well in a team, you will gain consensus and communicate Soybean Post Herbicide plans with other product brand managers, sales teams, leadership team members, regional and global marketing teams to ensure successful execution of brand plans. You will also lead the development and implementation of a cross-group, go-to-market project.

Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You
Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you—the whole you—in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry.
The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career.
BASF provides interesting and challenging learning and development opportunities to help you make the most of your talents and your job.

As the leading foodservice and support services company, Compass Group USA is known for our great people, great service and our great results. title: Field Representative
salary:
Job details
Salary
$42,780 - $72,424 a year
Job Type
Full-time
desc:
Are you passionate about the environment and want to make a difference?
DEQ has an open opportunity for a Field Representative.

This Field Representative is responsible for duties that are primarily those associated with administration of Permit requirements of the Coastal Area Management Act (CAMA) and the Dredge and Fill law in the area served by the Wilmington District office. Approximately two-thirds of this work is outside and physical in nature. This position is based in the Wilmington District Office.

Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for CAMA Regulatory Permitting and Enforcement work for development projects
Conducting on-site reviews of permit applications
Providing information on projects that usually require coordination with other divisions and state agencies for permit approval
Applicant should have good verbal and written communication skills.

The Division of Coastal Management
The Division of Coastal Management (DCM) works to protect, conserve, and manage North Carolina’s coastal resources through an integrated program of planning, permitting, education and research. DCM carries out the state’s Coastal Area Management Act, the Dredge and Fill Law and the federal Coastal Zone Management Act of 1972 in the 20 coastal counties, using rules and policies of the NC Coastal Resources Commission, known as the CRC. The division serves as staff to the CRC. Click here to learn more about the Division of Coastal Management.

The NC Department of Environmental Quality:
The primary mission of the North Carolina Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) is to provide science-based environmental stewardship for the health and prosperity of all North Carolinians. The North Carolina Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) is the lead stewardship agency for the protection of North Carolina's environmental resources. The organization, which has offices from the mountains to the coast, administers regulatory programs designed to protect air quality, water quality, and the public's health, and works to advance in all-of-the-above energy strategy that fits North Carolina's needs. DEQ also offers technical assistance to businesses, farmers, local governments, and the public and encourages responsible behavior with respect to the environment through education programs provided at DEQ facilities and through the state's school system. DEQ touches the lives of all North Carolinians in many ways to enhance and ensure our quality of life. Please visit our website at the Department of Environmental Quality for more information.

Recruitment Range: $42,780 - $50,738
This position is located at: New Hanover County, NC, Wilmington
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities / Competencies
The Knowledge, Skills and Abilities listed below, along with the Minimum Education and Experience requirements, are REQUIRED to qualify for this position. Resumes will not be reviewed in lieu of Experience and Education listed on the application. Click these links for additional information: Introduction to the Job Application and Addressing Knowledge, Skills and Abilities.

To qualify for this position, applicants must document on the application that they possess ALL the following:

Demonstrated knowledge of coastal environmental resources.
Experience in resource management and/or environmental regulations.
Experience analyzing differing views on complex issues and decisiveness in making recommendations on these issues.
Basic computer skills.
Management Preferences:
Experience working in a fast-paced environment, requiring the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously while meeting strict deadlines.
Experience in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

Minimum Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor's degree in one of the agricultural, biological, engineering, environmental or natural resource sciences or a closely related curriculum from an appropriately accredited institution and two years of experience related to the area of assignment; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

title: Market Strategy Consultant- NBI_US
desc:
Market Strategy Consultant

Work You'll Do

The Market Strategy Consultant role within New Business Innovation's Hybrid Business Design team is responsible for contributing to the execution of market analyses that inform hybrid business cases and investment decisions. This position will work with teammates to deliver services, including testing key hypotheses in-market, evaluating competitive landscapes, and ultimately making actionable recommendations that will shape net-new or early-stage hybrid business ideas.

The position requires capabilities at both the strategy and execution levels. The candidate will be expected to maintain expertise in current market analyses trends and techniques, including: market fit analysis, market sizing, competitive scanning, pricing validation, partnering analyses, voice of the customer insight synthesis, and interview techniques (both internal and external). Additionally, the candidate should be able to think beyond the data collected to distill and present meaningful insights that can be translated to action-oriented recommendations for senior executive leadership within Deloitte.

The candidate will also have the opportunity to work with other team members across Pricing and Ecosystem partnerships to expand their skills and better understand implications to business decisions Deloitte is making.

Specific essential functions of this role include:
Execute day-to-day development of multiple market assessments at once
Collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders at varying levels to deeply understand the market size and demand, competitive landscape, and partnering opportunities for high-growth, hybrid business cases and investment decisions
Support Network leaders as they develop key hypotheses to iteratively test through secondary and primary research
Identify and understand competitive offerings, including key capabilities, for the Deloitte hybrid offering in question
Perform market sizing estimation and detailed competitive analyses to validate or evolve Network stakeholders' point of view, including lead and/ or support Total Addressable Market (TAM) analysis
Analyze key industry trends to develop a strategic point of view on where a market is in the context of specific offerings
Maintain an informed point of view on new and emerging business models in management consulting and adjacent markets
Maintain an informed point of view on emerging technologies and related services for hybrid offering opportunities
Prepare and conduct external interviews with both target clients and key competitors (both at the executive level) to test key assumptions on clients' business challenges, perceived value drivers, and critical buying factors as well as competitors' differentiation
Synthesize large amounts of secondary research and interview data to develop key insights that can inform investment decisions for technical assets
Prepare and lead executive level analysis output and presentations
Act as POC for respective area on a project-by-project basis

The Team: Hybrid Business Design

The Hybrid Business Design team within Deloitte Consulting is primarily responsible for enabling new hybrid businesses by architecting and orchestrating offerings that pioneer differentiated business models for Deloitte Consulting.

We are looking for individuals who can help test, identify, and recommend the highest potential business ideas by collaborating with the Network, ecosystem alliances, and other enabling groups to shape the partnership component of these new concepts.

The group is part of Deloitte Consulting's New Business Innovation team, which focuses on scaling Consulting's asset-based agenda to deliver tangible results in the near-term and a sustainable competitive advantage for the firm in years to come.

Qualifications

Required:
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Finance, Marketing, Economics or a related field
2+ years of experience in business strategy and business case development, including market analysis, interviewing skills, and data distillation to insights preferred
1+ year experience with asset-enabled business, including development software business cases and / or delivering technology-based projects

Preferred:
Ability to support and conduct internal and external interviews with executive-level experts, including synthesizing interview notes to develop key insights
Experience in developing business cases for technology-based solutions, including analyses like: market sizing, competitor landscape, voice of the customer, pricing, cross-offering portfolio opportunities, and technical build recommendations.
Experience in applying standard methods for establishing and testing addressable market size estimates
Proven ability to successfully partner with internal senior stakeholders from various parts of the organization, with varying degrees of technical aptitude, and drive successful outcomes cross-functionally
Ability to develop high-quality deliverables with limited input from executive sponsors
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to juggle many competing priorities/ deadlines
Understanding of Deloitte Consulting's organization, including matrixed nature and Offering Portfolios

Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

title: Project Manager I
desc:

Travel: Up to 25%
Number of Openings: 2

If you’re driven to accomplish great things, Baker is looking for you. As the nation’s leading specialty concrete contractor, Baker has constructed every type of concrete structure imaginable in more than 1,200 cities across the U.S. Today, more than 5,000 co-workers proudly wear the Baker logo.

At Baker, you’ll do more, be more, and gain more with a company that puts the key to success in your hands. Join an elite team that recognizes commitment and supports your professional growth; that believes focus + hard work + smarts equals opportunity; that provides more options to take your career to the next level. You’ll achieve more in a day, in a year, and in your career than you thought possible. Apply today — we’re ready to build.

Summary
The Project Manager I provides overall management direction on less complex project(s). Establishes project objectives through planning and budgets, serves as the primary point of contact with the client, and monitors construction and financial activities in collaboration with the Superintendent. Responsible for the financial results of the project. Responsible for safety on the project by perpetuating the IIF culture.
Roles and Responsibilities
The Project Manager I will possess competency in the following areas in order to perform his/her role in a safe, productive, and effective manner. Note that the areas listed are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by co-workers assigned to this role. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all the responsibilities, skills, efforts, or working conditions associated with this job.

Responsible for Pre-Construction Duties
Coordinates Job Transition and Start-up Process
Manages Cost and Schedule
Manages Cash Flow
Oversees the Work of Direct Reports
Maintains Client Relationship
Generates and Submits Technical Records
Supports Construction of Project
Manages Project Safety and Risk Management Processes
Ensures a Safe Work Environment
Participates in Training/Certifications
Requirements
Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university and 4 years of experience, or 8 years of construction related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
When you join Baker, you become part of a team that is driven to do more. We offer an excellent pay and benefits package, extensive training, and a culture that is built on the values of People, Honor, and Grit.

Baker is an EOE Disability/Veterans Employer.

title: Content Specialist, English Language Arts
desc:
Responsibilities:
Development and review of English Language Arts items for large-scale assessments; evaluation of passages for use in large-scale assessments; interpretation of blueprints, and the construction of operational and field tests across multiple grade levels.
Apply best practices in item and test development, involvement in standards interpretation and appropriate alignment determinations.
Position requires skills in grammar, editing, and communications with internal and external customers.
Help facilitate, maintain and oversee content development in English Language Arts, Reading, Writing and/or Communications (Listening/Speaking); item writing and item and data review committee meetings; and provide content expertise during those meetings as necessary.
Assist in developing and conducting the item-writer training for item development workshops. Perform passage research according to required specifications as needed.
Providing support in the development of item, passage and test specifications.
Review and edit test items developed by contractors.
Classify test items according to pre-specified content dimensions. Ensure the accuracy of item content coding, keying, and item validations.
Provide rationales in support of the use of each item (e.g.,. for the correct response and the incorrect response alternatives) as well as source references and copyright research.
Consult with the customer as required, including participation in planning, status, review meetings, etc.
Participate in test construction activities, including meeting statistical requirements, developing operational and embedded field test items, etc.
Work closely with Test Development Managers, other Content Developers, Psychometricians, and across group users of assessment content.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Some travel may be required for project-related meetings.
As required by the Colorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Pearson provides a reasonable range of minimum compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only , the range of starting pay for this role is $65,000 - $70,000. This position is eligible to participate in an annual incentive program, and information on benefits offered is here.
Qualifications
Bachelors Degree in English, English Literature, Education, or equivalent education and experience required.
At least 5 years of K-12 teaching experience in English language arts education required.
Some experience in large-scale assessment programs, and in particular item development, is preferred.
General knowledge of test development including: processing, scoring, and reporting of large-scale assessments is preferred.
Must have outstanding written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work closely with clients.
Must have excellent planning, organizational, and problem-solving skills to coordinate multiple activities and to adapt to unexpected requests.
Familiarity with Excel, Adobe, Word, and the technology skills and confidence necessary to learn unfamiliar programs quickly and efficiently, is required.
Experience with technology-enhanced items is preferred.
Learning is the most powerful force for change in the world. More than 20,000 Pearson employees deliver our products and services in nearly 200 countries, all working towards a common purpose – to help everyone achieve their potential through learning. We do that by providing high quality, digital content and learning experiences, as well as assessments and qualifications that help people build their skills and grow with the world around them. We are the world’s leading learning company. Learn more at pearsonplc.com.
Pearson believes that wherever learning flourishes, so do people. We are committed to being an anti-racist company in everything we do. We value the power of an inclusive culture and a strong sense of belonging. We promote a culture where differences are embraced, opportunities are accessible, consideration and respect are the norm, and all individuals are supported in reaching their full potential. Through our talent, we believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion make us a more innovative and vibrant place to work. People are at the center, and we are committed to a sustainable environment and workplace where talent can learn, grow, and thrive.
To learn more about Pearson’s commitment to a diverse and inclusive workforce, please click here: http://www.pearson.com/careers/diversity-and-inclusion.html
Pearson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and a member of E-Verify. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other group protected by law.
