title: Organizational Change Management (OCM) Consultant, Future of...
desc:
BGS - Organizational Change Management (OCM) Consultant, Future of Work - Service Delivery Transformation

Are interested in the Future of Work? Are you intrigued by the idea of fundamentally reimagining the means and methods used to get work done across varied teams operating across distinct businesses? Plan your next career move with Deloitte's Service Delivery Transformation team!

Deloitte's breadth, depth, and scale, combined with our relentless passion for innovation, create powerful opportunities to help our clients and our own organization stay ahead of change, deliver impact that matters, and transform complexity and disruption into lasting value.

Work you'll do

The Consultant will be part of a multi-disciplinary team developing the Service Delivery Transformation strategy for the Deloitte U.S. firm. The Consultant will also assist Deloitte's businesses-Consulting, Advisory, Audit, and Tax-with structuring and executing their individual service delivery transformations and associated organizational change management approaches to drive adoption and behavior change.

The Consultant will interact with senior leaders in the firm and will assist in various top priority change management projects with potential to significantly impact our organization.

Key activities include: stakeholder analysis, leadership alignment, change readiness planning, communications planning and development, engagement activities, culture transformation, training strategy and development, and other areas of change management. You will be responsible for developing and managing an end-to-end change management programs that will enable service delivery transformations.

Qualifications - External

Required:

Required:
Bachelor's degree
2+ years of change management and business transformation experience
Limited travel (while up to 25% of travel may be necessary for the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)
Must be legally authorized to work in the United Stated without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Preferred:
2+ years of consulting experience
Demonstrated knowledge of organizational change management frameworks, with experience in one or more of the following areas: strategic communications, training design, training delivery
Strong client presence with project management, presentation, and facilitation skills
Ability to succeed in team-based or independent environments
Well-organized
Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to create and support internal client relationships
Dedicated work ethic with a commitment to client service excellence

For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in Colorado, Deloitte is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to the State of Colorado and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and delivery model. We would not anticipate that the individual hired into this role would land at or near the top end of the range, but such a decision will be dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the range is $64,935-$119,580.

You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: Project Manager
desc:
Company Description

Jobs for Humanity is dedicated to building an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we have dedicated this job posting to individuals coming from the following communities: Refugee, Neurodivergent, Single Parent, Blind or Low Vision, Ethnic Minority, and the Previously Incarcerated.

If you identify with any of the following communities do not hesitate to register, even if you feel that this particular opportunity is not the right fit for you.

Company Name: NielsenIQ

Job Description

Job Description
The Project Manager will provide direction and leadership to key NielsenIQ NA strategic projects. The Operations project manager has overall responsibility for creating, execution, monitoring, controlling and finishing the plan. This role will bring leadership and direction to projects.
Responsibilities:
To secure the successful delivery of medium to large, client facing projects in a local, multi-local or international environment.
To partner with resources and specialists in different groups across the business in one or more hubs to develop synergies from Nielsen’s international organization.
To manage stakeholder interests and resource planning for all assigned projects.
To adopt and proactively use Client Delivery standards and proactively ensure project health checks are completed for all projects.
To prepare project documentation (such as project charters, statements of work and project schedules) and to update risk/issue/change logs.
To provide guidance to other Project Managers and Project Executives as required.
Qualifications
Bachelor Degree in a relevant field
3-5 years of proven project management experience based on industry standards. PMP certified an asset
Experience with project management tools preferably smartsheet
Combination of technical understanding combined with client orientation.
Strong influencing skills (external and internal).
Understands and applies critical project management processes.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, excellent interpersonal skills.
Capacity to make decisions independently and resolve problems in a client focused manner escalating when appropriate.
Strong communications skills with the ability to speak and write clearly, and adjust communication styles to the target audience
Excellent people skills, with an ability to communicate sensitive or difficult information tactfully and rationally
Ability to influence others
Strong analytical skills
Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize own and others work to meet tight deadlines
NielsenIQ Operations experience an asset
Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
About NielsenIQ
NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.
NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

title: Project Data Manager
desc:
Company Description

Founded in 1997 by a Medical Doctor, Ergomed Plc is dedicated to the development of new drugs to save or improve lives. Operating with a global footprint in over 55 countries, Ergomed has the expertise to manage even the most challenging clinical trials. Ergomed provides services to over 100 clients in a range of therapy areas but excels in the provision of services for complex trials in Rare Diseases, Oncology and Neuroscience

Job Description

The Project Data Manager has overall responsibility for the successful planning, execution, monitoring, control, and closure of multiple projects. These projects will be managed from initiation to close-out for data management and may include statistics and medical writing activities.
The Project Data Manager will be responsible for (but not limited to) the following activities:
Independently leads and delegates tasks to ensure timely completion of project activities to project timelines, quality, and budget
Communicate frequently and responsively with customers and clinical partners regarding timelines, requirements, and scope, providing formal status updates and instigating frequent and proactive contact
Keep abreast of project status and ensure delivery requirements and deadlines are clear and achieved via frequent communication with project teams
Escalate significant issues promptly to department director and project team
Coordinate project requirements with clinical partners and third-party vendors
Performs project forecasting of hours and identification of resource requirements and manages project budgets including identification of out of scope work and participation in the contract modification process
Ensure deliverables are met on time and delivered to quality standards
Participates in the development and implementation of processes, procedures, and training for the data management function as directed, and facilitates appropriate changes to promote best practice throughout the business
** Please note this position can be offered fully remote in the UK/India or Germany **

Qualifications

The ideal candidate will have:
Bachelor's Degree, preferably in Life Sciences, Computer Science, or other related scientific discipline
Demonstrative experience in data management at a pharmaceutical, biotech, or research facility
Relevant experience in a Data Management project management role managing multiple projects through the full project lifecycle within the pharmaceutical industry, preferably at a CRO
Leadership of project teams including experience of facilitating and encouraging global and/or virtual teams and maintaining effective relationships and gaining trust
Manage multiple projects to tight deadlines and to budget and high quality
Thorough knowledge of the end-to-end reporting process (data management, statistics, medical writing)
Electronic data capture software set-up and end user experience (Rave, Inform, IBM)

Additional Information

Why Should You Apply?
You want be involved in a wide range of interesting projects and studies
You want your achievements and hard work to be recognized
You want to work for a growing company where you can progress in your career and where there are opportunities for advancement.
You want to work in a company that has a great reputation with its clients and employees, and invests in its relationships with both
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

title: Legal Operations Manager
desc:
Credit Karma is a mission-driven company, focused on championing financial progress for our more than 100 million members in the U.S., Canada and U.K. While we're best known for pioneering free credit scores, our members turn to us for tips as they work on their financial goals, including helping them monitor their credit, identity monitoring, searching for credit cards, shopping for loans (car, home and personal), and growing their savings* - all for free. Credit Karma has grown significantly through the years: we've added more than 70 million members in the last five years alone and now have more than 1,100 employees across our offices in Oakland, Charlotte, Los Angeles and London.
Banking services provided by MVB Bank, Inc., Member FDIC
Credit Karma is looking for an experienced Legal Operations Manager who is responsible for creating and supporting practices and processes to improve the day-to-day efficiency and effectiveness of the legal team. While the expectation is that you will roll up your sleeves and do the work to ensure operational excellence, you see yourself as a strategic planner as the legal operations team works to grow the enterprise. You will have exceptional organizational skills, process design experience, and a proactive management style. You can identify, design, implement, and reinforce the processes that allow the legal team to run smoothly, while providing stellar service to our internal partners and external vendors. You'll report directly to our Director of Legal Operations. This is a great opportunity to join a high growth and mission-driven company!
What you'll do:
Legal Technology:
Implement legal department tools to improve our practices, and manage design, rollout, and training for new systems
Oversee the daily administration of systems
Troubleshoot issues, and provide recommendations and resolution options to partners
Review, suggest and implement process and technology improvements where possible and cost effective
Metrics and Analytics:
Evaluate status reports which reflect key items such as project health, schedules, risk and issues
Analyze and report on data to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to improve results and find solutions
Project Management and General Operations:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address legal department priorities
Maintain and distribute project information, create documentation, reports, and related work
Monitor project budgets, technology, assess risks and track multiple project timelines and progress
Monitor and update project information, create documentation, reports, and related work throughout the project lifecycle
Budgeting and Outside Counsel Management:
Manage administrative aspects of outside counsel and vendor relationships with external consulting company
What we are looking for:
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university
4+ years of experience relevant to legal operations in a large organization or relevant operational management role in positions of progressive responsibility
Strong organizational skills and the ability to work with senior executives
Experience successfully leading projects and initiatives
What we would like to see:
Familiarity with technology solutions such as JIRA/Confluence, Google Workspace, Slack, and Airtable
Ability to execute under pressure and within tight timelines while juggling multiple projects
A self-starter with enthusiasm, who can work independently with minimal oversight on certain projects but who is also a team player and can support projects when needed
Benefits at Credit Karma includes:
Medical and Dental Coverage
Retirement Plan
Commuter Benefits
Wellness perks
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick, Baby Bonding, Cultural Observance, & More)
Education Perks
Paid Gift Week in December
Equal Employment Opportunity:
Credit Karma is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We welcome all candidates without regard to race, color, religion, age, marital status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, veteran or military status, disability (physical or mental), genetic information or other protected characteristic. We prohibit discrimination of any kind and operate in compliance with applicable fair chance laws.
Credit Karma is also committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment because it is the right thing to do. We believe that such an environment advances long-term professional growth, creates a robust business, and supports our mission of championing financial progress for everyone. We offer generous benefits and perks with a single eye to nourishing an inclusive environment that recognizes the contributions of all and fosters diversity by supporting our internal Employee Resource Groups. We’ve worked hard to build an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and the opportunity for professional growth. As part of the Credit Karma team, your voice will be heard, your contributions will matter, and your unique background and experiences will be celebrated.
COVID-19 update (US Jobs Only):
Credit Karma believes that vaccines are one of the most powerful tools to fight COVID-19 and save lives. We also believe that in order to work toward our mission of helping people make financial progress, people first and foremost need their health. All employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date unless otherwise approved for an exception as may be required by law.
Privacy Policies:
Credit Karma is strongly committed to protecting personal data.

title: Communications Manager - Telecommute in NC
desc:
UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)
The Communications Manager is responsible for developing, updating, and executing program communications for both internal and external parties. In this role, you will support analytical efforts regarding standard and ad hoc communications, working to ensure contract compliance and improve the member and provider experience. You will serve as a liaison between the NC Health Plan Operations team, executive leadership, and functional departments to understand member communication needs and requests. May serve in a project manager capacity for smaller work efforts as well.
If you are located within within the state of NC, preferably in Greensboro, High Point, Winston Salem, or Raleigh, Durham area, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
Contribute towards communication strategies that fulfill business needs; add value to strategic brainstorming sessions; provide suggestions for the development of tactical deliverables and translate objectives; ensure that the project deliverables are on time, within budget and at the required level of quality
Assess the productivity of marketing campaigns and adjusting based on analysis of results to ensure campaign objectives and revenue goals are met
Clearly communicate recommended strategy changes and execute on those recommended changes
Provide written and in-person performance reports to marketing leadership as requested and address questions or concerns as appropriate; follow up with internal and external stakeholders
Develop and present strategies or creative briefs to leadership and key stakeholders to achieve buy-in, gather insights and facilitate the evolution of new or existing communication projects
Develop PowerPoint presentations and project summary materials
Utilize your expertise on communications that will strengthen brand awareness and reputation, and achieve growth and retention targets
Maintain communication assets using established protocols for managing communications inventory, interface directly with operations and fulfillment teams
Develop multi-channel, internal communication plans capable of delivering against multiple audiences’ needs
Develop and implement a modern communications infrastructure that reduces low-level administrative burden on communicators
Ensure tools can deliver key metrics and measurable performance to inform future decision making
Collaborate with the external communications efforts for the company including media relations, issues management, and reputation management
Stay abreast of emerging issues and proactively develop communications strategies to address them
Partner across the enterprise to bring campaigns to life for both internal and external audiences
Manage crisis communications when deemed necessary

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree
5+ years of experience in communications and media relations
Experience mentoring, managing or leading others
Experience doing professional writing and editing
Experience coordinating several key stakeholders for communications materials
Experience developing and implementing strategic and tactical plans for internal communications initiatives
Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. Candidates located in states that mandate COVID-19 booster doses must also comply with those state requirements. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination, and boosters when applicable, prior to employment to ensure compliance
Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced degree in communications or public relations
Experience doing mail design and development
Excellent project management and people leadership skills
Ability to meet tight deadlines and multi-task, while flawlessly executing on projects in a fast-paced environment

To protect the health and safety of our workforce, patients and communities we serve, UnitedHealth Group and its affiliate companies require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment. In addition, some roles and locations require full COVID-19 vaccination, including boosters, as an essential job function. UnitedHealth Group adheres to all federal, state and local COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary information from candidates prior to employment to ensure compliance. Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation. Failure to meet the vaccination requirement may result in rescission of an employment offer or termination of employment.

Careers at UnitedHealthcare Community & State. Challenge brings out the best in us. It also attracts the best. That's why you'll find some of the most amazingly talented people in health care here. We serve the health care needs of low income adults and children with debilitating illnesses such as cardiovascular disease, diabetes, HIV/AIDS and high-risk pregnancy. Our holistic, outcomes-based approach considers social, behavioral, economic, physical and environmental factors. Join us. Work with proactive health care, community and government partners to heal health care and create positive change for those who need it most. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)
*All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

title: Communications Specialist
desc:
:
Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker – always asking, “What if?”

If so, then you may be the new team member we’re looking for. Because at SAS, your curiosity matters – whether you’re developing algorithms, creating customer experiences or answering critical questions. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless.

What we do
We’re the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live.

What you’ll do
As a Communications Specialist, you will collaborate with SAS leadership and internal and external stakeholders to amplify executive voices, corporate messaging and thought leadership. Through your creative writing and sound guidance, you will help executives effectively inform and connect with internal and external audiences and promote SAS’ brand awareness and reputation.
This role is for a communicator who has experience in crafting, vetting and customizing content to fit the audience and the executive’s voice and style. You’ll work both individually and collaboratively to develop and execute communications.

You will:
Create internal and external plans and messaging for SAS executives and work with them to deliver messages using the optimal style, format and channel.
Write, edit and collaborate on articles, scripts, talking points, blog posts, and other content as needed.
Develop and review corporate communications and executive messages related to diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives.
Design and execute internal communications strategies to align with corporate goals and initiatives.
Collaborate with various SAS teams to ensure that communication initiatives align with global messaging frameworks and timelines.
Consult on social media strategy and craft content in alignment with executive thought leadership platforms and corporate communication goals.
Manage content for company-wide communications, including divisional and internal town halls.
Monitor and report impact of communications through surveys and other performance measurements.
What we’re looking for
Experience with executive communications programs – both internal and external – including speech and script writing and communications coaching.
Experience creating communications for multi-media with a strong sensibility for visual presentation.
Excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to build strategic working relationships with executives and all levels of the organization.
Experience with change management and strategic communications plan development and execution.
Ability to work outside of normal business hours periodically.
Familiarity with social media communications channels; ability to integrate these channels into plans & strategies to achieve stated goals.
Media relations experience, including pitching executives for external speaking engagements and preparing executives for media engagements.
Project management, event planning and meeting facilitation skills.
Demonstrated understanding of communication concepts/functions and software tools (Microsoft Office 365 SharePoint, Teams, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Adobe Creative Suite, Wordpress).
Creativity and the ability to multi-task to manage multiple projects at once.
You’re curious, passionate, authentic and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do.
Other knowledge, skills, and abilities
Bachelor's degree, preferably in journalism, marketing, public relations or related discipline.
5+ years of experience in corporate or marketing communications or related function in the technology or other business-to-business industry.
Superlative written, verbal, and visual communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate with a wide variety of audiences.
Experience with modern communications strategy, practices and channels with attention to the needs of the intended audience(s).
Why SAS
We love living the #SASlife and believe that happy, healthy people have a passion for life, and bring that energy to work. No matter what your specialty or where you are in the world, your unique contributions will make a difference.
Our multi-dimensional culture blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Here, it isn’t about fitting into our culture, it’s about adding to it - and we can’t wait to see what you’ll bring.

Additional Information:
SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Read more: Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law. Also view the supplement EEO is the Law, and the Pay Transparency notice.

Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience. Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process.

In order to work at SAS, you must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If there is a medical or religious reason preventing you from receiving an available COVID-19 vaccination, and you are selected as a candidate for consideration, we have an accommodations process in place to evaluate those requests.

All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at www.sas.com. SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at Recruitingsupport@sas.com before taking any further action.

title: Technical Applications Consultant
desc:
The Technical Applications Consultants at Software Toolbox are a vital part of helping our customers integrate our off-the shelf software solutions into their industrial control systems, and work with a global customer base in every industry; from food & beverage, to renewable energy, to water/waste water, to automotive, power & utilities, oil & gas, and manufacturing. Our customers find us because of our software and reputation and return because of our technical know-how and the high level of service our team provides.
Some are able to join our team directly in this role, depending on their education, skills, and experience. Others start as Associate Consultants and are promoted to this role after a period of time that is as much under their control instead of a set period of time. Typically this role is one achieved after a year of experience in our business.
Our Technical Application Consultants:
Receive customer emails such as “the reason we buy your products is because of the superior support we receive – I can really tell you care about my success and have my back”.
Have been shipped a jar of salsa from a food manufacturer that was so delighted with how we helped them with our product.
Enjoy working in a casual team environment with daytime, normal work hours. (no mandatory on-call rotation or 24/7 support)
Love technology and learning something new every day, in a quickly evolving industry.
Wow us (and our customers) with their problem-solving strength, verbal and written communications skills, drive, motivation, and desire to learn.
Take pride and are excited to hear the stories of how our software makes every-day products that we all use. Imagine going into a store and picking up a product and knowing “I helped our customer make that, using our software”.
As a Technical Application Consultant, you will:
Work with our customers to integrate, configure, and optimize our products; but you won’t have to travel to do it! We built this company on the use of technology for remote work and delight our customers with how we deliver.
Troubleshoot, analyze, and resolve problems across a wide range of applications and systems; ranging from the very simple to the true head-scratchers
Work with our development teams, partners, and customers to reproduce, isolate, and squash those pesky software bugs when they appear
Have a say about what goes into new product releases and the chance to show ownership and pride in our company and product offering.
Consult with customers in a pre-sales technical capacity to determine the right product to use to meet their needs so they get the right results the first time.
Create application notes, knowledge-base entries, videos, blog posts, and/or technical training curriculums to share your technical expertise with others internally and externally.
Mentor and train Associate Consultants sharing your areas of expertise and experience.
Future Growth Opportunities
Continue your learning through our varied training methods designed to provide you the opportunity to demonstrate your initiative and drive to earn greater responsibility and eventually promotion to other roles such as
Sr. Technical Application Consultant
Product management
Inside Technical Sales
IT/Infrastructure Support & Internal Systems Development
If what you see here is exciting and you
Are a naturally curious, self-starting, motivated engineer that is ready to embrace our industry and product training,
Are ready to work somewhere that you are respected and esteemed by your teammates, our engineer clients and sales partners
Want to work with companies and brands that you know
Want to know your work makes a difference for the company but more importantly for our customers.
Want to have a work-life balance
Are interested in the opportunity to grow into senior technical roles, technical sales, and/or product management
And are a US citizen or Permanent Resident (We are not able to sponsor visas)
Then we want to hear from you!. When you join our team, you will learn about our products, customers, and industries we serve from your peers and our leadership team, with open access all the way to the senior leadership of our business.
Join us and put your passion for customer experience, problem solving, technical skills, and positive attitude to work in a casual work environment where you are the core value delivery of the business, everyone on the team from the top down respects it and rewards it.
Desired Skills
Windows
Computers
Networking
Microsoft Office
Technical Communication
Analytic Problem Solving
Written & Verbal Communication Abilities
Collaborative Problem Solving
Creative Problem Solving
Degree Level
Bachelor's, Master's
Computer Engineering, Computer Science majors are usually interested, but we do not limit that. For example, we have several mechanical engineers that have discovered they love working with software even more!
Qualifications that Differentiate But are Not Required
Windows desktop and/or server operating system configuration, basic troubleshooting literacy
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server (any version), or demonstrated experience with relational database engines and demonstrated ability to transfer that knowledge to another database engine
Networking of computers using TCP/IP – basic IP assignment, subnet masks, routing concepts, basic troubleshooting of network problems.
Fluency in a major second language other than English – French, Spanish, German, Chinese, or Japanese a strong plus
Co-op or other work experience if recent college grad: manufacturing, industrial, or any type of customer service.
Relevant technical experience in any of the following: VS.NET development, Visual Basic, PLCs, HMIs, DCS, Communications, Networking and/or Windows operating systems
Related Information:
Key Success Factors
Benefits
Application Instructions:
After reading this description, email your current resume and a cover letter sharing why you are interested in this position and why you would be a good fit to careers@softwaretoolbox.com
For candidates selected for an initial interview, we will conduct them virtually by Zoom or WebEx at a mutually agreeable time. If further interviews were to require an in person meeting, they will be conducted consistent with then current guidance from local and state public health authorities and guidelines and our own COVID-19 safety policy.

Software Toolbox does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor.

title: PROGRAM MANAGER- FACILITY DESIGN, ARTS, and HEALTH
desc:
Duke Raleigh Hospital Duke Raleigh Hospital offers the latest in care and technology in a patient-friendly setting. It has been an important part of Duke Health since 1998 and has served Wake County for more than 35 years, employing more than 2,000 teammembers. The hospital provides 186 inpatient beds and a comprehensive array of services, including the Duke Raleigh Cancer Center, Duke Raleigh Orthopedic and Spine Center, cardiovascular services, neurosciences including the Duke Raleigh Skull Base and Cerebrovascular Center, advanced digestive care, disease management and prevention, wound healing, outpatient imaging, intensive and progressive care, pain clinic, same-day surgery, emergency department and community outreach and education programs. U.S.News & World Report ranked Duke Raleigh Hospital as high performing in orthopaedics and five adult procedures/conditions: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), heart failure, kidney failure, lung cancer surgery, and stroke.
PROGRAM MANAGER- DUKE RALEIGH HOSPITAL
Responsible for the management of Duke Raleigh Hospital's Arts and Health program. This includes the coordination of both performing and visual art programs on campus. Position will serve as chair for various committees supporting the Arts/Health program.
Coordinates campus wide enhancements via collaboration with both internal and external stakeholders. Manages coordination meetings with stakeholders for new initiatives and projects occurring on campus.
Responsible for the procurement, assessment and installation of all furnishings and related equipment for the facility. Coordinates with customers and vendor for proper selection and installation.
Maintains facility design finish standards for Duke Raleigh. Serves as a member of Duke Raleigh’s construction project team and collaborates with Duke Health's corporate construction/design teams to ensure that the standards are maintained, implemented, and/or adjusted appropriately.
Preferred Experience
At least 2 years of related experience in Healthcare Interior Design
Occ Summary
Provide administrative direction to assigned program to include managing and coordinating financial development and administration, special programs such as speakers and lecturers programs, publications and special conferences or other events to ensure fulfillment of the program objectives.
Work Performed
conclusions. policies. Coordinate and participate in meetings with faculty members to determine objectives of the program and/or center and to identify internal and external resources available to meet those objectives. Develop and implement program protocol, procedures, and operating Prepare applications for grants and contracts to include development of budgets; administer departmental grants and contracts in accordance with University policies and sponsors' requirements regarding records, reports, controls and conditions governing expenditures of funds. Coordinate arrangements for special programs such as speaker series to include inviting appropriate speakers or other participants, arranging schedules, facilities, and publicity and ensuring necessary financial arrangements. Prepare brochures, bulletins and other publications to describe the program's academic goals, and events suchas conferences and special programs; publish, develop and implement other communications vehicles such as newsletters to include compiling news and educational articles of local interest; write and edit text and coordinate printing and mailing or distribution.] Maintain liaison with outside educational and professional organizations and agencies to explore implementation of specialized programs at Duke and to encourage participation in specified programs. Coordinate the compilation of and prepare operational and financial reports and analyses setting forth progress, adverse trends and appropriate recommendations or Correspond with interested students and other universities to provide information concerning activities, policies and procedures of the program.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
SUPERVISION ANALYZE TRENDS BUDGET PROJECTIONS CUSTOMER SERVICE
Level Characteristics
N/A
Minimum Qualifications
Education
Work requires communications, analytical and organizational skills generally acquired through completion of a bachelor's degree program.
Experience
Work requires the ability to plan and administer programs and direct program activities within a specific functional area, generally acquired through four years of related experience. OR ANY OTHER EQUIVALENT COMBINATION OF RELEVANT EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE
Degrees, Licensures, Certifications
N/A
Duke is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing employment opportunity without regard to an individual's age, color, disability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or veteran status.
Duke aspires to create a community built on collaboration, innovation, creativity, and belonging. Our collective success depends on the robust exchange of ideas—an exchange that is best when the rich diversity of our perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences flourishes. To achieve this exchange, it is essential that all members of the community feel secure and welcome, that the contributions of all individuals are respected, and that all voices are heard. All members of our community have a responsibility to uphold these values.
Essential Physical Job Functions: Certain jobs at Duke University and Duke University Health System may include essentialjob functions that require specific physical and/or mental abilities. Additional information and provision for requests for reasonable accommodation will be provided by each hiring department.

title: Trade Control Analyst - Commodities
desc:
Job Description:
FDCO Overview
The below FDCO description should be prefixed in all job descriptions:
The Fixed Income, Currency and Commodities (FICC) & Derivative Core Operations (FDCO) team perform end to end trade control, confirmation and settlements processes across FICC businesses and provides utility OTC derivative confirmation and settlement services for non FICC businesses.
Within FDCO, the teams provide multiple services such as FICC trade control, Foreign Exchange (FX) electronic matching and settlement, Over the Counter (OTC) derivative confirmation and settlement, and commodities operations.
Job Description:
We are currently in search of a Commodities Trade Control Analyst to join our team in Charlotte, While on the team, you'll assist with the day-to-day trade support operations for the Commodities Trading and Sales activities that span across APAC, EMEA, and AMRS. Trade Control team members are responsible for ensuring the data quality in the system or record which includes trade capture, trade amendments, and trade lifecycle processing. On a daily basis, you will be working with the Business, Support, and Technology partners to ensure control breaks are highlighted and resolved in a timely manner. Candidates are encourage to bring new thoughts and ideas to the team in order to manage risk and drive innovation with unique solutions.
Responsibilities
Daily derivative transaction reconciliation and highlighted breaks are reviewed for explanation and resolution to the appropriate stakeholders.
Manage day-to-day trade lifecycle support operations
Work with the business and support partners to resolve escalated issues to ensure regulatory and financial reporting obligations are met
Liaising with other support partners to ensure timely resolution of control breaks and Client fails
Involvement in ad hoc projects for Operational Excellence process improvements, regulatory, or industry initiatives
Working with technology on business initiatives, new product onboarding, and assisting with UAT testing
Requirements
Capable of working in a dynamic and fast pace environment
Able to multi-task and meet deadlines
Exercises extreme attention to detail
Can work in a group environment and independently
Continuous focus on managing risk
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications

Preferred
Bachelor's degree or higher
Derivative product knowledge
Other Qualifications
Excels in working among diverse viewpoints to determine the best path forward
Connecting with a diverse set of team members to understand future business needs – is a continuous learner
Commitment to challenging the status quo and promoting positive change.
Participate in and drive collaborative efforts to advance tools, technology, and ways of working to better serve an evolving client base
Believes in value of diversity so we can reflect, connect and meet the diverse needs of our clients and employees around the world
Strives to bring new thoughts and ideas to teams in order to drive innovation and unique solutions
Excels in working among diverse viewpoints to determine the best path forward
Experience in connecting with a diverse set of clients to understand future business needs – is a continuous learner
Commitment to challenging the status quo and promoting positive change.
Participate in and drive collaborative efforts to advance tools, technology, and ways of working to better serve an evolving client base
Believes in value of diversity so we can reflect, connect and meet the diverse needs of our clients and employees around the world
Job Band:
H5
Shift:
1st shift (United States of America)
Hours Per Week:
40
Weekly Schedule:
Referral Bonus Amount:

title: Learning Technologist
desc:
Citrix builds the secure digital workspace technology that frees 400,000 customers to do their very best work from anywhere. By joining our award-winning workplace, you’ll be included in the globally diverse, collaborative team that values work-life balance. Come see why Fortune named us one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For®. Let’s innovate and grow together!
What we're looking for:
The Learning Technologist for Wrike Sales Enablement leads the development of creative and engaging custom eLearning content in interactive, self-paced, and video formats. Candidates must have the ability to produce high-quality eLearning solutions in a fast-paced collaborative team environment. Should have knowledge of instructional design, graphic design, data gathering and analysis to measure project results, adult learning theory, best practices for eLearning, administering learning management systems (LMS), and a desire for continuous improvement of processes (automation of processes - API knowledge is a plus).
Responsibilities
Gather the learning needs, content, schedule, and scalability requirements for development projects.
Must have strong project management and time management skills to operate in a dynamic, fast paced environment.
Effectively uses tools for training development, including but not limited to digital media (graphic, audio, video editing), eLearning development tools, content authoring and presentation tools and other emerging technologies.
Design and develop engaging and memorable learning solutions through all aspects of the process from subject matter expert consultation through deployment in a learning management system.
Supports full course production cycle (from initial request to final launch and results tracking).
Identifies opportunities and makes for improvement to our processes, systems and training products to improve the overall team function.
Participate in administering the learning management system within Wrike.
Develop engaging and effective presentations in Powerpoint and Google Slides.
Convert existing documentation and training materials into engaging and effective online courses and take part in the continuous content process.
Create/maintain program and course evaluations and present the metrics in enablement dashboards.
Work with business partners and subject matter experts to identify and confirm learning objectives.
Preferred Qualifications
Outstanding writing, editing, critical reasoning, interpersonal, and communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to communicate complex concepts concisely and clearly and to convert technical or complex information and concepts into easily-understandable text and illustrations.
Demonstrated ability to assess learning needs and develop media-rich, engaging, and high-impact learning solutions.
Visual design – knowledge, and experience in how to craft the visual experience that works best with course content.
Experience making e-learning exciting, fun, and social.
Experience using and administering industry-standard learning technologies and tools, such as Learning Management System (LMS), project management tools, eLearning authoring tools, digital graphics media, and audio and video production tools to create impactful courses.
Demonstrated ability to measure and assess the impact of projects using foundational data analysis and reporting tools.
Ability to predict and overcome obstacles.
A conceptual thinker who proactively solves problems and makes common-sense decisions.
Results-driven, high-energy team player.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree (Instructional Design, Educational Technology, or a related field) and minimum 5 years of prior relevant experience; or a Master’s degree with 3 years of prior relevant experience (multimedia learning development and instructional design experience in a corporate training environment, preferably in SaaS, Technology or Sales organizations)
Advanced knowledge of learning authoring technologies.
Functional Area:

Customer/Technical Training

What you’re looking for:
Everyone is welcome at Citrix. We prioritize diversity, equity, inclusion, and a culture of belonging, and celebrate bringing our courageous, authentic selves to work. We believe this way of working helps us innovate, and it’s just one of the reasons why our employees continuously recognize Citrix as a great place to work.
Citrix helps make work more sustainable to benefit the planet, our business, and our communities. For more than 30 years, we have empowered individuals and organizations to work remotely or work from anywhere, reducing commuting emissions and energy consumption in the process.
We are the #1 leader in Virtual Client Computing (VCC) and #2 in the Application Delivery Controller (ADC) space, and we have key partnerships with top cloud providers. We’ll give you the tools, learning opportunities, mentorship, and flexibility to achieve your goals. Come see why you belong at Citrix, with our culture supporting purposeful innovation and growth from within.
The Benefits
We offer a competitive total rewards package* that includes:
18 weeks of paid parental leave
Health and wellness benefits
Employee assistance program
Retirement benefits
Education assistance
Time off and absence programs
Professional development and mentorship opportunities
Paid volunteer time and charitable matching of employee donations
Employee resource groups
And more!
**Please note that benefits may vary based on location.
President Biden released an Executive Order stating that federal contractors must require COVID-19 vaccinations for all US employees. As a company that works on federal contracts, we have a legal requirement to comply with the Executive Order. To be considered for this career opportunity, you must be fully COVID-19 vaccinated or have an acceptable medical or religious accommodation. Learn more about our COVID-19 policies.
Citrix Systems, Inc. is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status and other protected classifications.
Citrix uses applicant information consistent with the Citrix Recruitment Policy Notice at https://www.citrix.com/about/legal/privacy/citrix-recruitment-privacy-notice.html
Citrix welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Reasonable accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the job application process, please contact us at (877) 924-8749 or email us at ASKHR@citrix.com for assistance.
By applying, you are giving Citrix consent to be considered for future openings of other roles of similar qualifications.

title: Director of Business Strategy Planning & Design
desc:
Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

With over 15,000 employees worldwide, the Microsoft Customer Experience and Success (CEnS) organization is responsible for the strategy, design, and implementation of the Microsoft end-to-end customer experience. This newly expanded organization reflects the Microsoft ambition to be known as a customer experience company, ensuring our Microsoft mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more is enabled by delighting customers and consistently exceeding their expectations in every interaction through a connected customer experience.

Microsoft has a tremendous opportunity to exceed customer expectations and drive greater customer loyalty and trust, which leads to greater satisfaction, retention, and growth. The CEnS organization is looking for people with a passion for delivering customer success to help us build a future where customers come to us, not only because we provide industry-leading products and services, and also because we provide a differentiated and connected customer experience that is rooted in our commitment to delivering on customer outcomes.

Responsibilities
As the Director of Business Strategy Planning & Design within the Customer Service and Support (CSS) Chief of Staff Office and reporting to the CSS Chief of Staff, you will support the CVP and CSS Leadership Team in strategic business planning, strategy ideation, concept design, and proposal development.

The Customer Service and Support (CSS) organization is responsible for being the front line to our customers as we support them in their usage of our products. Our mission is the same as Microsoft’s, namely to “Empower every person and organization on the planet to do more.”

This exciting opportunity provides visibility, influence and leadership across CSS and the entire Microsoft ecosystem. The Director of Business Strategy Planning & Design role is essential to the vision of the organization as being recognized as the world leader in customer experience, success, and support. This role calls for a balance of strategic thought leadership, proposal and implementation plan development, influence skills and effective communication. You must be able to work well under pressure, have low ego with high confidence and interpersonal awareness, willing and able to partner effectively with diverse stakeholders, deliver impact under tight deadlines and must be flexible with strong ability to be effective amid ambiguity and uncertainty.

Business Program Planning and Design
Solves complex problems and synthesizes across organizational boundaries. Drives consensus to prioritize key business goals, objectives, and strategies, and develop short- and long-term business priorities. Understands and identifies current program risks, impact, and develops mitigation plans impacting Microsoft.
Identifies and scopes opportunities to develop new programs and improve current ones impacting Microsoft. Drives the definition of the program strategy, gathers program requirements, identifies resource needs, creates the project plan and targets, and works across teams to align on the plan of record. Improves operations of existing programs by applying industry methodology, defining crucial complex program issues, assessing various scenarios, and selecting the optimal scenario to resolve issues. Drives clarity in highly crucial program issues and strives for simplification.
Drives strategic alignment among cross-functional (e.g., organizational, business) stakeholders (e.g., Engineering, Field) to design crucial programs from initiation to delivery. Provides thought leadership to produce collateral (e.g., proposals, strategy walking deck, internal and external pitch content) to incorporate stakeholder needs and ensure the business objectives are met.

Buisness Program Excellence and Execution
Sets best practices to define and execute on a landing and communication plan, such as the target audience(s) and communication strategy. Drives the rhythm of business (ROB) during plan execution to ensure participants and stakeholders are communicating and responding according to the necessary cadence.
Acts as a subject matter expert to evangelize crucial programs to stakeholders, partners, and customers to gain buy in. Leverages data and performance metrics (e.g., Objectives and Key Results [OKRs] and Key Performance Indicators [KPIs]) to demonstrate the value of the program and show business impact. Drives others to adapt communication style and storytelling strategy according to audience and business needs.

Business Program Management
Acts as subject matter expert to drive others to understand mapping or how systems work and impact one another. Drives the collaboration and leverages other teams (e.g., Customer Success, Engineering, Field) to ensure program processes are rigorous and executed efficiently. Develops processes around scope and scheduled changes for programs impacting Microsoft and communicates it to stakeholders. Recognizes process gaps/inefficiencies and drives strategies for optimization.

Business Program Evaluation and Improvement
Drives the definition of the vision and strategy for change, broad and specific impact, and the flow of communication to the organization. Ensures buy in and adoption of the new program or change by others in the organization. Drives others to develop the collateral required to enable key stakeholders and others to be onboard. Drives the training, reskilling, and mapping of individuals in partnership with Human Resources (HR).
Provides subject matter expertise to collect and evaluates success criteria and performance metrics (e.g., Objectives and Key Results [OKRs] and Key Performance Indicators [KPIs]). Optimizes the use of data analytics (e.g., scenario analyses) to derive insights and training that help identify current and future program risks and mitigation plans, as well as opportunities to streamline and optimize programs based on lessons learned that impact Microsoft.

Other
Embody our culture and values
Qualifications
Required/Minimum Qualifications
12+ years work experience in program management, process management, process improvement
OR Bachelor's Degree in Business, Operations, Finance or related field AND 8+ years work experience in program management, process management, process improvement
OR equivalent experience.

The salary for this role in the state of Colorado is between $157,300 - 236,300 USD

At Microsoft, certain roles are eligible for additional rewards, including annual bonus and stock. These awards are allocated based on individual performance. In addition, certain roles also have the opportunity to earn sales incentives based on revenue or utilization, depending on the terms of the plan and the employee’s role.

Benefits/perks listed here may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.US-based employees gain access to healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan and company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, and fitness benefits, among others.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

title: Business Systems Analyst III (REMOTE)
desc:
Overview:
As a Business Systems Analyst III, you’ll be a member of the bank’s Digital Banking team. This position delivers strategic insight into business systems through complex analysis, reporting, and operational activities. Serves as a technical expert on system usage and performance. Determines business requirements and implements appropriate specifications, monitoring for compliance and effectiveness. Assists in identifying and resolving process issues which may involve system testing or development. May oversee the work of less experienced analysts in the work group.
Responsibilities:
Data Analysis - Sources, compiles, and interprets data. Analyzes data for accuracy and efficiencies, effectively communicates analysis output.
Identifying Requirements - Determines system requirements and communicates them through the use of specifications, reports, project plans, or other forms of documentation. Identifies issues that affect system processes, and assists in correcting. Ensures compliance through testing and analysis.
Reporting - Produces advanced reporting based on data analysis, user input, and system testing. Identifies patterns, problems, and areas of improvement. May develop process enhancements based on analysis results.
System Support - Provides expert technical support for systems by responding to escalated inquiries, ensuring processes run smoothly, and working to continuously improve the end-user experience. Implements recommended modifications and enhancements. Serves as an analytics resource to wider organization or business units, offering guidance on systems and data output.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree with 4 years of Systems Support, or Analytics, or Operational Support experience.
OR
High School Diploma or GED with 8 years of Systems Support, or Analytics, or Operational Support experience.

Additional Requirements:
Analytical skills – data.
Computer skills – software.
Detail oriented.
Organization skills.

Preferred Qualifications:
Digital Banking experience.

title: Hospice Business Development Specialist
desc:
Overview:
Implements marketing and growth strategy in assigned territory according to hospice service line goals. Evaluates and identifies key referral sources, providing ongoing marketing efforts to increase their use of Novant Health Hospice services. Educates the community, referral sources, patients and families on hospice services through daily, planned activities
including in-services, one-on-one presentations and group meetings.

Assist in development of marketing materials and other communication activities as assigned. Monitors referral integrity and results of marketing efforts. Works closely with the Manager, Hospice Business Development to organize and facilitate ongoing development efforts in territory, providing onsite support at events, as well as marketing for any/all fundraising opportunities. Establishes a collaborative working relationship with the Regional Coordinator for Hospice Volunteers and Program Development, to identify community activities and promote hospice/volunteer program opportunities.

At Novant Health, one of our core values is diversity and inclusion. By engaging the strengths and talents of each team member, we ensure a strong organization capable of providing remarkable healthcare to our patients, families and communities. Therefore, we invite applicants from all group dynamics to apply to our exciting career opportunities.
Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor's degree required. Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Journalism, Communications, Business Administration or related field required.
Experience: Minimum four years of healthcare marketing experience required.
Licensure/Certification/Registration: Valid drivers's license required
Additional Skills Required: Excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Must be comfortable with public speaking, in both large and small settings. Work environment involves deadlines and aggressive timelines for work performance. Must be able to maintain composure under pressure while meeting deadlines. Must be flexible in work environment, as schedule may consist of many hours in vehicle while on marketing visits. Ability to drive/travel to multiple locations/facilities as needed.

title: Construction Project Management Fellow
desc:
JOB SUMMARY: Serving as a Blue Ridge Project Management Fellow is a unique professional development opportunity. Working closely with the Project Director and Blue Ridge Team, the Project Management Fellow helps manage the planning, implementation, and conclusion phases of the project, and coordinates the work of the project team.
The Project Management Fellow is responsible for development, implementation, coordination, schedule, budget, documentation, turnover, and compliance of construction, renovation, upgrade, replacement, repair and move management projects for the system. The Project Management Fellow interfaces between System personnel and consulting architects, engineers, contractors, and vendors. The Project Management Fellow performs a broad spectrum of activities normally associated with project management as a team member of Planning, Design & Construction.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Develops and manages actual project scopes, schedules, and budgets.
Manages multiple projects or move projects with installation, on multiple campuses simultaneously.
Monitors projects while in progress and at completion to assure quality and adherence to codes.
Reads and understands design/construction drawings and specifications; has a technical knowledge of design and construction processes.
Proficient with Code review, proficient on regulatory compliance issues
Participates in the drawing and design reviews to ensure compliance with System standards
Reviews job scope, definitions, and contract documents to ensure final design falls within the System standards.
Possesses financial competence to supervise and bids plans and competitive process, manages financial commitments, invoices and project lift cycle costs; interfaces with audit teams as required
Coordinates activities of on-site team members, contractors, and vendors to execute the scope of work for a project without the daily operations of the facility being adversely affected
Implements projects including inspections, testing repairs and installations on behalf of the department and coordinate these activities with all team members and contractors involved
Communicates and coordinates with team members, external project team members and customers on all project related activities, keeps everyone updated, and secures concurrence of others on issues which might impact goals or system operations. Communicates through formal documents all construction activities that may affect daily operations.
Monitors and files weekly status reports on all continuing projects. Meets with Director as often as required, but at least weekly to discuss the status of various projects.
Ensures that all as-built information is assembled and complete. Submits to appropriate team for final billing and project closeout.
Provides leadership as the designated representative at project meetings through all phases of the project
Represents the department to ensure that the final project is functional and maintainable as well as in compliance with all System standards, specifications, and negotiations.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Education: Bachelor's degree in Construction or Project Management or equivalent required.
Experience: Relevant business experience in the field of architecture, construction, maintenance, or equivalent experience preferred. Healthcare design and/or construction experience preferred. Working knowledge of computer-based software applications required. CAD /BIM experience preferred.
License/Registration: Must possess a valid North Carolina drivers license
Other: Skilled in the application of construction management practices, in reading and interpreting design drawings and specifications. Demonstrated knowledge of the principals, practices, and standards associate with building construction, project management, and building codes.
TYPICAL PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Frequent standing and walking. Functional range of motion. Functional hearing and vision. Frequent bending, stooping and stretching. Occasionally lifting 50 pounds from floor to shoulder height and carrying 25 feet. Requires manual and finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination. Occasional climbing steps/ladders, crawl, squat, and kneel to observe work and conditions. Functional sense of smell, differentiation of hot/cold, sense of vibration.

Location: UNC Health Blue Ridge · Support Services
Schedule: Full Time, 1st Shift, 8am-5pm

title: Customer Strategy Senior Consultant
desc:
Deloitte Consulting LLP seeks Customer Strategy Senior Consultants at locations nationally. We are looking both for candidates with depth in particular industries and candidates who have worked across industries.

Work we do

The Customer and Marketing business within Deloitte Consulting serves clients facing fundamental strategic choices and growth challenges related to their customers and ecosystems. Our team brings together a diverse mix of strategists, marketers, digital and creative experts working to transform client organizations and capture value by deeply understanding clients' markets and customers.

Work you will do
Serve as the day-to-day lead on projects that start with a fundamental strategic customer problem
Assist clients to address the full range of CEO, CMO and other executive leadership challenges
Develop, maintain and expand senior client relationships and lead consultant and client project teams from project planning through execution.
Assist clients in making strategic decisions and implementing changes in areas such as marketing operating model design, customer experience and go-to-market strategy
Manage the preparation and performance of primary and secondary market research including customer interviews, focus groups and group interviews to obtain insights.
Lead quantitative customer data and analytics inquiries
Manage and deliver client engagements that identify, design and implement technology and creative business solutions for large companies
Monitor project status and progress, prepare and present weekly steering reports, assess risks, manage delays and escalate issues to steering committees.


The team

Customer Strategy & Applied Design

Our Customer Strategy & Applied Design team focuses on helping clients discover, design, and prototype customer growth strategies and innovation portfolios to create and drive change in a digital world. We bring knowledge and offerings to uncover the behaviors, motivations and preferences of our clients' customers and develop new experiences for them. Our team of professionals has deep capabilities in strategy, customer experience, digital strategy and innovation.

We deliver set of customer focused work:
Customer Strategy | Help clients build capabilities to better understand customer value drivers and make choices about the markets and segments they serve through digital, social, and mobile channels; optimize pricing decisions and shape the most strategic issues on the CMO agenda
Customer Experience | Help clients improve the quality, nature and power of interactions between the customer and the organization across the lifecycle of sales, marketing and service at each and every touch point.
Applied Innovation | Help clients rapidly design, prototype and launch new businesses and experiences, translating insights on human behavior from design-led methods into offerings and technologies that delight customers and drive growth
Digital Strategy | Help clients understand, envision and articulate "digital" as a business strategy aligned with their CEO's agenda - and then craft a plan to embed everything they do with the latest technology solutions and business models to compete in the marketplace for customers and talent

Qualifications Required:
Bachelor's degree
4+ years of substantial consulting experience providing customer and marketing strategy to clients
4+ years of significant project or work experience focused on customer strategy across industries (segmentation, customer experience, marketing, customer insights, etc.)
Consistent career progression with increasing levels of responsibility
Competent in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Travel up to 50% (While up to 50% travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Preferred:
Advanced degree in business
Experience leading or managing teams and change initiatives (especially in a project management role)
Experience leading programs with significant digital components
Experience with budgetary responsibilities related to projects or resources

title: Benefits Support Specialist
desc:
Gallagher is a global leader in insurance, risk management and consulting services. We help businesses grow, communities thrive and people prosper. A culture driven by our people, over 30,000 strong, serving our clients with customized solutions that will protect them and fuel their futures.
