title: Early Intervention Service Coordinator
salary:
Job details
Salary
$36,677 - $62,092 a year
Job Type
Full-time
desc:
The primary purpose of this position is to provide direct service coordination for children in the NC Infant-Toddler Program and to provide supports to their families/caregivers. Service coordination is a critical service that is helpful for families/caregivers and it is also required by the federal law, the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA). Services provided through the NC ITP must be compliant with the IDEA, federal regulations, and State policies and procedures.

This position as an Early Intervention Service Coordinator for children, birth to five, is located within the catchment areas of the Children's Developmental Services Agency (CDSA) of Raleigh or Durham area. Duties include working with families and providers to develop functional Individualized Family Service Plans (IFSPs), work with multi-disciplinary teams to determine families’ needs for supports and services, conduct home visits, coordinate and facilitate services and transition planning, and participate in the authorization and monitoring of early intervention services.

Salary Grade: GN09 Recruitment Range: $36,677 - $50,000
Position: 60040575/20-06471

About the Early Intervention Branch
The North Carolina Early Intervention Branch (NCEI) is a part of the N.C. Division of Public Health. It is the lead agency for the N.C. Infant-Toddler Program (ITP), which provides supports and services for families and their children, birth to three who have developmental delays and/or disabilities. Research shows that birth to three is a critical time frame for working with families to support their competence and confidence as their child’s best teacher because of what we know about brain development. This early learning offers a window of opportunity to make a positive difference in how a child develops and learns. The Children's Developmental Services Agencies (CDSAs), the local lead agencies that implement the ITP across North Carolina, work with local service providers to help families help their children succeed.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities / Competencies


To receive credit for all of your work history and credentials, you must list the information on the application form. Any information listed under the text resume section or on an attachment will not be considered for qualifying credit. Qualified applicants must document on the application that they possess all of the following:
Experience working with children in the age range of 0 – 5 and their families, including children with developmental delays.
Demonstrated knowledge of young child development.
Experience working with and collaborating with families, community organizations, and other agencies.
Management Prefers Candidate with the following
Coaching interaction styles and adult learning principles.
Experience working with infants, toddlers and their families using research-informed and/or evidence-based practices for the provision of early intervention services.
Experience developing treatment and/or outcomes-based plans, setting goals, planning, writing and measuring outcomes for children and their families
Good written and oral communication skills
Attention to detail and the ability to manage time independently
Fluency in a second language.
Physical Requirements
Must be able to drive and travel by car across the CDSA’s defined catchment area.
Minimum Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor s degree in Special Education, Elementary Education or Early Childhood Education, Psychology from an appropriately accredited institution and two years of professional experience working with the population served
OR
Bachelor s degree in human services field from an appropriately accredited institution and three years of professional experience working with the population served
OR
an equivalent combination of education and experience.

title: Senior Manager of Global Compliance
desc:
JOB DESCRIPTION
SUMMARY
The Senior Manager of Global Compliance has responsibility for leading a team that supports and maintains key compliance systems and processes across a variety of global compliance program elements and business areas. This person will work cross-functionally to ensure that compliance policies, training, and assessments are properly designed and managed. Areas of responsibility include corporate compliance policies (e.g., Anti-Corruption, Code of Conduct and Ethics, Corporate Governance), channel partner compliance, trade compliance, GDPR compliance and risk assessment management. This person will ensure compliance support is aligned with the Kollmorgen vision, mission and values and are in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.
This position can be performed in Radford, VA at our headquarters or can be performed remotely. If performed remotely, the amount of travel could increase. Expected travel is less than 25% of time.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Demonstrate a working knowledge of applicable compliance laws and regulations, industry trends, emerging issues, and ability to understand their applicability to risk management strategies, including the scoping of risk evaluations and monitoring.
Lead a team of regional compliance leads globally to drive synergy in the compliance function.
Serve as liaison for governmental and regulatory inquiries
Coordinate with global sites to ensure compliance with local, regional, and global trade compliance requirements
Ensure third-party compliance due diligence by complying with Altra’s Channel Partner toolkit
Oversee the development of and adherence to required compliance training for new and current employees
Partner with cross-functional associates to ensure understanding and adherence to US laws and regulations applicable to the company.
Lead a team conducting risk-based monitoring and evaluation activities, including risk assessment, auditing, monitoring, and testing, analysis of findings, and reporting to ensure effective, sustainable risk management processes exist (Import/Export, Enterprise Risk, Anti-Corruption)
Responsible for project management by leading and influencing cross functional enterprise or compliance teams.
Review implementation planning for new laws and regulations and ensures appropriate parties have been engaged.
Serve as a resource to Altra Corporate in Workplace Investigations
Serve as main point of contact for customer requests regarding Conflict Minerals
Analyze and interpret requirements for compliance as they relate to: Export Administration Regulations (EAR) of the U.S. Department of Commerce Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS),U.S. Treasury Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), International Traffic and Arms Regulations (ITAR) of the U.S. Department of State; U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP),Census Bureau, and other applicable Government Agency rules and regulations;
Develop, execute, and maintain trade compliance policies and procedures;
Responsible for approving and maintaining all broker agreements and powers of attorney
Key member of Cybersecurity task force
Participate in regional rep letter discussion and reviews
Experience managing all modes of transportation: small parcel, large parcel, air freight and ocean freight.
Make data-driven logistics related recommendations to the business to reduce cost and increase efficiency and drive implementation of your recommendations
Provide reporting and metrics across operations to stakeholders including executives.
Provide support during annual budget process for Transportation & Logistics budget

JOB REQUIREMENTS
Critical Competencies
Thorough knowledge of U.S. export control laws and regulations of the EAR, ITAR and OFAC.
Thorough understanding of applicable export controls and licensing requirements.
Extensive knowledge of U.S. Customs and Border Protection, C-TPAT and other CBP security initiatives.
In-depth knowledge of Customs regulations and U.S. Customs valuation, classification, and special trade programs.
Must be able to organize, prioritize, build effective teams and drive results.
Ability to influence across the company and to interact with persons at all levels
High accuracy and attention to detail are essential requirements for this position.
Capable of multi-tasking and prioritizing with excellent time management skills.
Capable of working independently and collaboratively.
Competent in making good judgment calls.
Good presentation and report writing skills.
Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to present them in a technical environment.
Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business or related and a minimum of 5-7 years in import/export administration or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience with export software packages
Domestic and International travel is required.
MRP/ERP experience is required.
APICS/CPM certification is a plus.
S. Customs Broker License a plus.

title: Manager Provider Recruitment
desc:
Overview:
Reporting to the Director of Provider Recruitment, the Manager of Provider Recruitment has primary responsibility to drive operational initiatives that will ultimately improve our provider recruitment effectiveness and candidate experience and to support the team to attract, source, and hire diverse provider talent that reflects the communities that Novant Health serves.
This is a hybrid role, working remote from home with the expectation for travel onsite as needed or requested.
The Manager of Provider Recruitment leads and develops high performing staff who recruit for multiple provider specialties, within Novant Health Medical Group (NHMG) and effectively manages and leads the recruitment process and the overall utilization of provider recruiters. The manager is fully responsible for the development of the recruitment process and the implementation of recruitment innovations. The manager solves all issues evolving during hiring job vacancies and makes all managerial decisions.

The manager ensures that the employment brand is extended through recruitment of the highest quality, mission-inspired medical staff, continually seeking to improve and deliver processes, outcomes, and customer evaluation of the NHMG Provider Recruitment experience. Additional duties include representing, marketing, and assessing the physician and APP needs of NHMG in partnership with the NHMG leadership, the director of provider recruitment and the individual practices. The manager will meet with internal clients, clinic administrators as well as Institute leaders, on a regular basis as potential gaps are identified and researched. The manager will also provide regular feedback to provider recruiters and internal clients.
At Novant Health, one of our core values is diversity and inclusion. By engaging the strengths and talents of each team member, we ensure a strong organization capable of providing remarkable healthcare to our patients, families and communities. Therefore, we invite applicants from all group dynamics to apply to our exciting career opportunities.
Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor's degree or equivalent education and experience, required.
Experience: 5 years experience in provider recruitment including executive and hard to fill positions requiring deep sourcing; other areas within recruitment may be considered if relative, required. Manager-level experience in provider development/recruitment, preferred. Project management experiencepreferred. Working with fraud, abuse and inurement laws. preferred. Laws related to recruitment and employment, including immigration and private practice support relationships, preferred.
Licensure/Certification/Registration: Association for Advancing Physician and Provider Recruitment (AAPPR), or Fellow, Association of Staff Physician Recruiters (FASPR), preferred.
Additional skills required:
Problem Solving: Strong creative problem-solving skills.
Digital Fluency: Proficiency with iCIMS or similar ATS, Microsoft Office 365, etc.
Highly Effective Communicator: Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively, appropriately and inclusively with key stakeholders at all levels.
Inclusion and Belonging: Foster a work environment of inclusion and belonging for all team members.
Judgment: Demonstrated ability to act independently upon information and make decisions that achieve optimal results.
Display professional image in alignment with employer and recruitment brand.
Respect confidential information.
Ability to think critically in a fast-paced environment and demonstrate visible momentum.
Demonstrated customer service skills.
Excellent organizational skills.
Ability to simultaneously handle multiple priorities.
Ability to manage budget, supervise staff, complete performance evaluations, organize and facilitate effective meetings, manage projects/programs, and effectively utilize resources to accomplish business objectives.
Thorough understanding of the provider recruitment landscape, tools, technologies, and methodologies. Ability to train and develop staff in selected methods, and oversee ongoing use at a high level.
Analyze issues using a holistic approach and comprehensive problem resolution methodology.
Participate in the development of innovative recruitment solutions to achieve NHMG mission and goals.
Ability to lead a team of diverse staff spanning geographic boundaries, including creation of ongoing communication methods, team building events/methods, and maintaining accessibility for staff not co-located.
Additional Skills/Requirements (preferred):
Entrepreneurial spirit and innovative drive for reaching the next great idea and exceeding goals.
Intellectual depth, moral integrity, personal vision, creativity, leadership skills, fortitude, sincerity and diplomacy.
Ability to work independently and as a team player who will productively engage with others at varying levels of seniority within and outside of Novant Health.
Responsibilities:
It is the responsibility of every Novant Health team member to deliver the most remarkable patient experience in every dimension, every time.
Our team members are part of an environment that fosters team work, team member engagement and community involvement.
The successful team member has a commitment to leveraging diversity and inclusion in support of quality care.
All Novant Health team members are responsible for fostering a safe patient environment driven by the principles of "First Do No Harm".

title: Technology Strategist
desc:
Are you a big-picture thinker who connects the dots and thrives on anticipating the unexpected? Are you energized by helping organizations prepare for challenges to mitigate risks? If you are seeking a role that offers you the opportunity to advise our Government and Public Sector clients through critical and complex issues, while allowing you to develop personally and professionally, consider a career in Deloitte Consulting's Strategy team! Our GPS practice brings deep industry expertise, rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve our client's most complex business problems. Join us, and play a key role in helping to design our clients' roadmap to the future.

The team

Strategy

Our Strategy practice brings together several key capabilities that will allow us to architect integrated programs that transform our clients' businesses, including Corporate & Business Unit Strategy, Technology Strategy & Insights, Enterprise Model Design, Enterprise Cloud Strategy and Business Transformation.

Strategy professionals will serve as trusted advisors to our clients, working with them to make clear data-driven choices about where to play and how to win, in order to drive growth and enterprise value.

Strategy will help our clients:
Identify strategies for growth and value creation
Develop the appropriate business models, operating models, and capabilities to support their strategic vision
Maximize the ROI on technology investments and leverage technology and Cloud trends to architect future business strategies


Qualifications

Required:
Bachelor's degree in Business Management, Communications, STEM or business-related field
2+ years of relevant consulting or industry experience
Prior federal consulting experience
Ability to build a project plan to execute tech transformation to include any of the following: data management modernization, data tooling, AI/ML , Cloud Technologies.
Ability to utilize Agile Release & Sprint Planning
Strong understanding of Agile PM
Experience assessing data reporting strategy and making recommendations to clients.
Strong technical comprehension
Experience working independently with minimal guidance
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with experience exercising mature judgment
Proven experience effectively prioritizing workload to meet deadlines and work objectives
Demonstrated ability to write clearly, succinctly, and in a manner that appeals to a wide audience
Ability to obtain and maintain the required Security Clearance for this role

Preferred:
Experience working with Lean Six Sigma
Well versed in Business Process Re-Engineering
Previous hands on experience with value stream mapping and predictive modeling


How you'll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

title: Sr Content Strategist
desc:
Job Summary:
The Senior Content Strategist leads the creation of the overall content architecture as well as the tactical work associated with assigned projects. This includes working with Architects, Designers, Prototypes, and Content Developers to provide quality and timely content-related deliverables to project teams in support of the design process.
To be successful, the Senior Content Strategist should have a general knowledge of external processes and technologies, both standard and unique to Lowe’s, including the work processes, technologies, platforms and services of the business. In addition, this role works cross-functionally, fostering relationships with key partners at all levels across the Technology organization.
Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for tone, style, content creation, content organization, and information architecture within digital experiences for Lowe's customers and associates
Partners with Marketing on digital brand and tone
Organizes content through CMS, building out a content matrix and information architecture
Writes and edits new/existing content for highly complex business requirements
Stays informed on best practices in a variety of content techniques; serve as a lead for the team on industry standards and trends
Leads multiple projects within a singular track of work within a platform/suite of products
Expert in content organization, content creation, and information hierarchy
Works independently to deliver quality, timely content, including strategy documents, content matrix and presentations
Review content and provide feedback and direction to other content strategists on the team
Stay on top of digital trends, emerging technologies, and new tools to continually improve the team’s position as experts in usability
Collaborates with others on the design team and lead design reviews
Provides mentorship to more junior level members of the content strategy team
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Communications, Journalism/English, Marketing, Content Strategy, or related field (or equivalent work experience in a related field)
5 years of experience in content strategy, copywriting and editing
Portfolio of completed projects

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience collecting and analyzing customer feedback and user testing results
Experience working in a corporate environment at an enterprise level
About Lowe’s
Lowe’s Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company serving approximately 19 million customer transactions a week in the United States and Canada. With fiscal year 2021 sales of over $96 billion, Lowe’s and its related businesses operate or service nearly 2,200 home improvement and hardware stores and employ over 300,000 associates. Based in Mooresville, N.C., Lowe’s supports the communities it serves through programs focused on creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts. For more information, visit Lowes.com.
About Lowe’s in the Community:
As a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company, Lowe’s is committed to creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts through nonprofit partnerships. Across every community we serve, Lowe’s associates donate their time and expertise through the Lowe’s Heroes volunteer program. For the latest news, visit Newsroom.Lowes.com or follow @LowesMedia on Twitter.
EEO Statement
Lowe’s is an equal opportunity employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Visual Space Planner
desc:
Job Summary:
The primary purpose of this role is to deliver on the approved Merchandising presentation intent. This position draws merchandise floor plans which provides the scale, scope, and plan for a multitude of projects.
Key Responsibilities :
Produces floor plans to enable merchandising initiatives aiding in the optimization of store space to achieve desired financial results.
Executes the physical design of the space, ensuring that the vision outlined in the floor plan is brought to reality and that it aligns with Lowe's merchandising and brand standards.
Makes recommendations to the Merchandising team as to how to deliver on the design needs, staying within the parameters of scope, strategy, and intent.
Outlines the details of the execution plan, drafts a production hand-off document, and creates visual aids for the support of projects.
Supports the development of in-bay product presentation that enhances the customer’s shopping experience, while maintaining effective store operational requirements.
Prepares all project planning materials for the Store Environment Merchandising and Space Planning partners to enable deliverables, keeping in line with timeline and budget.
Collaborates with Merchandising, Logistics, Loss Prevention, Marketing and other internal teams to translate merchandising strategy into executable store design.
Maintains accurate spatial information for each store.
Provides cost estimate templates, non-retail item matrix, visual intent packet, planogram hand off document and deployment package for each project.
Required Qualifications :
Bachelor's degree in Business, Architecture, Interior Design, Retail Management, Marketing, or related field and 2+ years’ experience in retail store planning and design (may be a combination of visual merchandising, store planning, planogramming, or store environment experiences)
OR
4+ years’ experience in retail store planning and design (may be a combination of visual merchandising, store planning, planogramming, real estate and facilities planning, or store environment experiences)
Preferred Qualifications :
Experience translating customer decision trees into presentation architecture
About Lowe’s
Lowe’s Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company serving approximately 19 million customer transactions a week in the United States and Canada. With fiscal year 2021 sales of over $96 billion, Lowe’s and its related businesses operate or service nearly 2,200 home improvement and hardware stores and employ over 300,000 associates. Based in Mooresville, N.C., Lowe’s supports the communities it serves through programs focused on creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts. For more information, visit Lowes.com.
EEO Statement
Lowe’s is an equal opportunity employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: District Sales Manager – Durham / Chapel Hill / Hillsborough
desc:
Join Our Community of Food People!
Oversee a group of Territory Managers (TMs) in the selling of (and may also sell) the Company's products and services using product, organizational, and customer knowledge to influence customers and assist them in applying the products and services to their needs, resulting in revenue generation. Directs TMs against opportunities in closing, penetrating existing accounts, as well as directing TMs with regards to new account acquisition and development within a specified district. Provide coaching, mentoring, and training to TMs to achieve profitable sales and case growth objectives.
Lead a group of TMs to achieve Division sales, penetration and churn reduction objectives; research, develop and maintain long and short range sales plans, while coaching and developing TMs in creating effective action planning to achieve AOP and Company goals.

Direct TMs toward high quality leads and assist TMs in warming leads and closing, working with TMs to open new accounts and reduce churn and highlighting need for New Business Manager to support TMs in opening high potential accounts.

Submit and administer annual street sales operating plan and operating budget, reviewing and approving street sales-related expenses, credits, donations, and contracts, and tracking performance against plan, identifying gap closures.

Leverage Sales Coordinator role to reduce time on administrative tasks, resolving TM and customer issues; assist in leveraging Restaurant Operations Consultant, Menu Analyst, Culinary Specialists, Customers Solutions Coordinator, Sr. Sales Analyst, and New Business Manager to grow account penetration and new accounts.

Assist in coordinating product cuttings and demonstrations; develop sales and marketing strategies and proposals for customers on products and services, conducting market research to determine customer needs and provide information to sales staff.

Communicate sales data to contribute to product/service planning; assist in planning district sales meetings and events with Marketing and Merchandising personnel.

Understand and utilize the Sales Foundations tools and processes to grow sales, generate additional revenue, and maintain customer service standard.

Coach, train and direct TMs to top account penetration and “quality” lead acquisition opportunities, creating effective action plans to achieve AOP and compensation goals, and ensuring accountability of TMs with regards to account development and goal attainment.

Recruit, train and mentor new hires as well as existing TMs, conducting field support/work-with sessions to observe coaching needs and support needs for TM development, and evaluate needs and recommend training as needed.

Oversee, manage, and assess TM performance to plan regularly, instituting performance improvement or disciplinary measures as needed. Assist TMs with organizational skills, account strategies, and territory planning.

Maintain current knowledge of industry trends and product developments that affect target markets, establishing and maintaining industry contacts that lead to prospective sales; evaluate product mix in terms of meeting customers’ needs.

Research and develop lists of potential customers, making targeted sales calls to develop relationships and follow up on leads along with sales staff. Conduct periodic Customer Business Reviews to identify customer needs as well as relationship gaps.

Assist in customer/delivery alignment and driver engagement.

Oversee the communication and execution of Company policies within the confines of the sales department.

Ensure that the sales organization is appropriately staffed and managed to minimize turnover.

Other duties and responsibilities as assigned or required.

Education/Training: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Sales & Marketing or related field or equivalent experience required.

Related Experience: A minimum of five years of foodservice sales experience required. A minimum of two years of supervisory experience required. Overnight travel may be required to participate in trainings, meetings, or other company events.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Demonstrated problem solving and negotiation skills required. Excellent oral and written communication skills, as well as customer service and presentation abilities. Must have proficient computer skills, preferably in Microsoft Office products (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Licenses:
Valid driver's license required
Candidates who have received a DUI conviction for drug or alcohol within the last three years will not be considered as eligible.
Other license history is reviewed and must meet company standards

desc:

The position will support the Quality Operations department by performing Quality Assurance material enrollment, supplier qualification, and material/component release activities associated with clinical and/or commercial products.

title: Entry Level Operations Manager
desc:
Here at Avis Budget Group we're more than just rentals—although over 70 years of experience and 11,000 locations in 180 countries has taught us a thing or two about that. We’re shaping the future of the mobility industry with our innovative, customer-focused solutions. Our globally recognized brands - Avis, Budget, Budget Truck and Zipcar - connect people to more. This means more convenience, more options and more time on the road for our customers. But we also connect our employees to more: opportunities, benefits, support, collaboration and most importantly—power to change the future. Sound your speed? Come join our family.
Start a career in management of front line teams in an exciting airport operation. Great perks, such as use of a new company vehicle.
Are you a natural born leader? Join Avis Budget Group as an Entry Level Operations Manager to coach and motivate your team to increase financial profitability, operational efficiency and customer satisfaction. You’ll quickly see the many opportunities you’ll have to grow and advance with our Fortune 500 company.
What you’ll do:
You will spend your first 90 days training and rotating through various critical functions including Production, Customer Service and Counter Sales to learn our varied business
After completing training, you will supervise one or more of the daily operations and sales functions to ensure maximization of fleet, revenue, customer satisfaction and employee management
Guide development of new employees and conduct on-going performance assessment of current employees
Perform duties and provide service in accordance to established operation procedures and company policies
Perks you’ll get:
Use of a new company vehicle which includes gas, insurance and maintenance*
Access to Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability insurance
401(k) Retirement Plan with company matched contributions
Eligible to elect other voluntary benefits including: Group Legal, Identity Theft, Accident Insurance, FSA, additional life insurance coverages
Contribute up to $270 as a tax-free benefit for public transportation or parking expenses
Employee discounts, including discounted prices on the purchase of Avis/Budget cars
Community involvement opportunities
What we’re looking for:
Recent graduate with Bachelor's Degree OR High School diploma/GED plus at least 4 years supervisory experience OR Associate's Degree plus at least 2 years supervisory experience
Ability to demonstrate strong leadership capabilities, work well in a team environment with a positive attitude and make independent decisions
Valid driver’s license and good driving record
Flexibility to work days, evenings, overnights, weekends and holidays
Willingness to work outdoor in weather conditions with moderate noise level
Extra points for this:
1 year of experience providing high quality customer service
Who are we?:
Glad you asked! Here at Avis Budget Group we're more than just rentals—although over 70 years of experience and 11,000 locations in 180 countries has taught us a thing or two about that. Shaping the future of the mobility industry with our innovative, customer-focused solutions, our globally recognized brands including Avis, Budget, Budget Truck and Zipcar connect people to more. This means more convenience, more options, and more time on the road for our customers. We also connect our employees to more: opportunities, benefits, support, collaboration and most importantly-power to change the future. Sound your speed? Come join our family.
The fine print:
Avis Budget Group is an equal opportunity employer – M/F/Veterans/Disabled.
This role requires the ability to frequently stand, sit, walk, drive, and type. This advertisement does not constitute a promise or guarantee of employment. This advertisement describes the general nature and level of this position only. Essential functions and responsibilities may change as business needs require. *Use of company vehicle subject to company policy. This position may be with any affiliate of Avis Budget Group.
Avis Budget Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

This position serves as the sole staff development position for the Division of Services for the Blind and is based in Raleigh, NC. In communication with management and Division leadership, this position leads the effort to maintain a staff which is well prepared to serve the current needs of Division clients.

Key responsibilities of the position include:
Identify training needs for all Division staff as well as by office location and staff roles
Serve as the point of contact for the learning management system
Maintain accurate and detailed records for reporting
Collaborate with other program specialists and leadership to develop high quality, relevant trainings for staff
Coordinate training logistics; provide guidance and assistance to staff on training logistics
Develop surveys as well as interpret and apply survey results
Research trends in the field of visual impairment and blindness which may impact staff training needs
Develop training materials and content which is accessible to all participant
Assist leadership with responses to inquiries from the legislative and executive branches as well
Represent the Division in cross-divisional meetings and with outside organizations
Assist with the development or revision of agency policies to ensure compliance with state and federal requirements

title: AVP, Workforce Absence Management
desc:
ABOUT HUB INTERNATIONAL:
HUB International Limited (“HUB”) is the 5th largest global insurance and employee benefits broker, providing a broad array of property, casualty, risk management, life and health, employee benefits, investment and wealth management products and services. With over 14,000 employees in 500+ offices throughout North America, HUB has grown substantially, in part due to our industry leading success in Mergers and Acquisitions.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU:
At HUB we believe in investing in the future of our employees. Our entrepreneurial culture fosters an environment of open feedback and improvement that empowers our people to make the best decisions for our customers and organization. We offer:

Competitive salaries and benefits offerings

Medical/dental/vision insurance and voluntary insurance options

Health Savings Account funding

401k matching program

Company paid Life and Short-Term Disability Plans

Supplemental Life and Long-Term Disability Options

Comprehensive Wellness Program

Generous PTO Package - Vacation, Holiday, Sick, and Personal Time Off

Great work/life balance, because that’s important for all of us!

Focus on creating a meaningful environment through employee engagement events

The ability to be a part of a motivated, winning team with the opportunity to learn from colleagues who are amongst the top talent in the industry!

Growth potential - HUB is constantly growing and so can your career!

A rewarding career that helps local businesses in the community

Strong community support and involvement through HUB Gives

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide subject matter expertise in Integrated Absence Management programs, knowledgeable in Short and Long Term Disability, FMLA/leave of absence, Paid Time Off (including sick and vacation), and coordination with Workers’ Compensation.

Conducts analytical evaluations on absence-related data received from carriers/vendors and employers

Establish and maintain relationships with senior and executive level client contacts by providing superior levels of service

Build and maintain external networks including vendors, partners, industry resources, etc.

Develop strategy options and evaluation criteria for clients around absence programs and lead implementation of strategies

Play lead role in fact-finding, analytic investigation to identify issues and risks

Identify people and systems implications required to enable solutions

REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s degree from four-year college or university

1-3 years of experience in Paid Time Off, Disability, Leave and absence programs consulting/management at either a carrier/TPA, broker or large employer (2500 or more employees).

Experience with consulting group or employer preferable

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

High degree of self-motivation and discipline

Ability to travel and work beyond normally scheduled workweek as necessary

Reasoning ability including the ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.

Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.

This position may work remote and may be located across the HUB South region.

Department Account Management & Service

Required Experience: 2-5 years of relevant experience

Required Travel: Up to 50%

Required Education: Bachelor's degree (4-year degree)

title: Co Manager
desc:
Position Overview:
In partnership with the Store Manager, direct all activities required to achieve all store goals, including financial objectives, client service, human resource management, operational controls, payroll and operating expenses, loss prevention, and merchandise presentation while driving both associate and client engagement.

Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities:
Partners with Store Manager to lead and direct all store activities
Embraces our values & sets an example through his/her behaviors
Responsible for compliance with all ANN INC. practices and procedures
Additional responsibilities as assigned by the Store Manager

Direction/Revenue Generation:
Directs client service efforts that are consistent with ANN INC. standards, to increase transactions and capture client opportunities
Drives a business strategy to grow sales & profits and maximizes opportunities to generate additional store volume/revenue
Understands how to maximize daily business by proactively managing team to embrace ANN INC. service standards while effectively performing Store Leadership responsibilities
Drives toward store’s achievement of quantifiable performance results (e.g. Net Sales, ROV, Conversion, DPT, UPT, Payroll, Inventory Shortage, Operational Assessments, and Credit Cards)
Analyzes business reports to identify, gain understanding, and recommend solutions to missed opportunities and to positively impact store performance

People Management:
Models ANN INC.’s Purpose, Values & Behaviors while holding associates responsible for their actions
Fosters a client focused team environment by driving volume and anticipating clients’ needs
Assists with development of team to accomplish store’s business objectives through recruitment, selection, coaching, investment, engagement, retention, and motivation
Provides exceptional client service by role modeling the ANN INC. service standards. Takes responsibility to immediately address client concerns
Participates in delivering an engaging assimilation and investment experience that is personalized and positions on Associate for excellence in fole and career progression over time through the use of ANN INC. tools
Adheres to Human Resource standards by following the general practices outlined in Company policies, procedure, standards and guidelines
Communicates appropriate goals, results (e.g. financial performance and productivity), and directives
Actively manages associates’ client service skills by providing informal and formal feedback
Assists in the recruitment, attraction, selection, and hiring of diverse talent
Holds self and associates accountable for achievement of financial results and statistical standards
Constructively confronts and provides timely feedback to help resolve conflict
Seeks a continuous learning environment by requesting input and involving others
Treats others fairly and with respect, valuing differences; builds relationships based on an individual approach
Assists in the development of associates by delegating appropriately and matching talents with tasks, while recognizing accomplishments
Supports Store Manager to foster team commitment through building relationships and recognizing individual contributions
Forms networking relationships with internal and external peers
Shares information and communicates clearly and in an accessible manner to all levels
Leads by effectively managing through change and adversity

Operational Excellence:
Executes brand visual standards and standard operating procedures
Prioritizes and leads execution of task directives within designated timeframes while using tools and resources to drive a high level of productivity (e.g. Price Changes, Mark Out of Stock (MOS), StyleFinders, Distributed Order Maintenance (DOM), Merchandising Needs, Payroll Adjustments, Processing of Shipment, Transfers, and Proper Claims Process)
Adjusts weekly schedules as needed to maximize productivity and control payroll spend
Reports to work as scheduled; records time worked accurately by using ANN INC.’s Time and Attendance system; remains flexible to the needs of the business
Supports Loss Prevention practices and completes operational assessments to protect company assets
Maintains the store’s organization, appearance, and cleanliness according to SOP’s
Uses available resources to assist in executing tasks/directives
Ensures compliance of with all policies, practices and procedures and all federal, state, and local laws
Leverages tools, processes, and best practices to drive operational excellence and consistently execute SOP’s

Product/Brand Management:
Executes visual merchandising updates and product placement within corporate guidelines and maintains visual expectations as defined by the Visual Merchandising Standards
Uses product knowledge tools to execute directives and interpret Store Sets
Executes company brand initiatives to the physical store layout
Supports continuous product movement based on company directives, client profile, and store sales
Integrates strategic activity on the floor, which includes recovery and restocking
Understands and can clearly articulate the company’s band positioning
Educates associates on marketing initiatives, product placement, lifestyle concepts, and product knowledge
Applies knowledge of product with internal and external clients
Represents the brand and hold associates accountable to expectations
Embraces fashion, understands current market trends and is able to articulate them using ANN INC. interpretations in every client interaction. Represents the brand by adhering to ANN INC.’s dress code guidelines
Understands ANN INC.’s competitor and communicates competitive landscape

Position Requirements:
Human Resources: Proven ability to recruit, develop, and retain team
Client Service: Demonstrate ability to function as a role model, ensuring that the client remains the top priority
Store Operations and Organization: Demonstrate ability to organize, delegate, prioritize, meet deadlines, and follow-up on all store activities
Leadership: Ability to respectfully challenge and motivate associates
Merchandising: Knowledge of visual standards and techniques
Communication: Demonstration of strong verbal and written communication skills
Business Analysis: Knowledge of store reports in order to maximize performance, drive volume, and react to trends in the business
Schedule: Ability to work a flexible schedule to meet the needs of the business, including evening and weekend shifts. Must have open availability
Physical: Ability to lift and carry up to 20 pounds occasionally, maneuver effectively around sales floor, stock room, and office

Educational Requirements and Experience:
Minimum Requirements: Associates or Bachelors Degree preferred
Supervisory/Management experience in the service industry preferred

title: Mortgage Compliance Officer
desc:
Deephaven was founded in 2012 to provide mortgages to the millions of Americans who, for one reason or another, are unable to qualify for a traditional, government-backed loan. Deephaven champions those mortgage borrowers whose independence, entrepreneurial drive and determination are often the very reason why they can't qualify for a traditional loan. Using ingenuity, supported by common-sense underwriting, we continuously and responsibly innovate new mortgage products and programs that put homeownership within reach of millions of borrowers and investors that need and deserve financing. We offer our loans through a network of 1,000+ independent mortgage brokers. We also buy loans from more than 200+ correspondent partners. Deephaven is headquartered in Charlotte, North Carolina and is owned by Pretium, a highly specialized investment manager focused on real estate, mortgage finance and corporate debt.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Monitor changes to applicable federal and state laws, rules, regulations, and guidelines
Collaborate with business units to assess impacts to processes, controls, and documentation and assist with implementation of updates to comply with laws, rules, regulations, and guidelines
Track external requests from examiners, regulators, and third parties to ensure timely responses are provided
Assist management in researching and responding to external requests from examiners, regulators, and third parties
Develop and update policies and procedures
Proactively identify compliance risks and operationalize remediation plans to mitigate risk exposure
Assist with development and tracking of companywide compliance and regulatory training
Any and all other duties as requested by management
Requirements
Bachelor's Degree required
2+ years demonstrated history of providing compliance advice and direction applicable to residential mortgage origination and/or business purpose mortgage lending
Proficiency in using Microsoft Office Suite
Must be an articulate and effective communicator
Must have experience in preparing and delivering written reports
Project management experience preferred
Six Sigma certification preferred
What We Offer
This position offers the opportunity to join a collegial, entrepreneurial firm committed to the personal and professional growth of its team members and to maintaining a positive, encouraging work environment where people enjoy working together. The company offers a comprehensive benefits and perks package, including:
Competitive base salary and bonus
401(k) plan with an employer match
Health insurance with significant employer contribution
Paid Time Off (PTO) program
Employee incentive compensation program

Here at Lenovo, we believe in smarter technology for all, so we spend our time building a society that’s brighter and more inclusive. And we go big. No, not big—huge.

We’re a US$60 billion revenue Fortune Global 500 company serving customers in 180 markets around the world. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that power (through devices and infrastructure) and empower (through solutions, services and software) millions of customers every day and together create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society for everyone, everywhere.

The one thing that’s missing? Well… you...
Description and Requirements
Lenovo is seeking a Diversity Innovation Project Manager to join the Product Diversity Office team to enhance and increase our innovative capabilities by bringing the voice of our customers with different abilities and physical attributes into the design process.
DESCRIPTION:
Primary responsibility is to develop, strategize, and plan new interventions that will drive the development of new products as a part of the Diversity by Design process across Lenovo.
Other duties include:
Lead the development of products and feature concepts from ideation through user research, prototyping, and communication to stakeholders
Lead the development of a new diversity innovation process to drive repeatable results in our ongoing effort to improve accessibility and inclusion with our products
Drive empathy for our diverse users by bringing their story to life and being a champion for innovation on their behalf
Use project management methodologies to scope project phases, define key deliverables, build project plans, and execute against outcomes in a dynamic, adaptive organization across multiple teams while working towards tight deadlines
Understand technical requirements to bring the proposed solution to life
Ability to communicate effectively to internal stakeholders including leaders and external audiences and learners

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
5+ years professional experience in project management within creative industries
Experience in human-centric design thinking and iterative product design
Language proficiency: Excellent written and verbal English
PREFERRED:
Experience working in a global company
Strong business acumen and ability to translate human insights into commercial outcomes
Experience and demonstrable ability to work with people of different abilities and diverse backgrounds
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills across all channels
Demonstrated desire for continuous learning and improvement
Ability to deal with uncertainty and thrive in a fast-paced, creative, and fluid work environment
Ability to work under pressure managing multiple projects/requests simultaneously while successfully coping with interruptions and redefined priorities
Ability to follow processes where necessary

To be fully vaccinated means individuals must receive the full series of a vaccine either approved by the FDA or WHO and listed by the CDC (e.g. two dose of the Moderna, AstraZeneca or Pfizer-BioNTech vaccines; or one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine). title: Sr. Project Manager
desc:
RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:
Set the direction for the project team. Improving the performance. Ensure respectful communications by creating an atmosphere of collaboration and iterative improvements, inspiring people and collaboration, and welcoming change by team engagement of planning and problem solving.
Actively handle Stakeholders expectations, resource alignment, and possible conflicting priorities across the projects. Lead scope definition and communication sessions. Apply negotiation abilities to drive project team and Executives to make decisions in a timely manner in order to deliver project as to agreed scope, schedule and within budget.
Actively demonstrate abilities as a ‘Self Starter, ‘In Charge’ ‘Thought Leader’ & ‘Mentor/Coach’ who is proactive in seeking opportunities to serve in leadership roles, even outside of their area of responsibility. Consistently demonstrate MIT values, especially in the area of Leadership within their project and Organizational team.
‘Lead by example’. Build a reputation as a positive problem solver who collaborates in a constructive manner to create iterative improvements for operational efficiencies within the position, project team, and MIT.
Drive through 'analysis paralysis' and make progress with minimal direction. Multi-task by leading the execution of ad hoc vs. planned deliverables within tight timeframes, among multiple managers with conflicting priorities.
Be conscious of team behavior and provide constructive feedback to line managers for annual Performance Evaluation.
Demonstrate commitment and ensure team adherence to MIT Enterprise Project Governance and Project Data Integrity within activities such as MIT Investment Framework, Estimation, Purchasing, Project, Resource & Development tools, Planning, Scheduling, Execution, Iterative Development Methodologies, Risk Management, Quality & Process Control. Change Management, Project Completion/Closeout, Status Reports, Presentations, Training Plans and Transition to Operations.
Collaborating with Technology and Business stakeholders, supervise project/program budgets at a detail level. Applying expertise, lead project sessions such as estimation, requirements, scheduling/planning within an iterative development framework. Lend broad and deep credibility during discussions based on prior experience. Serve as mentor/coach to others on the team in this capacity. Collaborate with appropriate SMEs.
Lead and drive issue resolution, risk identification and mitigation, change and dependency management. Encourage the active use of a strong risk management framework with the project teams and customers.
Provide excellently crafted MIT Governance communication vehicles on time and with completeness such as Resource Management reports, Watch List Status Reports, Executive level status, using MS Office tools suite.
Proactively seek out to address ambiguity by providing transparency and by owning and implementing solutions.
Provide a positive presence to Organizational team. Volunteer and own organizational results through execution.
Minimum education and work experience required for position includes:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field; or equivalent work experience
Must have 10+ years of validated IT PM experience & 5 years of senior management experience, preferably in the financial sector, encompassing iterative development methodologies, all with increasing levels of responsibility and budget management. (approx $5M-$10M)
3 years demonstrated ability in strategic business planning preferred.

KEY COMPETENCIES
Excellent and purposefully proven understanding of the Project Lifecycle and the inherent responsibilities as a PM applying an iterative development methodology. Ability to lead team sessions in scope, estimation, planning, scheduling, etc. lending deep knowledge to discussions because of past practical experience.
Ability to organize complementary projects into programs and handle accordingly.
Reputation as an “In Charge” and “Take Charge’ project manager with the experience in leading projects/program which are broad scope, interdependent, high risk, high impact, long implementation time frames, cross functional and of significant magnitude. Resources could be onsite or offshore.
Excellent project financial abilities.
Excellent ability to create, analyze and present written, verbal, and presentation communication skills to various audiences.
Commitment to leadership both and words and actions within the team. Proactively and continually identify and complete operational efficiencies. Excellent ‘change management’ skills, with the vital skills to implement clarity where ambiguity exists.
Excellent multi-Stakeholder leadership skills with strong negotiation competencies, providing positive interactions.
Ability to set direction and delegate to project team, then follow up as necessary to ensure team meets project/program deliverables in relation to the project or departmental initiatives.
Infrastructure Services PMO

title: Manager, Human Resources (HR) Shared Services - Compliance
desc:
Manager, Human Resources (HR) Shared Services - Compliance

Applicants or employees with disabilities must be offered any reasonable accommodations, which are necessary for them to be able to perform the essential functions of a position.

Key Role Description:

This role will lead all efforts related to Talent-specific compliance activities surrounding the Talent record retention and destruction policy, and more. Serve as point of contact for these activities and work with specialists and others to ensure all activities are completed in a timely and compliant manner. This role will interact with other areas of Talent for all record related subjects, as well as with Records Management Services (RMS), Talent Risk, and the Office of General Counsel. Potential candidates must be knowledgeable on these areas and work to ensure immediate resolution on all items.

Job Responsibilities:


Oversee and execute on all Talent records management related matters
Develop and manage processes to optimize efficiency and quality
Lead records management project initiatives, project execution, resource deployment, and overall leadership and coordination efforts to ensure projects are completed on schedule and within budget.
Provide insight, strategic context, direction, and leadership to RMS and other professionals involved in assigned areas of responsibility for Talent records.
Provide guidance to Talent Record Stakeholders on Talent official and transient records, including supporting Talent Risk with the Talent Confidential Information Management Plan (CIMP).
Foster and maintain strong relationships with internal clients and stakeholders - Office of General Counsel, Office of Confidentiality & Privacy, Information Technology Services, Talent Risk, RMS etc.
Serve as a subject matter expert and trusted advisor for applicable record processes, work autonomously and partner with appropriate stakeholders to understand and address highly complex record related challenges and issues.
Use knowledge to identify trends. Develop, implement, and enhance Talent records related processes.
Provide effective communication and follow-through while acting as a dependable and responsive point of contact for practitioners and leadership within and outside of Talent.
Team with the Compliance team on Talent privacy efforts, including annual Safe Harbor Recertification, and providing subject matter expertise as it relates to Talent record keeping.
Develop and present communication materials appropriate for audiences including, but not limited to, RMS team members, One Team/Office Experience professionals, business leaders, records system users, and other business stakeholders.
Manage and direct ELE team members supporting the applicable activities. Provides coaching, feedback, and development opportunities to others on program / project teams.
Develop the skills and capabilities of the US and USI Compliance team members in this subject matter.
Take part in special project assignments to develop world class processes and tools for Talent Services ELE and overall Talent Services.
Perform other job-related duties as assigned.

Qualifications:


Microsoft Office; HR system experience
Bachelor's Degree
Minimum of 8-10 years Human Resource or related experience
Ability to manage complex projects with virtual teams
Creative problem-solving skills; strategic and takes initiative
Ability to handle difficult conversations in professional manner
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Refresh and Grow your Career with Us!
Job Overview
The Compensation Analyst is responsible for analyzing, evaluating, and maintaining core compensation policies, programs, and processes (including job evaluation, salary structure development, survey participation, incentive plan design, and associated analysis) to support the organization's business initiatives and strategic goals. Additionally, this position monitors Total Rewards programs, practices, and policies in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local statutes.
Duties & Responsibilities
Conducts analyses and creates high-level summaries to support leadership presentations and decision processes
Researches and analyzes market data trends that align external benchmarks with internal positions, evaluate internal equity, external competitiveness, business conditions, legal requirements, and economic impact to make sound recommendations and resolve compensation concerns
Researches and analyzes market data trends that align external benchmarks with internal positions, evaluate internal equity, external competitiveness, business conditions, legal requirements, and economic impact to make sound recommendations and resolve compensation concerns
Provides analytical support to identify gaps and inefficiencies in programs, processes for a broad base and, or incentive compensation initiatives
Conducts individual and group salary analyses using market-based evaluation methods and prepare recommendations to maintain a competitive position within labor markets
Audits compensation processes, programs, and provides recommendations to ensure compliance with internal guidelines and government regulations
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
HR technologies, compensation modules, and compensation modeling and forecasting tools. Knowledge of relevant Federal, State, Local laws, regulations relating to compensation
Certified Compensation Professional (CCP) and, or Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM) certification
Experience in sourcing and managing salary benchmarking surveys, including job matching, survey submissions, comparative reviews, pay line analyses, and reporting
Ability to manage multiple and competing priorities with high volume work periods combined with tight deadlines
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to influence, and lead discussions utilizing data
High-level and advanced proficiency in MS Access, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Excellent communication skills, teamwork, and collaboration
Minimum Qualifications
High school diploma or GED
Knowledge acquired through 3 to up to 5 years of work experience
Preferred Qualifications
Three (3) years of increasing responsibility in data analysis, market research, and comprehensive knowledge of compensation
Bachelors Degree in Accounting, Statistics, Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Human Resources or related experience
Work Environment
Office environment

title: HR Business Partner
desc:
COME THRIVE WITH US!

Come join The Forest as we strive to provide a best in class, caring community that fosters the independence of our residents by enhancing their ability to lead healthy, active, purposeful and secure lives. We aim to be both the Preferred Provider of Service for older adults and the Employer of Choice in the Greater Durham area.

We have an open HR Business Partner role that will give you the opportunity to fulfill your professional objectives and to be a part of a team that is committed to success. This is a chance to take your HR experience, expertise, and goals, and contribute to an organization with great potential for personal and professional satisfaction, development, and pride.

What are the position responsibilities?

Advise and coach managers on the implementation of strategies and policies regarding Performance Management, Competence Development, Talent Management, Employee Relations, Workforce Planning, Recruitment, and Compensation and Benefits to support TFAD vision and KPI objectives and to maximize employee engagement.
Promote positive employee relations through inspirational leadership. Coach managers through complex employee relations situations/issues. Champion TFAD culture as well as assure alignment of management actions with TFAD values and principles.
Prioritize a customer service approach, resolving complaints, investigations, and support requests efficiently and thoroughly, ensuring compliance with all related processes, policies, and laws.
Act as a change agent to drive a continuous improvement mindset while building a culture of high performance and accountability.
Be a cultural steward developing and executing on initiatives which create a positive, respectful, and productive work environment.
What are we looking for in an HR Business Partner?

Bachelor's degree in human resources, business, or related discipline, or equivalent experience.
6-10 years' experience in human resources partnership; non-profit, health care, and/or CCRC experience is helpful but not required.
HR Certification is highly regarded. If not currently certified, certification is required within two years of hire.
Excellent written and verbal communications skills (including effective presentation skills) with the ability to interact comfortably at all levels of the organization.
Thorough knowledge of US employment law and HR professional practices.
The ability to understand business goals and recommend new HR approaches, policies and procedures to effect continual improvements in business objectives, productivity, and development of HR within the company.
A true hands-on approach with the ability to perform at both strategic and tactical HR levels.
A commitment and capability to build strong relationships with managers and Team Members to support open communication, and mutual trust and respect.
Strong internal and external customer service focus.
What The Forest provides our Team Members…

A beautiful campus and work environment filled with friendly people.
Competitive compensation based on experience.
Low cost health insurance coverage (major medical, vision, dental).
Life and disability insurance coverage paid 100% by The Forest.
FSA, Accident, Critical Illness, and Voluntary Life insurance are available.
403B retirement plan with above average company match and immediate vesting.
Generous paid sick and vacation time.
.…and so much more!

If you are interested in becoming one of our newest Team members, then we'd like to hear from you! Please complete our online application now for prompt consideration!

The Forest at Duke is proud to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), national origin, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, veteran status, or any other class of unique or protected character.

Participation in our Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) Vaccination (including booster) program is a requirement for all employees. Religious and medical exemptions are accepted.

title: Senior Manager -Atrium Health Behavioral Health ED Psychiatr...
desc:
Overview
Job Summary
FT Primarily virtual, may need to go to BH Charlotte and or Abbey place as needed.
Partners with the physician co-leader, leadership team, and various support departments to create practice environment and operations to drive progress and achieve goals in the areas of financial performance, revenue cycle management, patient satisfaction, telephony performance, employee engagement, provider satisfaction, quality of care, Care Coordination, patient and teammate safety, EMR Meaningful Use, e-Health, and other initiatives.


Essential Functions
Oversees the daily operations of the practice, with the physician co-leader to include: scheduling and registration of patients, verification of insurance, clinical work-up, treatment and flow of patients, capture of clinical information in the EMR, proper coding and charging of services rendered, scheduling and pre-certification of specialty referrals and ancillary services, collection of co-pays and co-insurance payments.
Ensures that practice operations and team members are knowledgeable of and in compliance with applicable regulatory, licensing and accrediting agency standards and applicable state and federal laws, as well as policies and procedures as defined by the System.
Promotes effective communication dialogue with providers and staff through daily huddles, regularly scheduled staff meetings, or other means of communication.
Analyzes data with physician co-leader, using data to work collaboratively with providers, other team members, patients and vendors to continually enhance performance, positively effecting clinical outcomes and patient satisfaction.
Demonstrates fluency in the EMR/Canopy, effectively implementing and monitoring utilization of the tool for improved preventive medicine and disease management practices. Achieves goals in Appropriate Care Measures of Quality and Meaningful Use of the EMR.
Assumes responsibility for the recruitment of qualified staff.
Works with team members on mutual goal setting, providing regular performance feedback and evaluation.
Manages practice by improving utilization of resources, and maintaining practice efficiency while seeking to minimize operational costs. Assigns duties and determines staff work schedules based on competencies of available staff and patient/practice needs.
Promotes the financial viability and accomplishment of financial goals of the practice by effectively managing billing, collections and budget processes, including proactive cost containment activities.
Physical Requirements
Work requires use of telephone and sitting for prolonged periods of time. Walking, standing, lifting bending, reaching, stooping, pushing and pulling are required a moderate amount of the time. May lift and carry up to 40 pounds on an intermittent basis. Must demonstrate the ability to communicate with individuals and groups effectively. Must possess critical thinking and ability to concentrate. Must be able to work with high volume of activities/projects with short deadlines. Must be able to deal with intense, emotionally charged issues. Work can require non-traditional hours (early mornings or late evenings and/or weekends).


Education, Experience and Certifications
High School Diploma or GED required; Bachelor's Degree strongly preferred. At least 1 year of experience in a medical practice (or completion of a practice manager training program), including managing the financials (billing, collection, etc.) in a medical facility environment, is desired. Relevant certifications (MGMA, ACHE or the Professional Association of Health Care Office Management) are preferred. Excellent written and spoken communications skills in English are required. Bilingual in other language/s based on working location and relevant patient population is preferred. Ability to build relationships, problem solve, remain flexible, attention to details, knowledge of virtual care preferred, ability to navigate MS teams, excel, PowerPoint, Core Connect, saavy with technology and solutions.

title: Math Curriculum Designer: Elementary Specialist
desc:
IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 13 million students worldwide, is seeking an experienced, passionate educator to join our team as an elementary math specialist. In this role, you'll lend your specialized knowledge and expertise in K–5 math education to help the curriculum design team craft exceptional learning experiences for elementary students. Your strong writing skills, creative problem solving, educational insights, and commitment to quality will make personalized learning a reality for millions of students.
This is a full-time position in our Raleigh, NC office with a hybrid work schedule.
WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
Design creative, engaging, interactive activities both online and in print
Consult with other curriculum designers to ensure content is age-appropriate and meets educational objectives
Collaborate with visual designers, curriculum managers, and company leaders to determine appropriate instructional approaches
Develop and manage project plans to create and deliver high-quality math content
Write rigorous and mathematically correct content
Research and analyze content requirements and strategies
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
Bachelor's degree required - advanced degree or degree in Mathematics is a plus
K–5 math teaching experience - experience as math coach or math supervisor is a plus
Excellent writing ability
Experience in curriculum development and instructional design
Can-do attitude with an openness to others' ideas
Highly self-motivated and efficient with superb attention to detail
#li-hybrid

title: Supplier Diversity Analyst
desc:
Address: USA-NC-Salisbury-2110 Executive Drive
Store Code: Vendor Strategy (27266)

What’s Our Dish
Announced in May 2018, Peapod Digital Labs (PDL) is an Ahold Delhaize USA company that powers the eCommerce and digital strategies for the Great Local Brands of Ahold Delhaize USA. Accelerating growth in digital and personalization capabilities, PDL is an innovation lab focused on meeting the changing needs of customers, regardless of when, where, and how consumers choose to shop.

Browse The Aisles
Peapod Digital Labs and Supplier Diversity Team are driven by putting the customer at the center of all they do and are constantly looking for ways to evolve the omnichannel grocery experience. We are a seeking positive, enthusiastic, team orientated individual who wants to work in an entrepreneurial environment to develop and execute high-value strategic initiatives to increase the diversity of the supplier base across the brands of Ahold Delhaize USA.

Supplier Diversity Associates work with the Managers and Leads and:
Cleanses & consolidates complex data from multiple sources and turn these into simple, relevant and actionable insights that support the Supplier Diversity roadmap.
Creates various Supplier Diversity scorecards by leveraging several sources of data.
Assists with various ad hoc analysis and reporting, often in partnership with key cross-functional stakeholders.
Assists in the development and the utilization of innovative data visual presentation strategies to ensure data is conveyed in meaningful and interpretive formats for all stakeholders.
Participates in key team discussions and share analysis, viewpoints and rationales.
Cross-functionally helps shape successful business plans and strategic decisions through the assessment of the current environment and marketplace by analyzing various sources of data, researching competitors and leading internal cross-functional conversations.
Develops strategic recommendations for the organization, often developing supporting analytics and presentations.
Helps stand-up Tier 2 spending tracking and reporting process
Sets up vendors on an as-needed basis.
Processes POs, Invoices and routes other financial documents throughout the organization.
Provides administrative support to ensure efficient operation of Supplier Diversity Team.
Supports overall Supplier Diversity initiatives and attends various events & panels as needed.
Provides support to Vendor Strategy and Commercial strategy as needed.

People who will do well in this role often have the following traits:
Comfortable using data to tell a story and enjoys creating presentations
Proficient with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Creative, structured, and objective problem solver, both conceptually and analytically
Collaborative, enjoy working on teams, can work well with all levels of an organization
Passionate about Supplier Diversity and ready to work hard in a fast-paced environment to create tangible change

The Essentials In Your Cart - The required ingredients
Bachelor's degree required
+2 years of eCommerce / retail Merchandising / retail Marketing / CPG or consulting experience is preferred
Domestic travel required with minimal notice required up to 20% per year
Proficient with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint

Extra Spices - What you should bring to the table
Being comfortable using complex data
Detail-oriented
Able to quickly analyze data, draw and present conclusions with actionable steps and measure final outcome
Strong financial and business acumen
Works well independently in ambiguous situations and with limited supervision when required
#LI-KM #LI-Hybrid

Join Us at Our Table
Peapod Digital Labs is a forward-thinking company with a strong legacy of innovation. We recognize who powers our progress – our people! We offer a great variety of benefits and perks to our employees, including: great health care options, including PPO and HSA plans (with company contributions), dental, vision, flexible spending accounts, a 401k with strong company match and immediate vesting, and generous and flexible paid time off.
