title: Communications Specialist
desc:
:
Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker – always asking, “What if?”

If so, then you may be the new team member we’re looking for. Because at SAS, your curiosity matters – whether you’re developing algorithms, creating customer experiences or answering critical questions. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless.

What we do
We’re the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live.

What you’ll do
As a Communications Specialist, you will collaborate with SAS leadership and internal and external stakeholders to amplify executive voices, corporate messaging and thought leadership. Through your creative writing and sound guidance, you will help executives effectively inform and connect with internal and external audiences and promote SAS’ brand awareness and reputation.
This role is for a communicator who has experience in crafting, vetting and customizing content to fit the audience and the executive’s voice and style. You’ll work both individually and collaboratively to develop and execute communications.

You will:
Create internal and external plans and messaging for SAS executives and work with them to deliver messages using the optimal style, format and channel.
Write, edit and collaborate on articles, scripts, talking points, blog posts, and other content as needed.
Develop and review corporate communications and executive messages related to diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives.
Design and execute internal communications strategies to align with corporate goals and initiatives.
Collaborate with various SAS teams to ensure that communication initiatives align with global messaging frameworks and timelines.
Consult on social media strategy and craft content in alignment with executive thought leadership platforms and corporate communication goals.
Manage content for company-wide communications, including divisional and internal town halls.
Monitor and report impact of communications through surveys and other performance measurements.
What we’re looking for
Experience with executive communications programs – both internal and external – including speech and script writing and communications coaching.
Experience creating communications for multi-media with a strong sensibility for visual presentation.
Excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to build strategic working relationships with executives and all levels of the organization.
Experience with change management and strategic communications plan development and execution.
Ability to work outside of normal business hours periodically.
Familiarity with social media communications channels; ability to integrate these channels into plans & strategies to achieve stated goals.
Media relations experience, including pitching executives for external speaking engagements and preparing executives for media engagements.
Project management, event planning and meeting facilitation skills.
Demonstrated understanding of communication concepts/functions and software tools (Microsoft Office 365 SharePoint, Teams, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Adobe Creative Suite, Wordpress).
Creativity and the ability to multi-task to manage multiple projects at once.
You’re curious, passionate, authentic and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do.
Other knowledge, skills, and abilities
Bachelor's degree, preferably in journalism, marketing, public relations or related discipline.
5+ years of experience in corporate or marketing communications or related function in the technology or other business-to-business industry.
Superlative written, verbal, and visual communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate with a wide variety of audiences.
Experience with modern communications strategy, practices and channels with attention to the needs of the intended audience(s).
Why SAS
We love living the #SASlife and believe that happy, healthy people have a passion for life, and bring that energy to work. No matter what your specialty or where you are in the world, your unique contributions will make a difference.
Our multi-dimensional culture blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Here, it isn’t about fitting into our culture, it’s about adding to it - and we can’t wait to see what you’ll bring.

Additional Information:
SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Read more: Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law. Also view the supplement EEO is the Law, and the Pay Transparency notice.

Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience. Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process.

In order to work at SAS, you must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If there is a medical or religious reason preventing you from receiving an available COVID-19 vaccination, and you are selected as a candidate for consideration, we have an accommodations process in place to evaluate those requests.

All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at www.sas.com. SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at Recruitingsupport@sas.com before taking any further action.

title: Business Development Program Manager - Remote (Anywhere US)
desc:
Business Development Program Manager
Overview of Position
The Business Development Program Manager reports directly to the Global Vice President of Business Development and Strategy and requires experience and demonstratable success in developing and managing complex cross functional programs. The right candidate excels at building programs from scratch and creating sound operating structure and processes.
What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job?
Responsible for overall executive dashboard-level scheduling, tracking, and reporting on programs driven by the business development team.
Responsible for developing formal structure and programs related to partnerships
Responsible for developing formal structure and programs related to innovation and growth initiatives
Responsible for developing formal structure to track milestones and status of contracts in negotiation.
What are the requirements needed for this position?
5+ years of experience defining and managing complex programs or projects.
3+ years of experience managing programs in a technical environment
What critical skills are needed for you to consider someone for this position?
Proven experience leading the creation of complex programs such as partner programs.
Excels at discovery, collaboration and consensus building with internal stakeholders on technical and business topics
Proven ability to organize initiatives from scratch and negotiate stakeholder buy-in
Maintains best practices for defining and tracking programs, and creating executive dashboards
Working knowledge of technical and financial concepts.
Strong interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills within a multicultural environment.
Advanced problem solving and critical reasoning skills
Strong internal negotiating skills
Ability to make timely decisions
Ability to manage multiple projects that might be geographically widespread
Adept at Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?
Bachelors Degree or the equivalent combination of education, technical training, and/or work experience.
Strong personal energy and ability to energize others
What are the working conditions and physical requirements of this job?
General office demands/Home office
How much should I expect to travel?
Up to 20% travel requirement
Employees in roles that require travel will need to be able to qualify for a company credit card or be able to use their own personal credit card for travel expenses and submit for reimbursement.

desc:

Works with the Manager Training - EPIC and application coordinators to develop training programs for the EPIC application. Creates, designs, develops, implements, and manages training programs for the functional use of EPIC EMR software systems. Assists with developing and delivering training programs to staff and physicians.

Bachelor's degree with three years' experience in an IT Technical or professional training role; or, an equivalent combination of education and experience. Adult education experience required.
LICENSURE, CERTIFICATION, and/or REGISTRATION:
Prior Epic certification preferred. Achievement of Epic certification on assigned application(s) will be required upon hire.

1. Masters the Epic application assigned and associated organization, specific workflows.
2. Develops and implements training programs for respective application(s).
3. Builds, tests, and maintains the training environment.

7. Coordinates training for software releases and updates.

Excellent oral and written communication skills Excellent interpersonal, organizational, customer service skills Proficient in Microsoft Office, particularly Word and Excel.

title: Sr Marketing Specialist II
desc:
Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges
The future is what you make it.
When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Our mission is to attract, retain and develop diverse and highly motivated, entrepreneurial employees striving to flawlessly deliver superior value to our customers every day.
If you are a self-led, energetic marketing professional, Honeywell currently has an exciting opportunity for you to develop and execute marketing campaigns as a Senior Marketing Specialist II. You will be a part of the Smart Energy global business which supports the growing demand for energy efficiency solutions. The Honeywell marketing team provides full-service marketing for our utility clients to deliver integrated, multichannel outreach campaigns. Our marketing team has designed and deployed hundreds of successful utility marketing campaigns and engaged millions of utility customers to learn about energy usage and participate in utility-sponsored programs. Our innovative approaches enable us to drive measurable, cost-effective results and deliver high customer satisfaction.
We are looking for someone in this client-facing role with a broad range of experience to manage marketing, from strategy to execution, for our utility clients. This person will build yearly marketing plans, manage budgets, and execute on those plans in a collaborative and fast-paced environment. Be part of a team that is responsible for the coordination and completion of a variety of marketing projects. You will oversee all aspects of projects, set deadlines, assigns responsibilities, and monitor and summarize progress of project. You will utilize a high degree of creativity and latitude in this role. You will prepare reports for upper management regarding status of project and will lead and direct the work of others. Position can be located at offices in Raleigh, NC or Charlotte, NC or Baltimore Maryland. Hybrid work schedule.
Key Responsibilities
Managing integrated marketing campaigns, from concept to launch, including strategic
development, creative briefs, creative development, and securing approvals; experience with email,
digital, and direct mail.
Analyzing campaign and customer data, as well as analytics to identify best prospects, marketing
strategies, and tactics to inform future marketing plans.
Developing and presenting marketing campaign results to the client during monthly, quarterly
and annual reviews.
Ability to work independently, proactively, and with ambiguity leading multiple projects and
prioritizing marketing efforts while ensuring processes are followed and projects are completed on
time and within budget.
Managing multiple external vendors and holding them accountable for quality delivery
(creative agencies, digital, website designers, printers, etc.).
Approaching business challenges from a strategic perspective that includes thinking outside
the box, problem-solving skills, resourcefulness and attention-to-detail.
Effectively partnering and collaborating with internal teams to meet goals and client objectives in
a matrix environment.
Providing thought leadership and knowledge sharing to both internal teams and clients.
Ability to provide direction and oversight on work deliverables, coaching and mentoring to junior
level team members.
Building and maintaining strong client relationships.
High level for attention to detail and be able to identify process improvements.
YOU MUST HAVE
Bachelor's degree
Minimum 3 years of experience in marketing
3+ years using MS Office including Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook
WE VALUE
Marketing or Communications degree
Excellent communication skills - writing and presentation skills
Demonstrated financial acumen and ability to successfully manage budgets
Experience in project management and executing marketing campaigns such as direct mail,
email and online advertising
3+ years of project management in a fast-paced environment
Advertising agency or client-facing experience
Energy marketing experience
Experience working in B2C and B2B channels
Google Analytics experience
Experience deploying campaigns through a marketing automation platform like Constant Contact,
Eloqua, Adobe Campaign, Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Market to corporate and agency leadership experience a plus
Familiar with the field's practices and procedures
Excellent organizational and project planning skills
Ability to operate collaboratively
Strong project management skills
Additional Information
JOB ID: HRD163367
Category: Marketing
Location: 208 South Rogers Lane,Raleigh,North Carolina,27610,United States
Exempt
Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status.
Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

title: Office of Sponsored Programs Manager - Contracts
desc:
Our work is more than a job – it’s a calling – where humanity is at the center of everything we do.

You see, we are an organization made up OF ALL and dedicated FOR ALL…where our people – teammates, patients and community members alike – come first. And because of this:
We create a space where all Belong
We Work as One Team to make great things happen
We earn Trust in all we do
We Innovate to better the now and create the future
We drive for Excellence – always
What propels us forward is not just to be a national leader…but to champion compassion, embody empathy and harness hope.

The Wake Forest School of Medicine and Atrium Health enterprise is a top 50 national academic medical center and world class health system with an extramurally funded research portfolio of over $300M annually. We bring together high quality health care with innovative research as an academic learning health system with the goal of improving the health of our patients and communities we serve.
The department of Research Administration is a unified research entity comprised of over 300 teammates structured to provide outstanding research administration support in all research domains (e.g. basic, clinical, population) across the enterprise. The Research Administration department supports investigators and research teams through the provision of creative tools and services while maintaining the highest standards of customer service and promoting a safe, compliant and ethical research environment.
JOB SUMMARY:
The Contracts Manager within the Office of Sponsored Programs is a leadership and working position under the direction of the Director of Contracts, the position oversees and performs the receipt, review, negotiation and execution of sponsored contracts across all regions of the Atrium Enterprise. The position will have an active portfolio of contracts activity that they are responsible for maintaining and will be expected to perform all contract-related activities assigned, including those not mentioned specifically in this job description.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Provides general oversight and management of the contracts administration team.
Works closely with the Director of Contracts and other contracts manager to facilitate operational activities.
Serves as lead liaison with General Counsel and external partners to manage the terms and conditions appropriate for contracts.
Implements personnel actions (e.g., hiring, training, promotion, termination, and organizational changes) for the OSP Contracts Team, following appropriate location-based policies and procedures.
Oversees and performs the following contract activities for the Enterprise:
The processing of initial routing information for all CDAs, CTAs, and MSAs; ensuring they are appropriately logged into the Huron Contracts Module;
The analysis and red-lining of initial sponsor-provided documents;
The integration of standard institutional language and/or the application of Master Service Agreement language within contracts;
Negotiating the CDAs and MTAs with industry sponsors;
Finalizing MSAs with appropriate stakeholders;
The management of the contract execution process;
The completion of the contracting process within pre-defined timelines.
Ensures that all contract negotiation and execution responsibilities and workflows across the Enterprise are performed in conjunction with institutional and federal policies and guidelines.
Assesses, implements, and continuously monitors workflow and volumes to ensure workload is balanced among team members.
Monitors key performance indicators (KPIs) to include, but not limited to, contract volumes, contract receipt, negotiation and execution timelines.
Develops, implements, and monitors a comprehensive training program to include career ladder development. Addresses team training needs based on team member performance and quality reviews.
In conjunction with the Director of Contracts, OSP and the Office of the General Counsel, ensures that institutional policies and procedures are followed to ensure compliance with federal, state and local regulatory guidelines related to clinical research contracts.
Evaluates ongoing activities and services using customer feedback, system reports and metrics. Reports performance results to the Director of Contracts, OSP.
Ensures compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws and specific regulations by monitoring such requirements on an ongoing basis.
Stays informed of developments in the field of research contracting and other related topics.
Participates in internal and external meetings and committees, as assigned. Represents leadership in various meeting forums, as assigned.
Manages special projects and other initiatives, as assigned.
Performs other related duties incidental to work described herein.
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's degree in a related field with 2-4 years of relevant experience in clinical research as a financial analyst or similar position. In some circumstances may consider equivalent years of direct research administration experience in a central office or certifications relevant to the profession in lieu of a bachelor's degree.
0-3 years of experience supervising or managing direct reports and completing performance management activities is required.
Knowledge of research administration practices is required.
SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS:
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills and attention to detail.
Experience with computerized databases (e.g., Microsoft Excel), word processing (e.g., Microsoft Word), and presentation software (e.g., Microsoft PowerPoint).
Personnel management experience.
Ability to work independently and to accept responsibility for complex and sensitive decision-making as it relates to the position.
Strong organizational skills to manage many competing priorities and responsibilities.
Ability to travel to Enterprise locations

title: Corporate Training & Development Manager
desc:
Training and Development Manager
Send your resume to mohita.kaur@aeroflowinc.com OR visit us at https://aeroflowinc.com/employment-opportunities/#current-openings
WHO ARE WE?
Aeroflow Healthcare is taking the home health products and equipment industry by storm. We’ve created a better way of doing business that prioritizes our customers, our community, and our coworkers.

ARE YOU READY TO TAKE YOUR CAREER TO THE NEXT LEVEL?
We believe in career building. We promote from within and reward individuals who have invested their time and talent in Aeroflow. If you’re looking for a stable, ethical company in which to advance you won’t find an organization better equipped to help you meet your professional goals than Aeroflow Healthcare.

JOB DESCRIPTION
The Corporate Training and Development Manager will be working with company leadership to identify critical training and development gaps and to create and implement training programs to address these needs. The Corporate Training and Development Manager will have overall responsibility for various initiatives focused on developing Aeroflow’s internal talent and fostering a company culture that emphasizes professional development, career advancement, and individual excellence. This role will begin as an individual contributor but responsibility will grow as company and training needs grow. This is a unique opportunity to build out an entire corporate training function rapidly growing organization and could include management of training specialists, corporate trainers, or instructional designers as company and training team continues to grow. Areas of training focus will include:
Leadership Development – oversee Aeroflow’s Fast Track Leadership Development Program in partnership with HR Director and Executive Team. Bring best practices and continuous improvement to program with each successive cohort.
Facilitate and coordinate Aeroflow Management Academy; ongoing manager training sessions for company supervisors.
Career Development – facilitate ongoing career pathing and leadership development conversations and trainings with high potential employees.
Onboarding and Orientation – create an engaging and impactful onboarding and orientation program.
Core Competencies and Fundamental Skills Training – work with department managers across the organization to develop training programs that address the unique needs of each team.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Evaluate current training programs for effectiveness and identify training gaps
Develop metrics to measure the effectiveness of training programs and learner performance in the workplace
Integrate results and feedback from trainings into new and existing course curriculum
Track data, report on metrics, and provide feedback and recommendations to leadership team
Conduct needs analysis on a regular basis to identify skill gaps and prioritize training programs to mitigate these gaps.
Develop communication plans to drive awareness and participation of programs and offerings
Work with third parties as necessary to deliver training needs that cannot be delivered in-house.
Performs other duties as assigned by management
Maintain HIPAA/patient confidentiality.
Employee has an individual responsibility for knowledge of and compliance with laws, regulations, and policies.
Compliance is a condition of employment and is considered an element of job performance
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years’ experience creating and managing training programs in a corporate setting, including involvement with developing company-wide training strategy.
Experience with training needs assessment and analysis in a complex corporate environment
Ability to effectively prioritize and manage projects and priorities across multiple departments and stakeholders.
Exceptional project management ability.
In-depth knowledge of best practices for developing a variety of corporate training programs and understanding of adult learning concepts.
Experience with instructional design, managing instructional design projects, and/or Learning Management Systems strongly preferred.
Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills
Superior interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with and get buy-in from employees at all levels of the organization including C-level executives
Ability to think critically, analyze and solve problems, and successfully implement solutions
Must be flexible and demonstrate the ability to change course quickly as priorities and company needs evolve.
Proven ability to complete full training cycle (needs assessment, planning, development, coordination, implementation, facilitation, and evaluation)
Experience with G-Suite and Microsoft applications
Bachelor's Degree Required
POSITION PERKS AND BENEFITS
At Aeroflow, we know it’s not all about what you can do for us. We believe that our people are the best investment we can make and we want to reward you through a wide range of benefits that recognize the important role you play in our organization and in driving our mission. We offer the following benefits to our employees:
Competitive Pay
Living Wage Certified
401(k) with Safe Harbor Company Match (up to 4%)
Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
Optional Life Insurance
Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
6 Weeks Paid Maternity Leave / 2 Weeks Paid Paternity Leave
Additional Maternity & Paternity Benefits (including free diapers for a year, free breast pump, and reimbursement for doula services)
Adoption Assistance
PTO Accrual Starts Day One
8 Paid Holidays
Corporate Volunteering and Community Service Opportunities
Employee Referral Bonus Program
Corporate Leadership Training and Professional Development Opportunities
Healthy Lifestyle Programs and Corporate Fitness Center
Financial Wellness Program
Discounted Gold’s Gym Membership
Great Place to Work Award Winner
Here at Aeroflow, we are proud of our commitment to all of our employees. Aeroflow Healthcare has been recognized both locally and nationally for the following achievements:
Great Place To Work Certified
Living Wage Certified
Inc. 5000 Best Place to Work award winner
HME Excellence Award
Sky High Growth Award

If you’ve been looking for an opportunity that will allow you to make an impact, and an organization with unlimited growth potential, we want to hear from you!
Aeroflow Healthcare is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

title:
new
Client Account Management, Manager
desc:
We're looking for an autonomous self-starter with outstanding organizational and program management skills-a strategic thinker who's also a natural collaborator. As a Client Account Manager (CAM) you'll work with senior leaders, enabling account teams to deliver the best of Deloitte, strengthen relationships with our most important clients, and accelerate growth for the Firm. With a client-first mindset, you will align with Deloitte's businesses to execute business priorities and expand our services footprint, help develop and deliver Green Dot account strategies to address client issues, bring insights and leading practices to accounts, and drive operational efficiencies to keep client service PPMDs and professionals client-facing and help account teams win work.

How You'll Operate

You will serve as "chief operating officer", flexing the role you play as you deliver against account priorities, serving as:
Catalyst to spur the realization of our client's vision and goals, accelerating growth objectives;
Strategist to engage with account and firm leadership to determine strategies vital to maximizing successful client performance;
Steward to protect and build our brand with our client while seeking opportunities to reduce risks for our clients and the firm; and,
Operator to effectively and efficiently manage across the account operating model to optimize performance and client results.

Work You'll Do

Responsibilities will be based on specific client relationship objectives and the priorities of the account leadership team. You will deliver across the "Account Excellence Model", a holistic framework for managing world-class accounts, which includes:
Client: Client Relationship Strategy and Implementations; Client Accelerators and Executive Programs/Experiences; Marketing and Eminence; Pursuit Management
Strategic: Account Strategy and Planning (strategy, operating model, and strategic initiatives)
Leadership: Leader Development (connectivity, successions, transitions, etc.)
Quality and Risk: Confidential Information Program, Firm Compliance/Independence, and Legal/Contracting
People: Talent and Teambuilding/Team Management
Financial: Financial Management and Reporting

The Team

At Deloitte, clients are at the heart of everything we do. As a part of Client and Market Growth, the CAM program is comprised of professionals who are dedicated to providing our most important client accounts with streamlined, cross-functional support. CAMs, like other Deloitte practitioners, are aligned to an industry (e.g., Energy, Resources & Industrials, Financial Services; Consumer; Life Sciences & Health Care; Government & Public Services; or Technology, Media & Telecom). CAMs help build and execute client service strategies, optimize internal support, and increase efficiencies to enable our account teams to provide the best Deloitte client experience.

Qualifications

Required:
Bachelor's degree
Minimum 5 years of work experience
Strong organizational and project management skills
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to a changing environment
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with executives
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite - strong PowerPoint and Excel skills critical
Excellent strategic, analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience mentoring/counseling others
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Preferred
Client service experience
Account management experience

For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in Colorado, Deloitte is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to the State of Colorado and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and delivery model. We would not anticipate that the individual hired into this role would land at or near the top end of the range, but such a decision will be dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the range is $86,425-$159,165.

You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: Demand Planning & S&OP/IBP
desc:
Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization
The future is what you make it.
When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.
Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.
Are you ready to help us make the future?
At Honeywell, we look for people driven by a desire to contribute, be challenged and grow. Our people make Honeywell a special company and are a key competitive advantage.
Honeywell International is a $37 billion diversified technology and manufacturing global leader. Honeywell has more than 113,000 employees in 120 countries around the world and has a demonstrated heritage of innovation and achievement.

Demand Planning & S&OP/IBP
A position has been created in the Corporate ISC Planning Centre of Excellence team (PCOE) for an ambitious Supply Chain Professional. You will report to the Corporate VP of ISC Planning & Inventory with the opportunity to develop and demonstrate your leadership skills and play an instrumental role in the success of the company.
The successful candidate will support the implementation and continuous improvement of an effective and sustainable Sales Inventory Operations Planning (SIOP, S&OP, IBP) processes across Honeywell businesses integrating demand planning, supply planning, production planning, inventory planning, and life cycle management into a common plan. The role will focus on Sales, Inventory and Operational Planning (SIOP) with particular emphasis on consensus demand planning and long-term demand planning. Supports the facilitation of the demand planning meetings, the supply planning process, the financial reconciliation and the final SIOP plan review. The role will be dedicated to implementing Corp policies and procedures within the Business Units (BU’s) and driving the adoption of RapidResponse for SIOP and Demand Planning.
Must be capable of translating objectives into a deliverable strategy to achieve business goals and create a competitive advantage of the product portfolio. Focusing on building a world-class team, utilizing and deploying lean techniques, driving continuous improvement activities and achievement of superior performance across all KPIs (Key Performance Initiatives).
Responsibilities:
Define and implement world class consensus demand planning and SIOP/S&OP/IBP management system and methodologies across global Honeywell businesses
Implement Planning System of Record (Kinaxis Rapid Response) owning the Demand/Consensus Planning and SIOP process orchestration across $36B Annual Revenue, 35 GBE, and 250 sites.
Serve as SIOP & Consensus Planning Subject Matter Expert, co-developing Supply Chain Academy content and leading regular process audits, educational boot camps, and online Module
Continuously develop and improve SIOP processes, increasing automated and integrated solutions tailored to specific lines of business.
Drive standard org and process rigor and constructive tension and accountability, standardized as much as possible via R&R and Org alignment, customized where necessary
Improve product transition management with intelligent lifecycle data, process, and analytics including advanced leading indicators like sales funnel, spec analysis, and market intelligence.
Create a global Executive SIOP process for CEO and Executive Leadership team (does not exist outside of the current Business Group today)
Develop culture of Speed of Trust and constructive tension to resolve business misalignments

YOU MUST HAVE:
Bachelor's Degree
2+ Years of Consensus Sales Inventory, Operations Planning, SIOP
2+ Years New Product Introduction management experience
2+ Years Product Management experience in industrial, technology vertical
WE VALUE:
History of success standardizing & integrating SIOP across multi-business environments
Advanced Degree (MBA or MS)
Demonstrable deep knowledge of Portfolio Management, Demand Planning, product transitions, SIOP reconciliations, & executive alignment
Industry relevant project management certifications (i.e. LEAN, PMP, APICS, Six Sigma)
Strong matrix, global organization management demonstrating relationship management skills with excellent written & verbal communication and ability to influence cross-functionally
Experience implementing an Integrated Planning System of Record like Rapid Response, o9, IBP
Travel up to 50%
Additional Information
JOB ID: HRD149802
Category: Integrated Supply Chain
Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States
Exempt
Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

desc:
Durham County Government employs approximately 1,900 employees that work towards providing needed services throughout the community. With a wide array of services, Durham County Government is at the heart of a rapidly growing and diverse area offering residents, employees and visitors exciting opportunities to live, work, grow and play.

DEPARTMENT:
Social Services (DSS)

DATE POSTED:
May 2, 2022

CLOSING DATE:

May 14, 2022

SALARY MIN:
$58,541

SALARY MAX:

$105,374

HIRING RANGE:
$58,541 - $81,958

POSITION NUMBER:

40008753

JOB TYPE:

Full-Time

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Supervises a team of Child Welfare Social Workers. This position is responsible for receiving and investigating reports of suspected child abuse or neglect. Duties include coordinating, implementing, and managing, and supporting all activities that are performed by five social workers assigned to an assessment/investigative unit, whom work 8:30 am -5:00 pm. The staff work hours for this position are the after-hours on call social work staff who work when the agency is closed during normal business hours, weekends, and holidays. The supervisor is responsible for ensuring that the front line social workers carry our their functions of protecting children, complying with court orders, North Carolina Child Welfare Statues and laws, Federal Child Welfare Statues and Laws as well as meet the expectations of the county and agency. Due to the nature of child protective services, the employee is required to be knowledgeable about all tasks and expectations within child welfare services and may be expected to peform tasks/responsibilites in other areas of child welfare.

KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of NC Laws, and policies under which program operates.
Knowledge and experience with the judicial system.
Ability to teach, plan, organize, and schedule management functions.
Comprehensive knowledge of principles, methods, and techniques of social work administration, including a broad knowledge of child welfare services.
Effective oral and written communication skills.

REQUIREMENTS:

The position requirements are a Master's degree in social work from an appropriately accredited institution and two years of directly related experience;or a bachelor's degree in social work from an appropirately accredited institution and three years of directly related experience; or a Master's degree in a human services field from an appropriately accredited institution and three years of directly related experience; or a bachelor's degree and four years of directly related experience;or a bachelor's degree from an appropriately accredited institution and five years of directly related experience;or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

PREFFERED REQUIREMENTS:

Experience in Child Welfare Protective Services.

Durham County Government is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Clinical Lab Spec II-Thursday-Sunday 9pm-7:30am
desc:
Under direct supervision, this position is responsible for performing routine testing of biological specimens. Works with other team members to ensure timely and quality test results.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Performs all assigned duties in compliance with internal SOPs and external regulations. Brings compliance issues to the attention of management.
Assures quality customer service to all customers.
Maintains good attendance and punctuality per the absence policy.
Maintains accurate records and documentation. Ensures maintenance of donor, patient and employee confidentiality.
Prepares and labels reagents.
Performs routine testing of biological samples and notifies appropriate personnel of any identified problems. Operates equipment and monitors for errors and responds appropriately.
Performs record review.
Performs routine maintenance on equipment, identifies equipment malfunctions, and notifies appropriate personnel if additional action is needed.
Assists with monitoring supply and reagent levels, notifies appropriate personnel when new supplies are needed.
Receives and manages incoming supplies and reagents.
Maintains the cleanliness of equipment and work areas. Adheres to safety guidelines.
Assists process improvement teams, as required.
Performs all other duties, at the discretion of management, as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS:
Knowledge/Education
Bachelor of Science degree required.
CLIA requirements for High Complexity Testing required.
California testing requirements where required by law or SOP.
Licenses/ Certifications
Appropriate state licensure and/or certificate, where applicable, required.
Experience
None.
Skills/Abilities
Must possess the skills and abilities to successfully perform all assigned duties and responsibilities.
Must be able to maintain confidentiality.
Must have proficient computer skills.
Ability to work in a team environment and participate as an active team member.
Must be able to understand, follow, and give precise written and verbal instructions, and perform all activities safely.
Must be able to read and comprehend written procedures and instructions.

title: International Field Service Representative
desc:
International Field Service Representative(Job Number: HAC00011Z)
Honda Aircraft Company, LLC

Description

General Summary:
The Field Service Representative provides technical support to HondaJet dealers and customers and supports issue resolution. The Field Service Representative is the liaison between customers, dealers, and Honda Aircraft Company.

Duties and Responsibilities:
1. Conducts planned and unplanned post-delivery customer visits, communications, and facilitates resolution of technical and customer satisfaction issues.
2. Reports customer, dealer, and aircraft issues requiring Honda Aircraft Company management visibility and/or action.
3. Provides dealer and customer on-site support, answers technical support questions, resolves customer satisfaction issues, resolves warranty questions, and any other issues that may arise.
4. Submits Field Condition Reports in accordance with Honda Aircraft Company field issue reporting requirements.
5. Works with Honda Aircraft Company Technical Support and Service Engineering to resolve uncommon technical difficulties and to initiate development of approved repair procedures and drawings.
6. Facilitates on-site technical training as required.
7. Assists in promoting and supporting Honda Aircraft Company interests at trade shows and special events as required.
8. Supports audits and compliance of dealer contractual obligations with respect to HondaJet Dealer Agreement and Operations Manual requirements.
9. Travels approximately 40% of the time both domestically and internationally (Please note: Travel may be required under short notice.)
10. Performs routine administrative duties related to timekeeping, office facility, office supplies, job reports, expenses, travel etc.

Education, Work Experience, Certification and/or Licensure:
Bachelors’ degree from a four year college or university in Business, Aviation Management, or a related technical field is required. *At the discretion of management, equivalent years of experience and education/training may be considered in lieu of a degree.
7+ years of experience in general aviation is required.
Previous directly related work experience in customer support and/or product support is required.
Previous experience working with an ERP System (i.e. - SAP) is preferred.
FAA A&P license or equivalent civil aviation authority certification is required.
Qualifications

Education, Work Experience, Certification and/or Licensure:
Bachelors’ degree from a four year college or university in Business, Aviation Management, or a related technical field is required. *At the discretion of management, equivalent years of experience and education/training may be considered in lieu of a degree.
7+ years of experience in general aviation is required.
Previous directly related work experience in customer support and/or product support is required.
Previous experience working with an ERP System (i.e. - SAP) is preferred.
FAA A&P license or equivalent civil aviation authority certification is required.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Working technical knowledge of aircraft systems and assemblies is required.
Working knowledge of turbine-powered aircraft systems and field support practices is required.
Working knowledge and understanding of FARs as they apply to aircraft operations, maintenance and design certification is preferred.
Ability to communicate effectively is required.
Ability to facilitate resolution to complex technical issues and customer concerns is required.

Physical Requirements:
Incumbents may be routinely exposed to equipment operational noise heat-cold-dust, and/or aircraft equipment, parts, or fuel odors.
Incumbents may be required to stand, sit, squat, walk, bend, climb ladders, move, reach, or stretch for prolonged time periods with no restrictions, as required by job duties.
Work in a safe and professional manner while adhering to all regulatory requirements (FAA, OSHA, DOT, EPA, State, and Federal regulations, etc.).
Read, hear, speak, and see with no restrictions, as required by job duties.
Comprehend and adhere to management directions and/or safety instructions with no restrictions.
Effectively communicate in Business English language.
Pull, push, carry, lift, or move items up to 10 lbs. throughout the work shift without assistance, as required by job duties.
Pull, push, carry, lift or move materials/people/items/equipment weighing up to 50lbs or more during the work shift, with the use of Company provided “reach assistance technology” or “movement assist technology” (fork-lifts, pallet jacks, pulleys, dolly’s, robotics reach equipment, people movers etc.), as required by job duties.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and scope of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, and responsibilities required of personnel so classified. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. This document does not constitute a contract between the incumbent and Honda Aircraft Company. (FLSA: ) 01/07/13

title: Consumer Strategist
desc:
At Mercury Healthcare, we empower healthcare organizations to create seamless consumer experiences and improve outcomes to build healthier communities. As a Consumer Strategist, you will showcase your impressive analytical skills and strategic planning chops. You will leverage MH's market-leading insights and digital capabilities to create and implement consumer-centric, integrated marketing programs to meet the goals of our hospital and hospital system clients.
What you will do:
Work with clients directly to understand their marketing needs and identify relevant data insights
Create innovative integrated marketing strategies to fulfill client needs, leveraging insights and capabilities
Engage internal resources and partners for project/campaign planning expertise
Draft proposals laying out integrated strategies and expected outcomes for client review
Report results and explain implications of executed strategies to client
Analyze strategy results and make recommendations for optimization
What you will bring:
Bachelor's degree and 3+ years of experience in marketing planning and campaign/program execution
Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Good understanding of healthcare and healthcare marketing is a plus
Knowledge of CRM and marketing automation platforms and their use in marketing. (Oracle Eloqua, Act-On and Salesforce Marketing Cloud)
Experience with Google AdWords, Facebook Analytics or Google Analytics a plus
Ability to analyze performance data and develop recommendations for marketing programs across multiple channels with a focus on Digital (paid search, display, paid social and SEM)
Ability to develop and present a compelling story to stakeholders that articulates the business problem, outlines corresponding solutions, and frames the outcomes
Experience with development, management, and evolution of consumer insights and journey mapping
Comfortable with 25% overnight travel
Benefits:
5% Bonus
401(k) plan with employer match
Medical, dental, and vision insurance, with HSA contributions for qualifying plans
Company-funded basic Life, AD&D, and disability coverage
Family planning resources
Subsidized wellness benefits
PTO plus paid holiday and volunteer time
Tuition reimbursement and learning & development programs
Who we are:
Mercury Healthcare is a technology and data analytics company that empowers healthcare organizations to engage consumers and optimize provider networks to accelerate growth. Our customers benefit from more than 30 years' experience driving intelligent engagement, aligning physicians, and enabling personalized healthcare journeys. Learn more at mercuryhealthcare.com.

title: System Administrator - SOF MISO
desc:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:Perform as part of a team responsible for IT Services to a group of elite forces. These services include system hardware and operating systems operations, software and systems installation, and documenting all aspects of IT services. Adhere to established policies, procedures and guidelines set out by the government. Be able to support the infrastructure and systems used by Special Operations Forces to produce audio and video, print and broadcast assets. Be willing to support provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware, software and related infrastructure within a DoD approved enclave. The employee will participate in technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the infrastructure.

More specific job duties may include but aren't limited to the following:

Install new/rebuild existing servers and configure hardware, peripherals, services, settings, directories, storage, etc. in accordance with standards and project/operational requirements
Monitor, backup and archive log files from enterprise level platforms
Install new/rebuild existing servers and configure hardware, peripherals, services, settings, directories, storage, etc. in accordance with standards and project/operational requirements
Monitor, backup and archive log files from enterprise level platforms
Able to develop and document step-by-step procedures that is easily understood by other System and Network Administrators
Have a working knowledge of the Microsoft Windows Operating Systems
Understand the functions of servers
Have a basic understanding of the commands used to analyze and troubleshoot computer issues.
Able to create, maintain and support Windows Computing Environment
A basic understanding on how to read a vulnerability scan reports and apply the recommended corrective actions
Able to maintain and correct established security policies
Perform research on system technology and provide resolution to complex issues for processes
Monitor all system alerts and assist in resolving complex issues with system hardware and software
Develop and maintain installation and configuration procedures
Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups
Perform daily backup operations, ensuring all required file systems and system data are successfully backed up to the appropriate media, recovery tapes or disks are created, and media is recycled and sent off site as necessary
Repair and recover from hardware or software failures. Coordinate and communicate with impacted users
Review and apply OS patches and upgrades on a regular basis, and upgrade administrative tools and utilities. Configure / add new services as necessary.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 2 years of professional experience. Considered experienced, but still a learner.

A working knowledge of workstations and servers within a DOD Network Environment. This includes a basic understanding of DISA STIGS, HBSS, ACAS and other required DOD security parameters.

Must have the temperament and interpersonal skills suitable to be embedded into a military organization. Ability to take general direction and follow through to task completion including solution development, planning, execution and status reporting. Work effectively as part of a team.
Desired Skills:
Working knowledge of Windows Server (2012/2020) /desktop Operating Systems (Win 10)
Managing deployments/rollouts
A basic understanding of Group Policy design and configuration
Microsoft IIS administration and configuration
Linux/UNIX administration
Able to work in Active Directory/LDAP user and group administration with supervision
Strong communication and documentation skills
Flexible and able to adapt to a rapidly changing environment
Must be organized and have the ability to understand and support IT Tickets
Positive, self-motivated. Team Player
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
job.Qualifications

Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.

Experienced Professional

title: Service Delivery IAM Program Manager
desc:
Overview:
Come join a growing bank with a world-class Information Security organization! As the Identity & Access Management Program Manager (IAMPM), you will be a member of the Identity and Access Management team. The IAMPM is responsible for driving the IAM program's maturity and continuous improvement. The IAMPM is required to communicate with both internal departments and third-party vendors as needed. Additionally, the IAMPM is responsible for prioritizing IAM-related projects collaboratively with corporate & IAM leadership.
Responsibilities:
Work closely with business units, technology teams, and IAM teams to ensure business requirements are met while following IAM best practices.
Evaluate the firm's current IAM posture and spearhead enhancements to policies, processes, and tools.
Document the IAM strategy and capture key milestones as improvements are implemented.
Champion the IAM program, ensuring that business partners understand the importance of sound IAM practices to support their business initiatives.
Responsible for monitoring and tracking the progress of all IAM-related projects.
Function as the liaison between other departments and third-party vendors with respect to IAM projects and processes.
Research changes and developments within the industry.
Provide high level decisions with respect to projects and other work-related items.
Expertise in information security and identity management best practices.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to make presentations to audiences including senior management.
Excellent organizational and project management skills.
Ability to analyze existing capabilities and emerging trends and recommend improvements.
Ability to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Build and maintain collaborative relationships with both internal and external clients.
Responsible for providing updates, status reports and tracking metrics for IAM, PMO, BISO and GRC.

Bachelor's Degree and 8 years of Project management or Program management experience.
OR
High School Diploma or GED and 12 years of Project management or Program management experience.

Additional Requirements:
Communication skills – interpersonal.
Business acumen / knowledge.
Management skills.
Organization skills.
Decision making.

Identity & Access Management, Information Security, Cybersecurity experience.
PMP and/ or PgMP certification.
CISM certification.

title: Leave Of Absence Coordinator
desc:
Address: USA-NC-Salisbury-2085 Harrison Road
Store Code: Benefits (2761844)

Retail Business Services is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, providing services to five East Coast grocery brands: Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop & Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the size and scale of the local brands to and provides industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued. For more information, visit https:// www.retailbusinessservices.com .

Position Summary:
Coordinates and administers activities and duties related to associate leaves to ensure compliance with multiple variations of company policies and federal and state leave regulations. Provides instruction, guidance, and customer support to associates, managers and human resources on all matters related to leave of absence. Performs activities related to the coordination of all leaves of absence including FMLA (Family Medical Leave Act) and non-FMLA, Military, company medical leave and Paid Parental Leave. Assist associates in returning to work from non-occupational injuries or illness including supporting HR with coordination of ADA accommodations. Coordinates with vendors to assist employees who are out of work on STD (Short Term Disability), LTD (Long Term Disability), and Workers’ Compensation. Coordinate with payroll to ensure timely accurate payments for associates on salary continuation or paid parental leave of absence.

Principle Duties & Responsibilities:
Manage case load which includes communication with associates regarding their needs for leave and/or modified work schedules. Ensures that associates are aware of their responsibilities and of any documentation and notice required to qualify for and to take leave.
Effectively coordinate the FMLA leave administration process from the employee’s initial notice of the need for leave to the return to work. This includes gathering and completing all required paperwork, determining leave eligibility, designating leave as FMLA-qualifying, requesting medical certification as needed, and accounting for intermittent and reduced schedule leave use.
Independently review clinical documentation in support of approving or denying medical related leave cases. Clinical documentation can range from simple doctor notes to physician summaries and diagnostic test results.
Maintains reasonable communication with employees on leave to facilitate smooth and timely return to work, relays communication between employees and their managers during leave within reason.
recertify extension requests for leaves in accordance with Company policy within required timeframes.
Provide associates managers and HR Business Partners with direction related to federal, state and company leaves of absence policies, ADA, disability benefits and workers’ compensation.
Coordinates accommodation requests and return’s associates to work in a timely and efficient manner.
Provide associates support in understanding of their benefits continuation rights as defined by company policy.
Facilitate the integration of various disability management programs and ensure all benefits are provided in a timely and accurate manner.
Coordinates with associates ensuring awareness of other benefit programs such as Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, Workers’ Compensation, health benefits, paid time off programs and other internal and external benefits.
Supports HR/AR business partners with standard accommodation requests under ADA including the return-to-work process for associates with non-occupational injuries or illnesses who are unable to return to a suitable position due to their limitations. Coordinates applicable resources such as STD/LTD carrier vocational rehab with associate and HR/AR business partner.
Documents all correspondence including medical documentation, meetings and interactions with the associate, manager and other involved parties, initiates and tracks the progress of the case in the leave administration system and executes any follow-up.
Coordinates with managers and payroll department to pay associates on leave or in transitional work for non-occupational injury or illness.
Maintains knowledge of all applicable leave and accommodation laws including the FMLA, ADA, and state and local laws.
Preserves confidentiality of associate medical documentation and files.
Performs all other duties as assigned or required.

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’ degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
1 - 3 years' experience in HR/Benefits related position - leave of absence management, return to work programs, disability management, ADA case management or workers’ compensation.
Experience working with injuries/illness and physical limitations.
Experience reviewing medical documentation including physician notes and diagnostic results
Working knowledge of federal and state laws and regulations related to leave of absence management, including but not limited to FMLA, ADA disability benefits, workers’ compensation and return to work.

Preferred Qualifications:
Basic understanding of regulatory requirements and workplace safety principles.
Solid understanding of STD, LTD and other benefit plans.

Skills and Abilities:
Strong customer-focused service skills
Demonstrated ability to tolerate and cope with non-routine situations
Creative, self-directed and able to work well in a team environment
Strong problem-solving skills
Effective communication, telephonic and organization skills, including strong verbal and written communication skills
Computer skills including but not limited to Microsoft Office, HRIS Software and leave of absence management software

Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities.
If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@retailbusinessservices. com >

title: In Plant Safety Specialist
desc:
In-Plant Safety Specialist
Department: PSSI Safety Department
Job Status: Full Time
FLSA Status: Salary Exempt
Reports To: Site Manager
Work Schedule: Varies by location
Amount of Travel Required: 0-10%
Positions Supervised: None

PSSI VISION
To be the leading food safety solutions company that owns the standard of health and safety for our PSSI family and brand protection for our partners
Safety: We are committed to the health and safety of our team members and set the standard of food safety for the protection of our customers products and brands.
Integrity: We speak with candor, act with transparency, follow through on our commitments and abide by our principles and values.
Team: We respect and value our team members, embrace diversity, and invest in their development through coaching and training.
Customer Focus: We strive to exceed our internal and external customers expectations through open communication, relationships, and continuous improvement.
Achievement: We manage our business to provide opportunities and stability for our team members, and bring value to our customers, owners, and the communities we serve.

POSITION SUMMARY
The In-Plant Safety Specialist position is responsible for compliance with PSSIs safety procedures in the plant. This position must know, understand, and be able to communicate PSSIs safely policies and practices to teammembers, and train and re-train team members on proper safety practices.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/JOB DUTIES
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily, with or without reasonable accommodation:
Ensure PSSI operations comply with all PSSI company policies and procedures and customer requirements.
Implement and maintain safety policies and procedures.
Follow Site Management, Area Management, Division Managements, VP, and Technical Services directives regarding issues related to Safety, Health, and Environmental. Maintain regular communication with Safety and Technical Services team.
Report all accidents and first aids following established accident and first aid reporting SOP. This includes reporting caught-in type accidents following established protocol.
Establish annual goals and continually measure in the following categories:
Regularly scheduled and completed safety training.
Improvements in safety awareness and training consistency.
Improvements in safety performance metrics and knowledge of management and team members.
Overall implementation of action plans, follow-up, and resolution of safety issues.
Perform investigations at the plant level as needed. This includes but is not limited to severe injuries, OSHA complaints, and when necessary to assist other PSSI departments. Make sure all investigations are followed up with and an action plan is implemented successfully.
Perform weekly safety audits, assist operations with corrective actions, and report findings by email to appropriate PSSI management.
Ability to identify and eliminate hazards in the workplace.
Maintain regular communication with Site Manager.
Exercises independent judgement and issues disciplinary action for safety violations.
Authority to terminate team members based off PSSI disciplinary policy for safety violations.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Ability to wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors degree in safety related field or equivalent job experience.

WORK ENVIRONMENT
This position works in wet, hot, and/or cold environments. Shift may vary depending on location.

WHAT WE OFFER:
Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance
Basic Life Insurance
401k Retirement Plan
Paid Holidays
Paid Vacation
Employee Assistance Program
Training & Development Opportunities

Packers Sanitation Services, Inc. (PSSI) is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, creed, sex, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status, uniform service member status, veteran status, age, genetic information, disability, or any other protected status, in accordance with all applicable federal state, and local laws. PSSI is committed to complying with the laws protecting qualified individuals with disabilities. PSSI will provide a reasonable accommodation for any known physical or mental disability of a qualified individual with a disability to the extent required by law, provided the requested accommodation does not create an undue hardship for the Company and/or does not pose a direct threat to the health or safety of others in the workplace and/or to the individual. If an employee requires an accommodation, they must notify the site manager or the Corporate Human Resources Department. If an applicant requires an accommodation, they must notify the hiring manager and/or the Recruiter hiring for the position.

title: Senior Manager Infrastructure & Operations (REMOTE)
desc:

This position manages Information Technology (IT) strategies, processes, systems, and staff associated with technical operations. Responsible for the performance and functionality of the Bank's technical infrastructure, including networks, software, and hardware. Provides oversight and guidance to IT associate teams. Directs the strategic development of infrastructure to ensure Bank technology is cost-effective, secure, and effective in meeting organizational needs.

Business Strategy - Leads technology strategies and initiatives. Manages the priorities of technical operations and infrastructure activities with developing organizational needs. Develops strong relationships with business partners and service providers.
Operations Oversight - Manages associate teams supporting technical operations and infrastructure. Oversees, develops, and maintains systems, hardware, software, and other technical components crucial to daily operations. Implements methods of reporting and monitoring to track the performance, functionality, and cost-effectiveness of Bank systems. Provides guidance on the resolution of complex technical issues.
Managerial Functions - Establishes and monitors expectations to achieve company and department goals. Responsible for budget and resource allocation. Makes appropriate changes to IT policies, standards, procedures, and efficiencies in order to meet objectives. Manages the performance, training, and evaluation of assigned staff. Maximizes department achievements by providing professional development. Manages risk, audit and regulatory requirements.
Technical Expertise - Serves as a technical expert and strategic leader to senior management, associates, and business units. Maintains a strong knowledge of industry trends, technology, and vendor offerings. title: Enterprise Work Collaboration Specialist
desc:
Citrix builds the secure digital workspace technology that frees 400,000 customers to do their very best work from anywhere. By joining our award-winning workplace, you’ll be included in the globally diverse, collaborative team that values work-life balance. Come see why Fortune named us one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For®. Let’s innovate and grow together!
What we're looking for:
The Work Collaboration Specialist is part of the Sales team responsible for selling Citrix SaaS solutions to existing Commercial and Enterprise customers in the assigned territory. You will carry an individual, discrete quota.

You are a take-charge, proactive, Sales Representative. You love to develop end-user customer accounts and re-seller partnerships. You thrive in a consultative phone sales role. You’re able to easily establish rapport with customers/prospects with the end goal of being a trusted advisor. When asked “what drives you?” you reply, “the opportunity to be part of an organization whose culture drives everything we do, including changing the way people work”. Remote opportunities available.

Overview/Summary
Develop and apply an understanding of Citrix's Work Collaboration products, sales methodology, processes, prospecting techniques and customer base to sell to end users
Invest time and effort into learning and practicing prospecting techniques, while following up on inbound leads, qualifying, solution selling, negotiation and closing sales.
For existing customer base, call on and develop relationships with an emphasis on new product sales to our customer base. Account expansion and retention activities include cross selling into new areas, solution selling, negotiation and closing.
Begin to achieve sales targets and demonstrate progress towards achieving account strategies with field counterparts.
Learn to input accurate and timely forecasts as well as opportunity updates in SalesForce.com for management visibility in territory pipeline.
Set qualified appointments for the field counterparts with new and existing customers to address their IT challenges and business needs.
Begin to establish relationships with key channel partners, system integrators, and any other external partner to develop and achieve the defined account strategies and opportunity plans.
Begin to establish relationships with field sales, systems engineers, consultants, and sales specialists to maximize full potential of every opportunity.
Learn and begin to deliver product presentations to customers focusing on selling and positioning Citrix solutions.
Identify and develop opportunities across different product groups in order to leverage sales opportunities.
Role And Responsibilities
Proven ability to communicate effectively in presentations via telephone and computer with customers required.
Ability to identify new and existing opportunities through basic consultative selling methodology
Proven self-starter with motivated attitude to manage multiple tasks, projects and responsibilities
Strong organizational and time management skills
Developing knowledge of Citrix products and solutions
History of successful target attainment
Knowledge of CRM and opportunity management systems preferably SalesForce.com
Knowledge of two tier channel sales (VAR, distribution, and vendor)
Requirements
University/Bachelors degree or equivalent experience required
3-5 years of Software Sales experience (SaaS solutions preferred)
4+ years of successful B2B sales experience at a software company in Inside Sales or similar environment preferred
4+ years of experience identifying and working with C-level contacts preferred
Experience in a high tech, indirect sales and procurement environment with a demonstrated track record of success in driving customer adoption of technology is preferred
CCSP certification a plus
Functional Area:

ShareFile (Inside Sales)

What you’re looking for:
Everyone is welcome at Citrix. We prioritize diversity, equity, inclusion, and a culture of belonging, and celebrate bringing our courageous, authentic selves to work. We believe this way of working helps us innovate, and it’s just one of the reasons why our employees continuously recognize Citrix as a great place to work.
Citrix helps make work more sustainable to benefit the planet, our business, and our communities. For more than 30 years, we have empowered individuals and organizations to work remotely or work from anywhere, reducing commuting emissions and energy consumption in the process.
We are the #1 leader in Virtual Client Computing (VCC) and #2 in the Application Delivery Controller (ADC) space, and we have key partnerships with top cloud providers. We’ll give you the tools, learning opportunities, mentorship, and flexibility to achieve your goals. Come see why you belong at Citrix, with our culture supporting purposeful innovation and growth from within.
The Benefits
We offer a competitive total rewards package* that includes:
18 weeks of paid parental leave
Health and wellness benefits
Employee assistance program
Retirement benefits
Education assistance
Time off and absence programs
Professional development and mentorship opportunities
Paid volunteer time and charitable matching of employee donations
Employee resource groups
And more!
**Please note that benefits may vary based on location.
